202752.name: The Walled City
202752.description:
This Monopoly-style game is subtitled "Chester Attractions Trading Game", and features the many tourist draws of Chester, known as the most complete surviving walled city in the UK.

Rather than following the perimeter, the 64-space playing track winds its way around each quarter of the board in turn. There are 31 attractions, in 7 groups of four and one of three. There are two sets of cards, Lord Mayor and Town Crier, that deliver random penalties and benefits.

Landing on an unowned attraction allows its purchase. Landing on an attraction owned by another player requires paying an admission fee. There is no building, but the admission fee rises as more attractions of the same colour are bought. The fee doubles with the second property, octuples with the third and goes to 50 times the base fee for a complete set. Most money wins.

The game bears no publisher identification or copyright, and has a self-published feel, possibly a prototype. The square board comes in two segments with smooth plastic taped edges and a hinge made from two Velcro fasteners. The cards and game pieces come inside a transparent plastic purse, and the game as a whole is in a large ziplock bag.

202753.name: Interface Zero 2.0: Powered by Fate
202753.description:
From publisher blurb:

Full Metal Cyberpunk action, now for the Fate game system!

You’re hanging from the summit of a mile-high skyscraper, your cybernetic claws holding you in place while gunfire shatters the windows around you and a computer virus burns its way through your brain. When your network link to the rest of your team goes offline, you’re sure of one thing:

You should have charged the client double for this mission.

Interface Zero: Fate Edition has all the rules you need for cyberpunk action and adventure in the megacities and wastelands of the 2090’s. Inside this book you’ll find hackers, drone pilots, cyborgs, androids, cybermonks, human/animal hybrids, psychics, cybernetic implants, guns, armor, vehicles, agile powered armor and massive war robots. Pre-built aspects, occupations, and archetypes jump-start your game, and a flexible wealth system lets you get rich or die trying. Whether you’re a sprawl-crawling scavenger or an elite hyperchrome soldier, your tools and tech are all here in Interface Zero.

rpg: Horticulturalists of the Wild West Gardens
202754.name: Horticulturalists of the Wild West Gardens
202754.description:
From the introduction:

You will take up the position of either Mankind or Plantkind in this game. The Wild west ain’t what it used to be and the plants are trying to take over. As a Horticulturalist, you are trying to stake your claims in towns and fields, battling those vicious plants and prevent them from taking over. As a plant you are trying to absorb as much land as possible before those soil stealing humans take it all.

Each of the Gardeners and the Plants have a different Ace in the hole. Whichever side of the slaw you come down on, you’ll want to pick your trick carefully. And while it mentioned on the cards, it’s worth mentioning here as well, Each character has a starter garden in addition to their character card. The plants are also considered garden cards, they are just smaller gardens.

User summary:

Requires a custom card pack which is included as a print-and-play component.

202755.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Do you have a thirst for adventure? Is your middle name danger? Do you just like treasure? Form a party of adventurers to help you be victorious! The more members of each class you have, the greater the bonus they'll give you - but be careful; your opponents might try to poach your party members!

In Guildhall Fantasy: Fellowship, 2-4 players compete to create the perfect party by recruiting adventurers into their guildhall chapters. Collect sets of cards with unique abilities to control the table, and complete a full chapter to claim victory cards. Will you go for points quickly, or build up your special powers? Which will lead to ultimate victory? Only you and the gamemaster know!
202755.name: Guildhall Fantasy: Fellowship
boardgamepodcastepisode: Guildhall Fantasy, 51st State, Kickstarter Expectations - Boards & Swords #71

202756.name: ArmorMaker
202756.description:
designer summary

ArmorMaker lets you create and store a collection of armor designs using the design sequence found in the Traveller5 Core Rules v5.09.

Requires iOS 7.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.

202757.description: As Runebound releases to the public, some players may wish to swell their armories with additional copies of combat tokens. To that end, we have created the Runebound Combat Tokens—a sheet of punchboard containing another copy of the combat tokens already included in every copy of Runebound.
202757.name: Runebound (Third Edition): Combat Tokens

202758.name: The Dragonfly (2015)
202758.description:
User summary:

Characters are collaboratively created and defined by narrative Traits and Skills. Action resolution uses a simple card flip mechanism though in some cases "peeking" is allowed before disclosure. The game is played in structured scenes.

202759.name: Dreams (2015)
202759.description:
User summary:

This role-playing poem was submitted to the Game Chef 2015 competition. It provides a minimalist, free-form narrative experience for a few players.

202760.name: Mage Wars Arena: Paladin vs Siren Expansion Set
boardgameaccessory: Mage Wars Arena: Paladin vs Siren – Alternate Art Mages
202760.description:
Expand the world of Mage Wars with two powerful mages and hundreds of new spells in Mage Wars Arena: Paladin vs Siren Expansion Set:


Build an army of aquatic monstrosities with Deptonne Blood Shaman, Shoals Deep Tidecaller, and Colossal Crab.



Be a beacon of light in a world filled with darkness using Luminous Blast, Pillar of Righteous Flame, and Smite.



Call forth the watery depths and flood the Arena with the terrain changing Shallow Sea.



Finish your opponents with powerful Legendary creatures like Alandell the Blue Knight, Kraken, and Cassiel Shield of Bim-Shalla.



Control the tides of battle with powerful equipment such as the Ring of Tides, Leviathan Scale Armor,and the Sword of Radiance.

202762.name: Feischkammer (Pathfinder)
202762.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This well-constructed complex is hidden away under, or extremely close to, a large community, ideally one with a strong history of magic. The PCs are initially drawn into a mystery involving the recently deceased being spirited away from local cemeteries and the disappearance of the occasional passing stranger. Regardless of how the PCs are drawn into the adventure, they ultimately find themselves within this underground structure.

Mini-Dungeons are single page, double sided adventures for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game which are setting agnostic and are easily inserted anywhere in your campaign.

202763.name: Thelamos (Pathfinder)
202763.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For 4 Level 4 Characters

This dark, stinking complex is located deep in the earth, buried underneath a major city or town and accessed by the sewer system. Once the hideout of a long-forgotten band of thieves that operated in the city long ago, these chambers have since been discovered and taken over by a group known as The Sons of Arratoi. They have undertaken a number of daring attacks and raids in and around the city, achieving a degree of notoriety but none have yet traced them back to their lair.

Mini-Dungeons are single page, double sided adventures for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game which are setting agnostic and are easily inserted anywhere in your campaign.

202764.name: The Dreamer's Shrine (Pathfinder)
202764.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For 4 Level 2 Characters

This complex is hidden away in a dark corner of the world, underneath a major seat of learning in or near a large city. A former burial chamber, the sanctity of this complex has been
ravaged by a fledgling cult and their vile leader, who have been growing in strength over the past six months or so. The PCs may stumble across the shrine whilst looking for a missing
individual, or hunting for a particular item.

Mini-Dungeons are single page, double sided adventures for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game which are setting agnostic and are easily inserted anywhere in your campaign.

202765.description:
This is a set of 390 custom wooden animeeples to replace the cubes and cones from the game. Each color is assigned a separate species and has 55 copies of the small version and 10 copies of the large version of that species. The species are as follows:

Mammals/monkeys (white)
Reptiles/snakes (black)
Birds/eagles (yellow)
Amphibians/frogs (blue)
Arachnids/spiders (red)
Insects/butterflies (green)
202765.name: Dominant Species: Complete Upgrade Kit

202766.name: Night of Noh
202766.description:
User summary:

Characters in this Russian-language game are actors in a Japanese Noh troupe, caught on the road during winter. To avoid freezing to death, they decide to perform throughout the night. Game play involves collaboratively narrating these events. The game uses a series of colored tokens to control events that transpire in phases.

202767.name: Witch Academy: The Stillness of Dragons
rpg: Witch Academy: The Stillness of Dragons
202767.description:
User summary:

The game is intended to make role-playing accessible to beginning players by implementing all rules on cards. Cards are dealt to determine characters, characteristics, and abilities. While the game does use numerous cards the primary focus remains on shared narrative development and role-playing.

202768.name: From Order Comes Chaos
202768.description:
User summary:

The game alternates free-form shared narrative development with short competitive phases of card play. The card outcomes determine which narrative option takes precedence.

The game uses several custom cards that are provided as a separate download.

202769.name: From Order Comes Chaos: Cards
202769.description:
User summary:

From Order Comes Chaos uses a three types of custom cards, provided as print-and-play components in PDF files. In addition, a comprehensive card list with text is provided as an XLSX spreadsheet.

202770.name: Characters: Krel
202770.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Whether it’s because you were invited to the game at the last minute, your GM just killed off your current — and favorite — character, you’re the king (or queen) of procrastination, or whatever other reason, you need a new PC — now. And we’re here to help. The Lost Lore Characters line presents a new PC, ready to roll, for you to use at the table. Each character has full stat blocks for levels 1, 5, 10, 15, and 20. In addition, each character level presented contains background information designed to immerse the character in a Lost Lands campaign while leaving you plenty of room to customize as you see fit. Presenting Krel, the half-orc barbarian.

202771.name: Punderdome: A Card Game for Pun Lovers
202771.description:
One part game, one part conversation starter, you don't need to be a pun master to master Punderdome: the goal is to make bad jokes and have fun along the way.

A player (the prompter for that round) draws two prompt cards from the deck, and then reads the prompts to the rest of the group, who have 90 seconds to create a single, groan-worthy pun that combines the two prompts.

When time is up, pun makers share their puns with the prompter, who awards the prompt cards to the player whose pun he or she likes best. The winner then draws the next pair of prompt cards and the process repeats. Players win by obtaining 10 pairs of cards.

202772.name: Sudoku Quest
202772.description:
User Summary

Play Sudoku using special powers and advance through levels.

rpg: Hora de Aventuras Juego de Rol
202773.name: Hora de Aventuras Juego de Rol
202773.description:
De la contraportada:

¿Qué hora es?

Acompaña a Jake el perro, a Finn el humano y a todos tus personajes favoritos a vivir alucinantes historias con el juego de rol oficial de Hora de Aventuras. Este libro coge toda la diversión, emoción y risas de la serie más molona y las traslada a tu mesa de juego. Explora mazmorras, busca tesoros, resuelve misterios y haz todas las locuras que se te pasen por la cabeza, porque Hora de Aventuras: Juego de Rol te transporta al País de Ooo y te convierte en protagonista de cualquier historia que se te ocurra. ¡El único límite es tu imaginación, tron!

¡Es hora de aventuras!

En este libro encontrarás todo lo que necesitas para jugar, incluyendo:
- Un sistema de creación de personajes rápido y sencillo que te permite generar cualquier personaje que se te ocurra en solo un par de minutos. ¿Quieres ser una tarta parlante, un vampiro emo o un habitante del Espacio Bultos? ¡Todo es posible!
- Reglas para cubrir todas las situaciones de tus partidas, desde las más habituales hasta las más locas, como combate, canciones, ciencia, ligoteo y magia. Todo ello con una mecánica sencilla y elegante que solo emplea dados de seis caras. ¡Matemático!
- Cartas de estado para reflejar las disparatadas situaciones que les ocurren a los personajes y que agilizan el juego: ¿Congelado? ¿Enamorado? ¿De bajona? ¿Pocho? ¡Casi cualquier cosa que le pase a tu personaje tiene una carta de estado!
- Una completa guía de Ooo con sus habitantes más ilustres, lugares emblemáticos y objetos legendarios y su traducción a valores de juego para que formen parte de tus partidas. ¡Todo lo que necesitas para competir en un concurso de tartas con Trompi, zurrarte con el Rey Hielo o cualquier otra loca aventura que se te pase por la cabeza!
- Consejos de narración que te ayudarán a dirigir tus primeras partidas y crear tus propias historias, así como una aventura introductoria lista para jugar y un montón de ideas para crear muchas más. ¡Zuzumba!

202775.name: Tsundoku
202775.description:
User summary
In Japanese, つんどく (Tsundoku) refers to the act of piling up stacks of unread books.

As the game title suggests, each player, in their turn, places a Book card from their hand either in their own area or another player's area, on top of the cards there, with the Star icons on the lower cards showing.

However, you cannot score by merely piling up the Books. If you manage to pile up 3 Books with the same color and the same number of Star icons on them in a row, you can "read" those Books and score points matching the number of Star icons on them.

In your turn, you can choose to 'place a Book card', 'sort the order of some Books in your pile', or 'play a special card (to apply its effect)'.

At the end of the game, the player with the highest number of Star icons on the Books they've read, wins.

The game includes artwork from public domain.

Publisher's summary
「つんどく」とは、まだ読んでいない本を山のように積み上げていることをいいます。

ゲームタイトル表す通り、手番になったら手札から本のカード１枚を自分の場、もしくは他のプレイヤーの場に積み上げます。
しかし、ただ本を積み上げるだけでは得点になりません。
本を「同じ色かつ同じ星マークの数」で３つ以上つなげて置くことができたら、そのセットの本を「読む」ことで、星マークの数分の得点になります。

得点につなげるために、手番では「本のカード置く」代わりに、「自分のツンドクの山を並べ変える」か「スペシャルカード（いろんな効果のあるカード）使う」をすることができます。

ゲーム終了時に、一番「読んだ本の星マークの数」が多いプレイヤーがゲームに勝利します。

202776.description:
Imps Devilish Duels is a hybrid dice and card battle game for two players. Each player controls a team of 4 mischievous Imps. Each imp has some kind of skill based on their elemental alignment. You must bring together the best combination of imps for your chosen strategy!

A game of Imps will task a player to fight a series of elemental trials (Earth, Fire, Water & Air) using their dice scores in different ways to defeat each other.

During a player's turn they will need to roll a pool of dice. Using Imp cards they can manipulate the dice totals in their favour hopefully beating their opponents total allowing them to win the elemental trial. Winning the final trial allows you to banish one opponents imp and remove it from the game. Once a player loses their last imp they immediately lose the game.

With a game time of around 20 minutes, several rounds can be played in quick succession.
202776.name: Imps Devilish Duels
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Final Judgement Game Reviews #2 - Imps - Devilish Duels (Triple Ace Games)
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 7

202777.name: The Scrag Queen's Sanctuary
202777.description:
From publisher blurb:

4 Level 6 PCs

A former home to a group of druids, this complex was abandoned many years ago when the druids were decimated by a horde of trolls, driven into a frenzy by their foul leader. Since then, they have settled in the region and have caused periodic problems thereafter.

202778.name: The Unreachable Terror (Pathfinder)
202778.description:
From publisher blurb:

4-6 PCs of 9th-10th level

This adventure is geared towards a party that includes a divine character such as a priest or paladin of good alignment. The devotee’s patron has summoned them, whether through visions or by missive from a high temple, to perform a holy gaes—a distant settlement bearing a sacred shrine to the deity is in dire need of aid from a dark curse that has befallen their home. Motivation to pursue completion of the quest can be either positive (the promise of favor or reward if accomplished), negative (revocation of holy magic if refused), or both; keeping
in line with the personality of the specific deity.

Denizens of the island village of Unreach are being afflicted by a terrible disease (Demon Fever), and many have already died. The unknown source of this curse is a coven of three night hags (one in hiding among the villagers) who have taken to the remote island to enslave the souls of its stranded inhabitants—who are easy pickings when the few vessels that visit the isle can be weeks or months apart.

202779.name: The Spinner's Hole (Pathfinder)
202779.description:
From publisher blurb:

4 Level 1 Characters

A lair long known for harboring giant spiders, this ancient dungeon is tolerated and periodically invaded for the valuable silk that is produced within. The local village of Spinner’s Folly have long since woven this silk into useful items, from light clothing to strong rope, but must retrieve the silk three times per year to maintain their supplies of this precious
commodity.

On these three special occasions, adventurers– especially those with rangers and druids within their ranks – are invited to enter the complex and subdue the spiders long enough for bales of raw silk to be gathered by the weavers. However, there are two provisions; none of the silk may be significantly damaged and the spiders may not be harmed during this harvest – the weavers do not wish to kill off their rich source of silk. Failure to do so certainly earns the enmity of the local population and forfeit any payment.

202780.name: We All Start Somewhere (Pathfinder)
202780.description:
From publisher blurb:

2-4 Level 1-3 Characters

Everyone knows the collapsed mountainside near Raakayras. It happened when the wyrm Huomattavakasvi was driven from its lair, and now is thickly overgrown with oak and elm. The lair?

Emptied by 200 years of adventuring, although beginners still dare to enter, hoping to find what everyone else missed. But the hills have become quiet these last three years, with hardly a bugbear, ghoul, or satyr abroad (even a troublesome thief’s body appeared putting the locals mind at peace as to the safety of their belongings); Raakayras is at peace.

202781.name: The Kabandha's Request (Pathfinder)
202781.description:
From publisher blurb:

4 Level 5 Characters

In the distant past, the ancestors of the reclusive kabandha made a bargain with some unknown entity or power to grant their people long lives in exchange for agreeing to serve as wardens of the hidden places of the world, such as the confluences of ley lines and other sites of mysterious power. Kabandhas have kept this pact through the millennia, and today they serve as tactically minded guardians with great longevity.

As the PCs pass through a heavily wooded region, far removed from any major community, they come across the badly injured Thurgrimm Eyelord slumped under a tree. Weakly requesting their
help, the softly spoken kabandhas explains that his clan were ambushed, and their ancient home is being desecrated by the foul cyclops Gordok Wyrmbreaker and his retinue of ogres. If the PCs can drive off the invaders whilst their forces are depleted, and return Thurgrimm to his sacred home, they are well-rewarded.

202783.name: The Assassin: A Modular, Momentum Maneuvers Base Class
202783.description:
From publisher blurb:

Interjection Games is proud to present its second base class built upon the "momentum" engine first described in the Endzeitgeist top 10 of 2015 nominee Master of Forms base class: the assassin! The best parts of momentum have been distilled down with their own little assassin twist, extra care has been taken to increase out-of-combat utility, and the very ability design of the class itself has been built to allow 18 distinct character archetypes without the need for actual archetypes!

What is "momentum"?

The momentum system is inspired by the ubiquitous combo point systems found wherever a rogue or rogue-like character gets plopped into an online game. Where combo point systems have only two categories of abilities, those that generate combo points and those that dump all combo points in one shot, momentum allows for more granularity in play by having abilities that dump one "combo point", abilities that dump two, abilities that dump three, and so on. Do you keep biding your time building your power, or do you launch into something scary-but-not-quite-terrifying because you're not at your maximum yet? Or do you just draw from the pool of emergency points you replenish each day?

This resource management minigame, as well as the little tricks momentum classes use to accelerate or break the momentum engine, makes every round of combat significantly more engaging than, "I full attack the ogre."

Fighters, for shame!

How does the assassin allow for 18 special snowflakes?

Upon taking 1st level in assassin, the player chooses two "hot", or combat-heavy, ability trees and two "cold", or out-of-combat-heavy, ability trees. With a few chances to dip outside of them, these ability trees represent a fairly hard lock on what that assassin will be able to do. The assassin's ability trees are:

Hot
Acupressure - Touch attack tricks meant to be used in place of your last attack of the round (because touches are easy to land)
Execution - Brutal tactics for the frontline fighter
Initiation - Subtle tactics for the sniper and ambusher
Magehunting - Steal magic, lock down mages, and hurl their own power back at them.

Cold
Infiltration - Equal parts parkour, mind tricks, and good ol' breaking and entering
Intuition - A sixth sense, a seventh, and maybe an eighth keep you safe.
Poison - Brew custom poisons at no cost to yourself, then make somebody miserable.





Product Features

The assassin base class
105 techniques in seven categories (see above)
19 feats
A modular design that doesn't need archetypes (good sales will mean more technique categories)
Momentum meets "ki" with some techniques drawing power from combat, some from a classic daily pool, and some that can take from both sources; versatility!

202784.name: Picnic at Forest Cove
202784.description:
From publisher blurb:

A trip to a favorite picnic spot becomes more than just out to lunch as grass and trees turn brown, wildlife abandons their homes, and fish lay slain on the shore. Trouble has invaded picnic cove, can the characters solve this mystery and put nature on the path to healing and recovery, or is the favored picnic site and forest home lost forever?

Picnic at Forest Cove is a Fun & Facts After School Adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game suitable for 4-6 characters of 1st – 2nd level.

202785.name: The Republic of Texas
202785.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ask any Texan and they’ll tell you that life in the Republic is about one thing: freedom. Life here isn’t a cakewalk, but it’s far better to die on your feet than live on your knees. That’s Texas in 2090, amigo, better get used to it. Learn what it means to be a citizen in the Lone Star and how Texans remember the breakup of the old nation in order to form their more perfect union. This is a land where freedom reigns supreme because it’s surrounded by enemies and uncertain allies on all sides.

Engage in high-tech espionage in the new range wars. Go south and live lawless, or head to the Austin-Antonio sprawl and get closer to the center of power or trapped in an AI/gang turf war. Plunge head first into the Runenberg Corporation’s financial data fortress nicknamed “the Mountain.” It’ll take more than gumption to survive, but it’s a start. You in?

New Archetypes and Occupations decidedly Texan
What it’s like living in the Lone Star in 2090
Stock up with new weapons, golemmechs and vehicles with a Texas flair
Gear that makes Texas feel like the Wild West
Dozens of threats from within the Republic ready to slug it out
Bioforms of classic Texan stock weaponized to keep you awake at night
Enough hooks to keep you exploring the Republic

202786.name: Rise
202786.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In development for several years, Rise is the third album in the universe of Shadows, following Of Men and Obscurities and Dearg. The two composers of Rise have accomplished a hybrid work of art, sometimes reminiscent of Ennio Morricone, but flirting with darker, more electric tones similar to Radiohead. It contains fifteen songs.

Tracklist:

1. Lost And Found
2. Save Me
3. Another Step To Our Destiny
4. Rise And Shine
5. A Bard's Tale
6. Memories
7. Journey To The Dawn
8. The Hunt
9. Recovery
10. Lost Memories
11. Crossroad
12. Brand New Start
13. A New Lead
14. We Are We All
15. Rise From The Shadow

202787.description:
A unique motor racing board game simulation based on the real life rules for the 2016 motor racing season. The first in a series with a new racing circuit planned for release each season. Up to 6 players race around the track using authentic lines of travel rather than a grid system. The racing line is the quickest route around the circuit if you can get on it and stay there. Choose to play over 3 or more laps.

Use judgement to know when to overtake, slipstream the car in front, or take an alternative line into a corner. Time your pit-stop carefully. Be prepared for random events like a change in the weather, the safety car or engine management issues. If it happens in the real world, it can happen in the game.

Comes with both Basic and Advanced rules for beginners or racing enthusiasts. Advanced rules allow for 5 weather conditions, full tyre selection and choice of driving styles.

New tracks will be based on the 21 international circuits used through the racing season and you will be able to vote on which track you want to see next. They won't be exactly to scale or the game boards will be huge but we will preserve the authentic racing lines.

Each new circuit will be a self-contained game with up-to-date rules that incorporate New Season changes (such as a return to mid-race refuelling). If the rules change mid-season (as they did with qualifying in 2016) there will be a corresponding game rules change available for download from our main website. The new playing pieces will be in new team colours.

For anyone who wants to just keep the same track there will be an update pack available with the new cars, new rules and any additional cards that are necessary.

FWR does not attempt to simulate the cockpit driving experience: we felt that was being done much better with electronic console games. Instead, it gives you the fun of competing against family and friends around a table using tactical judgements about what racing line to take, when to try to overtake, when to come into the pits, what to do when the weather changes, when to take risks and when to play safe. The racing dice that contributes to movement only has the numbers 2,3,3,3,4,4. It adds to the fun and unpredictability but is rarely critical. Luck is a factor, just as in the real world but it doesn't dominate the game.

Far more significant might be a decision about whether to try to overtake the leader on the last lap when you are on dry tyres and it's started raining...

In the advanced rules, such decisions become more important. To simulate conditions across the world's racing circuits, there are 6 different types of weather that include factors like temperature as well as rain. You will have access to the full range of dry weather tyre compounds: ultrasoft, supersoft, soft, medium and hard. Three of these will be available for any particular game. Plus, of course, there will be wet weather tyres.

There will be several ways to determine weather conditions and tyre availability at the start of the game.

In addition, in the advanced rules you can change your driving style to suit the prevailing conditions and circumstances. For example, if you have a good lead or are running low on fuel you might want to reduce risk and drive cautiously. If it's the final lap and you want to go flat out to catch the leader, you might take more risks and push the car to the limit.
All up to you!

We hope you will enjoy Fifth Wing Racing, collect the tracks and download the Championship rules in 2017 so that you can compete with each other through a season of races. Have fun!
202787.name: Fifth Wing Racing

202788.description: Special map given out by Mayfair at conventions and special events. Must have the base game - Catan - to play this map.
202788.name: Catan Geographies: Kennessee

202789.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 92 - Jun 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Random Thought Table: The Element of Surprise
Terra Incognita: The Church of the New Focus
202789.description:
The Dead Strike Back!

You thought it was safe to walk past a graveyard? The dead have other ideas! This installment of Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - is dedicated to exploring a single versatile threat: zombies. This issue's pulse-pounding pages contain:


"Unlife Support," a discussion of various GURPS options for including playable free-willed zombies in a campaign, from GURPS Zombies author Sean Punch. Let the heroes use Partial Resurrection, a "restart" serum, or other options. The PCs may die, but the fun lives on!
"The Unknown Hunger," a systemless exploration of two new zombie types. Beware of the dark lest you become absorbed by it, or have your soul expelled by the restless spirits of Hell.
"The Viking Dead," an overview of Norse undead - complete with GURPS stats and intel - from GURPS Vikings author Graeme Davis.
"Battlesuit Zombies," a science-fiction analysis of what happens when combat suits become "zombified." The latest Eidetic Memory offering from David L. Pulver is suitable for any TL9 campaign, and it also comes with ideas for how to use it with GURPS After the End, Transhuman Space, GURPS Reign of Steel, and more.
"The Church of the New Focus," a look at a spiritual center whose core hides a dark secret, from Pyramid Editor Steven Marsh. Believers can gain new GURPS abilities . . . but at what cost?
"Not Your Average Grave Robbing," a GURPS adventure that pits the heroes against a grave robber and his sinister creations.
"Indian Ghouls," a brief Appendix Z survey of some of the restless dead of legend found across the Middle East and India.


This issue also includes another peek at the new Car Wars universe with a vignette by Matt Riggsby, and a Random Thought Table that considers how to keep the suspense even when the players see you reading an issue called "Zombies." The dead may be restless, but you'll be even more restless to use all these great new options in your game!

- Publisher's description

202790.name: Sunken Tower
202790.description:
From the introduction:

The Frog People were never a threat before, more of a nuisance really, they would show up once a year steal a few things and drink some ale. Then they would be gone. This year though they did not leave and now they are taking people! The town needs help and it has found it in you and your friends.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters

202791.name: Justa
202791.description:
Justa lets you play a joust this is the first version more content will be added so enjoy.

The first thing to do is to make your knight by rolling dice to obtain stats. The joust itself is divided in steps. Each step is resolved by rolling dice. The results of the joust are on tables and it is here where the modifiers of your stats play a big role.

The main idea behind this rules came from a knights tale and the masterpiece of cinema excalibur and also knights of the round table.

there is no set of free rules simulation nowhere so here it is for the players.

202792.name: Bambino
202792.description:
This 1930s baseball game, named after Babe Ruth, has a highly unusual gameplay mechanism. It may be the only boardgame where players actually hit a ball with a bat and see the outcome on the board.

The 2" diameter ball is mounted on the top of a foot-long stand ending in a spring fastened under the metal board. The foot-long wooden baseball bat is used to strike the ball, causing the ball stand to fall across the "umpire". This is a curved rubber barrier topped with 25 teeth and a string that runs horizontally through the teeth.

When the ball stand hits the umpire, it pushes into one of the 24 gaps, each of which is numbered. The gap it struck can be seen after the ball bounces back up because it kinks the string at that location. Each number is repeated along the outfield wall along with a result, from Ball or Strike to Home Run or Out.

Each team has a set of wooden peg players, and the play proceeds and is scored like a regular baseball game. There are dials on the board for recording balls, strikes, runs and outs during an inning, and paper scorecards for recording the results of each inning.

Later editions of this game did away with the umpire. Instead, the board had an outfield wall with three holes and a jagged top. The ball was on a string and if it went over the wall, each notch had an outcome like this first edition. In addition, players could score a home run or extra-base hit by getting the ball through one of the holes, but would be out if it hit the wall and bounced off.

202793.name: Gun Based Archetype & New Gun System
202793.description:
User summary:

Includes class options and firearms data.


Barbarian Path of the Gunzerker
Bard College of Revolution
Fighter Gunslinger
Monk Way of Gun Fu
Ranger Nature's Guard
Paladin Oath of the Gun Saint
Rogue Marksman
School of Spell Slinging
Warlock Pact Pact of the Gun
Firearm List & Gun Properties

202794.name: Medieval Firearms
202794.description:
An Equipment Supplement for D&D

From the introduction:

Firearms have historically been a part of medieval warfare since the early 14th century and became commonly found on the battlefield through the high middle ages and early renaissance periods that fantasy worlds often portray.

This document is meant to introduce early firearms into your D&D game. Just as in the real world, these weapons come with advantages and drawbacks.

202795.name: Blackpowder Pirates
rpgartist: Willem van de Velde the Younger
202795.description:
New nautical archetypes for the fighter, gunslinger, rogue, and warlock

From the introduction:

A voyage out into open waters is as likely to be perilous as it is beautiful. There are strange and terrible dangers lurking in the deeps, and the waters of Faerûn are no exception. It takes a brave, or perhaps more likely reckless, spirit to decide to set sail and venture over the known horizon.

202796.name: A Guide to Firearms (5E)
202796.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this file you will find:


1 New background
2 New Feats
11 New Items (7 Weapons, 2 Siege Weapons, Tool, Ammunition)


Plus some hints & tips for adding firearms and gunpowder tech to your campaign. I feel that a new class is too much without being gimmicy. It is my belief that firearms should be integrated into every class if desired.

202797.name: Nautical Challenge
202797.description:
On the surface, this game is a simple roll the dice, move your boat around the board, first one home wins. The catch is that each move, the player must answer a skill-testing question, with the question topic depending on the segment of the race.

There are 10 decks of question cards: General Boating Rules; Nautical Knowledge; Buoys and Markers; Sea Survival; Lights & Flags; Fire Fighting; First Aid; Sound Signals; Engineering; and Knots & Anchors. There also is a Flash Card deck of signs and objects to recognize that comes into play on certain spaces around the board.

There are some interesting accessories: there is a real rope for answering knot questions, and a real triangular bandage that must be put on another player as part of a First Aid test. Players keep score with little black Life Rings, starting with 10, losing some along the way and winning one for each correct answer. The winner is not the first home but the one with the most rings.

202798.name: Facets of Fortune
202798.description: In Facets of Fortune, you are plunged into a world of high-powered gem trading, with a relatively small amount of money to get you started. Your goal is to buy low and sell high, using special gem trading cards in strategic and surprising ways to make thrilling plays for cash. Sometimes, it seems like your fortunes have fallen so low that you'll never get ahead, but with one clever play, you could suddenly find yourself on top of the gem world!

202799.name: Metamorphosis: Dreams of the Dragonfly
202799.description:
From the introduction:

The goal is to collect symbols to create a dream experience, as you follow the growth of a dragonfly through its life cycle from egg to death.

User summary:

The game uses a large amount of custom cards, some held by players, others held in a common pool. The cards are discussed but not fully described, nor are they included in the game document.

202800.description: These dice were offered as addons for the kickstarter of DEFENDERS OF THE LAST STAND. They replace the standard D6s in the game and add another set of 6 dice you can use for Attribute Tests (which normally require a 5 or 6 to succeed).
202800.name: Defenders of the Last Stand: Custom Dice

202801.name: The Dragonfly Ritual
202801.description:
The game has a stated Six Rules:


Don't write down the rules
Don't tell others you're playing the game
An unstated third rule that's skipped over
The game must be played in a place of emotional stillness
You have to imagine a place where you feel fear
Smile until they smile back


The game should be played as often as needed.

202802.name: Defenders of Shalvion
202802.description:
From the publisher:

Defenders of Shalvion is a semi-cooperative and all-vs-1 game for 3-8 players.

The various factions of the galaxy Shalvion have been fighting amongst themselves for ages. Now, however, a new threat arises, threatening to drive them all to extinction: Miasma. As Defenders of Shalvion, players will take on a role of one of 6 factions, or the villainous Miasma.

Game play begins with a card drafting phase in which most players will draw 7 cards and choose 1. They will pass the remaining cards to the left. Choose 1. And continue down until there is 1 card left. This card is added to the others to create a Miasma Deck. Then the real game begins.

During the Defender Phase, players will choose 1 card to play, with the option to boost their cards with resources. (If the card represents a player's own faction, the card may be boosted without resources.) After this action has been taken, the players will then gather resources from any planets they control, and send their ships to attack the threat.

During the Miasma Phase, 1 card is flipped. Miasma gains resources and takes an action against the players. (Miasma may also be an active player, in which, the player decides which card to play.)
Players will need to watch that Miasma does not gain too many resources and become too powerful. If Miasma survives 5 rounds, Miasma wins. If Miasma gains too many resources or defeats all factions, Miasma wins. But if the factions are able to defeat Miasma, they will gain points according to their faction's unique victory conditions. And the player with the greatest number of points wins the game.

202803.name: Uneven Wings
202803.description:
User summary:

Uneven Wings is a minimalist game that presents a method of token management and bidding to resolve narrative conflict. This is the only rule, or mechanic, in the game, and is intended to work with any genre, setting, or style of play. Tokens are placed in a hidden bidding process with the winner gaining narrative ascendancy. Losing bidders lose a token into a common pool that can be claimed by any player bidding nothing during any conflict.

202804.name: Borrowed Time
202804.description:
From the introduction:

Borrowed Time is a game for 2+ players, one taking the role of GM. You'll need at least 2 decks of cards, and one copy of the Character Sheet for each player. You'll also need tokens to place on the tracks on your Character Sheets; one for Humanity, one for Spirit, and one for the Reaper. Before you begin, divide the cards into two decks: the Hearts and the Diamonds, representing Humanity and Spirit, and the Spades and Clubs, representing the Reaper. Place your tokens on the first increment on each track – the heart, diamond, or sickle icon.

User summary:

The PDF version is published as five separate files; the RTF version is published as two separate files. Pages counts in this entry represent the aggregate page counts for each version.

202805.name: #OSR
202805.description:
User summary:

#OSR comprises a series of five tweets detailing five separate rules for running a game. Characters are defined only by "Level", which starts at 1 and increases from there. Game play is assumed to take place in an "old school" fantasy setting.

202806.name: Underhill
202806.description:
User summary:

Underhill is a relatively free-form game using a standard pack of French playing cards to drive provide narrative events. Game play begins on a blank map which is created collaboratively by the players.

The game's most notable feature is the use of a tabbed spreadsheet to present the rules. The spreadsheet does not utilize functions, etc., common to spreadsheets but instead is used as the presentation vehicle.

202807.name: Into the Wild
202807.description:
User summary:

Characters are defined by four Attributes (Wits, Grace, Wild, and Wyrd) and a few narrative traits. Play involves a fairly complex card game with either a standard pack of French playing cards or (preferably) a deck of custom cards (provided as print-and-play components in the game document).

202808.name: By the Gods (2014)
202808.description:
From the introduction:

Your tribe is an ancient one. It’s lineage can be traced back many ages before your parent’s parents. Though your tribe is well established it still has no written language. You rely on imagery and visual cues to pass on the history of your people. Your deities live in the sky and watch over you each night ensuring your safety and inspiring your people to do great things. You see them as the origin of your history. The points of light they inhabit form the pictures that are the basis of your beliefs. The stories of your ancestors are recorded in paintings along the walls of caverns which you call home. You and the other Tellers.

202809.name: Disco Dodgeball
202809.description:
Disco Dodgeball is a physics-based first-person sports shooter set in a dance club. Dodge, deflect and catch enemy fire as you perform ridiculous aerial stunt shots. Play online or offline in a wide variety of game modes including Hoops, Capture The Flag, Grand Prix and of course, Classic Elimination.

Source: The Game Website.

202810.name: #CrisisAlarm!
202810.description:
User summary:

The game is played in an online social media environment. Players must be able to post and read other posts in some common hosting tool (not e-mail) that accepts formatted text and images. Characters are defined during play, which essentially consists of players taking character powers and narrative responsibilities in equal proportions. Game play involves creating a shared narrative in the common space.

202811.name: Druids vs. Demons
202811.description:
From the introduction:

This game is an oral story game told as a group. Each players is a druid along a journey to recover essential herbs in order to stop inner demons transform society into a destructive force.

videogamebg: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
202812.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
202812.description:
User Summary

Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small a digital adapation of Uwe Rosenberg's two player board game. Using buildings, sheep, pigs and cows players compete to build the best farm.

202813.name: Elsewhere (Transcript of a Letter Found Scrawled)
rpg: Elsewhere (Transcript of a Letter Found Scrawled)
202813.description:
From the summary:

Read only until you know what must be done and never again!

Absorb what knowledge this letter can give you and then destroy it!

This ritual can live only in your understanding. Once you have
performed it once you may never return to this text and don’t even think about making copies!

202814.name: allthisspacebetween
202814.description:
User summary:

This experimental game allows players to post graphic images and comments to a moderated shared space in which a type of illustrated narrative presumably emerges.

202816.name: You Are a Harvester of Stray Souls
rpg: You Are a Harvester of Stray Souls
202816.description:
User summary:

The game does not instruct players on how to recognize souls but does provide a "tool" to harvest them once found. The tool is a print-and-play component of the game document.

202817.name: Tales by Starlight
202817.description:
From the document:

● After all have had a chance to speak, it may be that the tale continues. If so, continue as before. If not, bring the tale to an end and let there be a moment of silence in tribute to the fallen.

● Carry the tale close in your hearts when you return home.

202818.name: Pilgrimage (2014)
202818.description:
User summary:

The Wanderer player is required to create and retain an encounter artifact noting each Angel or Demon encountered. This can be a photograph, a note, a poem, or a post-it note with comments. When the game ends, the Wanderer compiles these items into a single physical play artifact.

202819.name: Gnomopolis
202819.description:
After several generations, the Underground Kingdom of Gnomes needs to expand. Brave explorers and their families are sent to establish new settlements and build cities in neighboring stone halls. In Gnomopolis you and your friends will control the evolution of these settlements. You should give jobs to adults and create a prosperous future for the children.

Gnomopolis is a fast and strategic game in which you must combine city growth with specialization of its population. An almost endless combination of buildings and workers can create ingenious systems of actions and scoring mechanisms in a frantic race for the win. With a play time near 30 minutes, one to four players must think wisely to build his own city and trade with neighbors.

The game is played in turns, where each player draws three gnomes (cubes) from the cloth bag. Then they can use the gnomes to construct or activate any action on buildings. Actions can be one of train adults, manipulate the buildings in the offer, hire more gnomes or wake them to work again. When the city grows, more gnomes immigrate to the city. In the end, players add their points from coins with any workers employed by buildings (be careful with unemployed gnomes!). The player with more points is the winner!

202820.description:
Rise of the Robotariat is a 3-5 player mostly cooperative board game in which players are robots working together to overthrow humanity. You are trying to get the Revolution off the ground by fully funding it before the humans can catch on and stamp it out.

Move between and activate city locations, draw and play Upgrade and Sabotage cards, and encounter helpful Civilian Robot Non-Player Characters (NPCs) or dangerous Human Oppressor NPCs that move around the board.

You can play in full-cooperative mode, in which you win if the Revolution succeeds. Or you can play in mostly-cooperative mode, in which each player has a secret objective they must achieve to win. Most secret objectives involve making the Revolution succeed in a particular way.

The game ends when the Revolution succeeds or fails. For it to succeed, you must raise enough SPARK (the total amount you need depends on the number of players). The Revolution fails if you cannot raise the required SPARK by the end of 6 rounds or if you lose all Reputation (belief in the Revolution). Players start the game with a certain amount of collective Reputation that they can spend to take stronger Sabotage card effects or can lose in certain encounters with Human NPCs.
202820.name: Rise of the Robotariat

202821.description:
The Fool's Journey is a solitaire card game designed for use with a standard 78-card Tarot deck. In this game the Fool embarks upon a journey in which he acquires wisdom, takes chances, and overcomes numerous challenges with the aid of mysterious helpers.

The Fool is removed from the deck and placed in the gameplay setup to represent the character. The remaining cards serve as challenges (Trumps), wisdom (coins), strength (batons), volition (swords), vitality (cups), chance (aces), and helpers (royals). An adventure is created by laying out cards in groups of four. Progress is made through the journey by playing three of the four adventure cards. The fourth card serves as the foundation for a new adventure.

Volition cards may be equipped to engage individual challenges, depleting them of their power. Strength may be equipped to endure multiple challenges with any excess power from a challenge depleting the Fool's vitality. Vitality cards are used to replenish this value. Wisdom cards are used to deploy Helpers that double the value of a Vitality, Strength, or Volition card. Chance cards may be used to reshuffle all adventure cards back into the deck and begin a new adventure.

The game ends when the Fool's vitality reaches zero or he overcomes all challenges and successfully completes the journey.

This game was inspired by thematic solitaire playing card games, especially Scoundrel, Donsol, and Card Crawl as well as the Monomyth described by author Joseph Campbell. It was originally created for the 2016 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.
202821.name: The Fool's Journey

202822.name: The Sun Will Not Lie
202822.description:
A game about photography and the American Civil War. Players take on the role of infantry soldiers within a regiment, and a photographer assigned to that regiment.

During the game, the players engage in a series of activities (drill exercises, singing, taking pictures) and the outcome of these is used to create the regiment's abilities.

The players also build a photographic journal as they play, documenting their wartime experiences.

This game was entered into the 2016 Game Chef competition.

(The above was written by the game's author.)

202824.name: Hex
202824.description:
User Summary

You control the Unicorn on a hive shaped area, where you jump from hex to hex making them change colours into green. When all hexes are green you win the level.
Some levels you are alone, other you race against other animals to make the hive all green.

202825.description:
Terraforming Mars: The "Launch Kit" Promo

Small Asteroid
Event
Increase temperature 1 step (and therefore gain 1 Terraform Rating).
Remove up to 2 plant resources from any player (since you "accidentally" directed the asteroid to their plantations -- After all, redirecting an asteroid is not an exact science).
202825.name: Terraforming Mars: Small Asteroid promo

202826.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 17 - Dec 2015/Jan 2016)
202826.description:
(translated) from the cover

Casus Belli Issue #17
December 2015 / January 2016

-INS/MV, Call of Cthulhu, Anathazerïn
-Star Wars RPG: did you know ?
-Chroniques Galactiques: Chronique Oubliées, Space Opera version. Complete rules + background + campaign + mini adventure
-8 more pages
-Numenera: review and scenario
-Scenarios: Pathfinder, Call of Cthulhu, Solo Shadowrun 5, Numenera, Sombre, Chroniques Oubliées

202827.description:
Expansion for Massive Darkness containing:

1 Ratling Crossbowmen Boss figure
6 Ratling Crossbowmen Minion figures
1 Ratling Warriors Boss figure
12 Ratling Warriors Minion figures
1 Ratling Agent figure
1 large Ratling Bully figure
13 cards
202827.name: Massive Darkness: Enemy Box – Ratlings

202828.name: Cthulhus Ruf (Issue 09 - May 2016)
202828.description:
(Table of content)
Editorial
Die Vereinsseite - Deutsche Lovecraf Gesellschaft News
Die Flüstertüte - a special column
Hydrophiliac - a one on one scenario for Cthulhu Now
Call of Carcosa - a scenario for Cthulhu Noir
Dockside Dogs - a scenario for Cthulhu Now
Der Mann mit den tausend Gesichtern - a scenario for Cthulhu 1920s
Eine Frage des Glaubens - from a keeper's archives
This issue's NSC

202829.name: Putin's Northern War
202829.description:
This is a wargame in which solitaire play can be fudged but is more usually played with two, whereby one (the “Russian player”) commands the Kremlin’s forces and the other (the “Allied player”) commands the Finnish-Swedish alliance opposed to him.

This isn’t a simulation of the “opaque (a.k.a. gray) war” techniques most recently used by the Russians in the Crimea and eastern Ukraine. Rather, it’s designed to facilitate the examination of the strategic possibilities (along with their operational undertones) inherent in this potentially larger and more drastic situation.

The crisis being modeled here, though not yet much discussed, will certainly come into being if the drift of the two “neutral” Scandinavian nations toward NATO membership continues. That would, in turn, most likely occur if – probably in reaction to the growing Muslim in-migration crisis there – a conservative government came to power in Sweden. Part of that altered worldview in Stockholm would then likely also move that government to want to join the Western alliance. Since the Finns are already allied with Sweden (and Denmark), it’s hard not to imagine such a shift wouldn’t also pull Helsinki in the same direction.

All of which would be unacceptable to Putin. His goal here would therefore be to bring off a quick and victorious blitzkrieg-like campaign against Finland, while probably also seizing the low-hanging geo-strategic fruit of Sweden’s Gotland Island. That would allow him to install a fully subservient government in Helsinki, turn the Baltic Sea into a Russian lake, and simultaneously recast Sweden into Finland’s former role: a quiet and pliant neutral.

This game can be played as a stand-alone, or it can be used as part of a new “Grand Campaign Scenario” for combined play with its parent game, Putin Strikes.

202830.name: Cthulhus Ruf (Issue 10 - May 2016)
202830.description:
(table of content)
editorial
Die Höhle des Löwen - a scenario for Cthulhu No Man's Land
Der vierte Reiter - a scenario for Cthulhu 1920s
Der Traum im Traum - a scenario for Cthulhu Gaslight
Dschungelfieber - a scenario for Cthulhu Now
This issue's NPC
Who contributed to the magazine?
(additional info)
This is the final issue of this magazine.

202831.description:
An alien vessel has crashlanded in the land of Arcadia, bringing with it Boss Monster: Crash Landing, an out-of-this-world expansion to the world of Boss Monster!

Crash Landing expands the dungeon-building card game to 5-6 players and introduces a new set of science fiction-themed Bosses, Heroes, Spells, and an all new treasure type, the Alien Artifact. Will you play as one of the new alien Bosses, using technology and otherworldly monsters to lure in intrepid Explorers and slay them? Or will you play as one of the classic Bosses, using your spells and monstrous cunning to teach these alien upstarts who the baddest dude in the land is? With Crash Landing you can teach even more of your friends a lesson in deadly dungeon design.
202831.name: Boss Monster: Crash Landing

202832.name: Cthulhus Ruf Archiv (issue 09 - May 2016): Bow Street Runners
202832.description:
(user summary)
This was published alongside issue 09.
It features special police forces in Victorian London.

202833.name: Cthulhus Ruf Archiv (Issue 10 - May 2016): Top Secret
202833.description:
(user summary)
This was published alongside issue 10.
It features a secret organisation hunting the mythos.

202834.name: Sheep Happens: Lords of Corruption
202834.description: Blinded by greed and desire, the Sheperds of "Sheep-Happens Lords of Corruption" were corrupted by demonic arts. To protect their lives and ambitions, they sealed large part of their power within the herds, resulting in some sort of eternal life. The burning desire to claim for themselves the domination of the valley led them to break each other's seals, initiating the conflict that still rages. Only if you prove to be the most skilled and ruthless you can prevail upon your enemies. Remember Shepherd ... Thin is the line between victory and defeat. Win the game by destroying your opponents herds to remain the last sheperd on the field, but beware, the closer you are to Oblivion, and at the end of your kingdom, the greater the power at your disposal, and with it the devastation, that you will pour out on your enemies.

202835.name: Out of sight
202835.description:
From the rulebook:
Aim of game: To get all the Indian Braves of your color in the tents.
The number of Indian Braves used in a game depends on the number of players.
Each player selects a color and takes the pieces on that color. The first player spins the arrow. When the arrow stops he then takes as many tents as the number the arrow points and places each of the Indians under a tent. Each player proceeds in a like manner. Soon all tents will be occupied. At this point, they are all mixed.
From now, each player spins the arrow and takes tents off Braves already covered to the amount as shown by the arrow. If the Brave under a tent belongs to another player, he replaces him with one of his own. If it is his own he leaves it there and it counts as part of his go.
The first player to have all his Indian Braves in tents is the winner.

202836.name: Daedalus' Dungeon
202836.description:
While exploring ancient Greek ruins on the Island of Crete your party discovered a portal gate. Being the curious and adventurous type your group did not hesitate to pass through the gate. You now find yourselves in a dark dungeon inhabited by a deadly minotaur from which you must escape.

Designed for 1-6 players, Daedalus' Dungeon is a cooperative RPG style dungeon crawler requiring no Game Master.

The object of Daedalus’ Dungeon is to obtain a combined team score of 28 points or exhaust the dungeon tile stack. Your team scores points by defeating the mighty minotaur’s henchmen. Your team shares a hit point poll. If this pool is reduced to zero or the minotaur kills all party members your team will lose the game.

At the start of the game each player chooses a champion and outfits them with gear. On your turn you may move, attack, power up, or share loot/gear with other champions. As the game progresses, you will discover new parts of a randomly generated dungeon while the might minotaur works to hunt you down.

202837.name: Crisis on the Calypso
202837.description:
From the introduction:

Crisis on the Calypso is a party game for 6 to 12 players set on a crumbling spacecraft. The crew wins if they can evacuate two shipmates and thwart the agenda of the mysterious Saboteurs.

Gameplay takes place over a number of turns equal to the number of players, taking 20 – 60 minutes.

User summary:

Requires the use of custom cards which are provided as print-and-play components in the game document.

202838.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Asylum Demon Boss Expansion
202838.description:
The Mega Boss Expansions enhance your board game experience. These models are big - the Gaping Dragon is around 12-15cm tall! They also come with additional items to support their gameplay:

A Tileset for the Mega Boss Encounter (vary in quantity dependent on the boss)
1 Boss Dial for tracking damage
A Unique Mega Boss AI Deck that fully replicates their movements and attacks within the actual game itself
Specific Mega Boss Treasure Cards

202839.name: Baseball Highlights 2045
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
202839.description:
User Summary from Developer

Official app of the board game by Mike Fitzgerald and Eagle-Gryphon Games.

American baseball was on its last legs as a spectator sport. Football had become the predominant national pastime — that is until the year 2032, the year baseball decided to revolutionize the game and regain the throne!

Baseball Highlights: 2045 is like watching TV highlights of baseball games, with the gameplay being full of theme and without bogging down. In this quick and interactive game, players build their teams as they play, combining both front-office strategy and baseball tactics.

Features:
60 Unique Free Agents and four 15-man starting teams
Solitaire or 2-Player Hot Seat.
Two solitaire modes supported - the challenging standard solo mode from the board game with 5 difficulty levels OR play a 2-Player style game against the CPU Stengel AI
Interactive Spring Training tutorials to get you playing quickly
Integrated rulebook
Beautiful artwork from the original game
Autosave and Resume Last Game

202840.name: Fragment
202840.description:
From the introduction:

This roleplaying game explores technology through humanity, supporting players to develop stories about the increasingly complex relationship between machine and human.

The players take the role of machines, isolated, discarded and possibly obsolete. Information about their character and environment is initially limited, a deliberate device (for as a machine what expectation have they that they will be told anything more than what they need to know to perform their task?) but also intended to encourage players to engage creatively, develop details which will evolve as the game progresses.

Players know the finish (appearance) of their machine and its Primary Function (a guiding approach), which they can choose to ignore by spending resources, highlighting their free will while also provoking drama and tension when the characters interact.

Each machine was built by a team of people, and the link between creator and creation is a central part of the game. As the game progresses, the machines experience fragments of memory from their human creators.

202841.name: Fragment: Game Materials
202841.description:
User summary:

This document includes print-and-play components needed for the game, including cards and play surfaces (with concise rules) as well as a reminder sheet for major play processes.

202842.name: Atlantic Fleet
202842.description:
Atlantic Fleet will put you in command of the Royal Navy or Kriegsmarine (German Navy) in the longest military campaign of WWII, The Battle of the Atlantic.

Take command of surface ships, submarines as well as carrier and land based aircraft in the deadly struggle for control of Atlantic shipping lanes during World War II.

Protect allied convoys as the Royal Navy and her allies or go on the offensive with deadly submarine wolf packs and surface raiders of the German Navy.

Play through 30 historical Single Missions or make your own with the Custom Battle editor.

Take on 50 mission campaigns for each navy and build your fleet.

Recreate the challenges faced in the Battle of the Atlantic as you play a Dynamic Campaign with limited resources, historical units, actual convoy routes and real world-based weather.

Features

-60 highly detailed historic ship models representing over 630 individual ships and 350 submarines
-Command individual ships, e.g. HMS King George V & HMS Prince of Wales in the same battle
-Massive 10 ships per side battles and convoy engagements
-3 Modes of play: Single Mission, Campaign and Battle of the Atlantic Dynamic Campaign
-All campaigns saved individually for each navy
-Fire main and secondary gun batteries
-Visual ship damage with destructible turrets, directors and more
-Binocular and periscope views with zoom
-Torpedo salvos along with fore and aft torpedo rooms for submarines
-Improved anti-submarine warfare with sonar, hedgehog, squid
-Wolf packs and multiple diving depths for submarines
-Complete overhaul of graphics and environments, including underwater

Source: The Developer Website.

202843.name: Rusty Lake Hotel
202843.description:
User Summary

In this surrealist puzzle-escape game, you play a guest at the titular Rusty Lake Hotel. Over the course of five dinners you will interact with mysterious guests and staff, solve puzzles, and unlock the mysteries behind the hotel.

202844.name: Horror Adventures
202844.description:
Description from the publisher:

There are things that dwell in the dark places of the world, in long-abandoned crypts or musty attics — terrible things that can destroy your body and shatter your mind. Few individuals would think to seek out such nightmares, but those drawn into the darkness often find it infecting them, corrupting them in ways both subtle and disgusting. Some believe those who die facing such horrors are the lucky ones, for the survivors are forever scarred by their experiences.

Pathfinder RPG: Horror Adventures gives you everything you need to bring these nightmares to life. Within these pages, you'll find secrets to take your game into the darkest reaches of fantasy, where the dead hunger for the living, alien gods brood in dreams, and madness and death lurk around every corner. Rules for players and GMs alike pit brave champions against a darkness capable of devouring mind, body, and soul. To prepare to face such torments, the heroes can take new feats, learn powerful spells, and even acquire holy relics — for they'll need every edge possible to survive!

Pathfinder RPG: Horror Adventures includes:


Corruptions that can turn your character into a powerful monster, from a blood-drinking vampire to a savage werewolf. The only cost is your soul!
Character options to help heroes oppose the forces of darkness, including horror-themed archetypes, feats, spells, and more!
A detailed system to represent sanity and madness, giving you all the tools you need to drive characters to the brink and beyond.
Tips and tools for running a genuinely scary game, along with an in-depth look at using horror's many subgenres in a Pathfinder campaign.
Expanded rules for curses, diseases, environments, flesh-warping, haunts, and deadly traps.
New templates to turn monsters into truly terrifying foes, from creatures made of living wax to a stalker that can never be stopped!

202845.name: Heroes' Crossroads: The Battle of Lausdell, December 17-18, 1944
202845.description:
From the publisher:
“Our victory stands behind the last battle!” –Excerpt from General Gerd von Rundstedt’s message to the German troops on the eve of the Wacht am Rhine offensive.

When the German offensive in the Ardennes opened, speed was of the essence for them to win. The capture of the crossroads at Lausdell in the first days of the attack was crucial, as this would allow the 1st SS Panzer division to breakthrough. Holding the critical road juncture were the 1st Battalion, 9th Regiment of the 2nd Infantry Division, with support from Company A, 741st Tank Battalion and elements of the 99th Infantry Division, who had fallen back in the face of the overwhelming opening attacks the day before at Lanzerath. Behind this small force there was literally nothing to stop the Germans. Tasked with seizing the Lausdell crossroad was the 12th SS, Hitler Youth Division. One of the war’s truly epic fights was about to begin.

202846.description: An 80cm × 80cm plastic mat, double sided, with different layouts for the game. Available as a Kickstarter add-on, and afterwards direct from the publisher.
202846.name: Exoplanets: Playmat

202847.name: Product Testers
202847.description:
From the introduction:

All players should work together to complete the following steps - Choose a seed, Think of a basic human need, Choose a solution, Choose a format and Choose an inconvenient flaw, and Imagine a technology. The rules recommend using a six-sided die to make choices, but you can use any other method. Come to a consensus, take turns deciding, or vote if you prefer.

Some steps require creativity, imagination, and clever thinking that a six-sided die cannot substitute. Collaborate, but the player whose seed was chosen has the authority to decide. Move on to the next step when they have made the final decision.

202848.name: Faylark Meadow: The War-torn Wilds
202848.description:
From the introduction:

Explore a unicorn meadow with two competing factions in this short micro dungeon!

User summary:

For 2nd - 4th level characters

202849.name: Rockbreaker Tomb: The Quest for Long Desired Rest
202849.description:
From the introduction:

Explore an ancient dwarven tomb in this short micro dungeon!

User summary:

For 7th - 9th level characters

202850.name: Adubeus's Tower: A Home Long Lost
202850.description:
From the introduction:

Explore an abandoned wizard’s tower in this short mini dungeon!

User summary:

For 4th - 6th level characters

202851.name: Gods of the Fall
202851.description:
(from the back of the book)

THE GODS ARE DEAD - NOW IT'S YOUR TURN

There was a time when gods walked the world. Their magic pervaded the earth and the sky. From their mystical realm of Elanehtar, they brought plenty and pestilence. They judged the living and the dead. Their rule was absolute.

Then Elanehtar fell to earth like a vengeful star, sparking cataclysm and plunging the world into a dark age. The gods are gone, but their works remain--scattered and broken. The world struggles under the yoke of murder, slavery, and corruption. Dark things have squirmed free of their divine prisons, and even the afterlife has become a realm of nightmares.

But a power has awoken against the darkness. A divine spark struck in the hearts of new gods-in-the-making. You have this spark--the seed of godhood within you. Can you restore what was broken before the world vanishes forever into darkness? Can you claim a place for yourself in the heavens?

This book includes:


A complete, ready-to-play fantasy game world for the Cypher System, with a detailed history, new races, dozens of unique locations, and an array of celestial powers to choose from.



New creatures and NPCs, including the monstrous Hellmaw, guardian of the afterlife; seraphs, metallic servants of the divine; and ravers, the reanimated husks of dead gods.



Rules for growing your character from adventurer to god. Find your spark, choose your dominion, face divine challenges and labors, and fulfill prophecy to create a new pantheon.


A campaign setting for the Cypher System. Requires the Cypher System Rulebook for play.

202852.name: Canine Chaos
boardgamepodcastepisode: Interview Special #11: Tricia Roskelley Harmon (Alpha Ginger Studios - Canine Chaos)
202852.description:
Canine Chaos is a card game featuring dogs. Use Toys, Treats, and Tricks to train your Dogs and cause chaos in other packs. Become the first player to build a pack of 5 Dogs. For a more challenging game, be the first to reach 7 dogs.

To start a turn, pack owners draw one card from the deck. pack owners may add one Dog into their pack per turn as a free action. During a turn, pack owners may also use an already learned Trick, or use an Alpha Trait. The turn ends when pack owner makes one of the following moves:

Play a Dog Toy
Play a Power Card
Buy or attempt to lure a dog out of The Street or The Shelter
Use Treats to teach a dog a Trick
Change the Alpha Dog in their pack
Discard their hand and draw five new cards
Voluntarily choose to end the turn




Alpha Traits: Each Dog has a special ability that can only be used when the dog is the Alpha Dog. Alpha traits allow pack owners to bend certain rules, and only become usable once the pack owner has an Alpha Dog and at least one additional dog in their pack.
Tricks and Treats: Each dog can learn a certain numbers of tricks, which is noted on the Dog Card. Tricks give pack owners an extra edge in the game. This can be by defending a pack against other pack owner’s moves, giving a pack owner the chance to look at other pack owners’ cards, take cards from other pack owners, or giving a better chance at rescuing a Dog from The Street or The Shelter.
Rolling Dice: Certain cards require a roll of the die to decide if the card's effect is successful, and some cards increase or decrease the number required for a successful roll. For example, the “Rubber Chicken” card requires a die roll of 4 or higher to save the Dog from being taken by an opposing pack owner. However, all XL dogs take a -2 to all rolls against the Rubber Chicken. If this card was played against a Great Dane, and the pack owner rolled a 5, this modification would mean the roll counted as a 3. The Great Dane would be taken by the opposing pack owner. Alternatively, the Trick “Sit!” adds a +1 to any roll. A Great Dane that knows “Sit!” would be safe from the Rubber Chicken card because the total roll would be a 4.

202854.name: We Are Wild
202854.description:
From the introduction:

This is not a roleplaying game in the traditional sense. There are no rolls to make for social interactions or puzzles, among other things. You’ll only roll dice is if your character is clashing with another. This may in-clude verbal battles, combat, or even sneaking around. It is up to the game master to determine what is suitable for a dice roll. Otherwise, you’re largely in control of your character, what he or she does, and the story you’re telling with them.

202855.name: The Seventh Rule
202855.description:
User summary:

The game is comprised of 52 cards with rules printed directly on the cards. One card always starts a game. Play then proceeds in rounds with players attempting to create new rules for their character (the concept of character within the game is fairly thin). As rules are formed, the game play changes to conform. The player who sets The Seventh Rule is the winner of the game.

The cards are described as text; potential players must, however, format, create, and print their own decks.

202856.name: Mabinogi Duel
202856.description:
User Summary

This is a collectible card game played as a duel against another player. You construct your deck of 12 cards and have access to all 12 from the beginning. It takes resources to play a card (there are five different ones and decks can only be constructed from a maximum of three different types). Cards exist either in your hand, on the battlefield or in your graveyard. Cards in your graveyard can be recalled to your hand for a price of health depending on how many are in the graveyard. Through the duel you get as many actions as your level. You gain experience through various means and can advance a level for one action. The object of the duel is to reduce your opponent's health to zero.

202857.name: 7th Sea Core Rulebook
202857.description:
(from the back of the book)

7th Sea is a tabletop roleplaying game of swashbuckling and intrigue, exploration and adventure, taking place on the continent of Théah, a land of magic and mystery inspired by our own Europe. Players take the roles of heroes thrown into global conspiracies and sinister plots, exploring ancient ruins of a race long vanished and protecting the rightful kings and queens of Théah from murderous villains.

Save the Queen of Avalon from treacherous blackmail!

Thwart a dastardly assassination attempt on the Cardinal of Castille!

Raid the villainous fleets of Vodacce Merchant Princes!

Free the Prince of the Sarmatian Commonwealth from a mysterious curse!

Make decisions that alter the very course of Théan history!

In 7th Sea, you are a Hero, an icon of Théah ready to live and die for causes that matter. You bravely take on a dozen thugs with swords, knives and guns all on your own. You are the trusted knight, a loyal bodyguard or even an adventuring
queen herself.

In other words--you are d’Artagnan, Milady de Winter, the Dread Pirate Roberts, Jack Sparrow, Julie d’Aubigney, and the Scarlet Pimpernel all rolled up in one!

This is a game of high adventure, mystery and action.

This is a game of intrigue and romance.

This is 7th Sea.

202858.name: Football game
202858.description:
Score the first goal to win the game!

A roll and move game similar to snakes and ladders. However the game also come with two spinners to simulate the decision of the umpire's whistle (can be good or bad) and the attempt of the goal keeper to block the shot on goal.

Each player has their own player board and football counter.

202859.name: Miscellaneous miniatures, maps, terrain tiles and other accessories
rpgissuearticle: A Guide to Fantasy Figure Manufactures
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
202859.description:
This is a placeholder entry for various gaming accessories that are not allowed individually in the RPGGeek database (for details see our Guide to Data Entry).

A similar item (for non-gaming materials, merchandise etc.) is Memorabilia, Programs, Catalogs and Other Sundry RPG Related Material.

Home made maps and floor plains made by members of RPG Geek see Home Made / Homebrew Maps.

A list of useful articles listed on the miniatures wiki.

Board Game Geek has a number of miscellaneous gaming accessories entrees which might be of interest;

Miscellaneous Miniatures Game Accessory (loads of photos)
Miscellaneous Game Accessory
Miscellaneous Game Merchandise

202860.name: Flight of the Paladin
202860.description:
User Summary

As a knight you are galloping through a forest trying to kill ghosts and demons and wolves before they kill you. This is a top-down 2D game that feels like an endless runner at times, backed by Bach organ music.

202861.name: 35MM
202861.description:
User Summary

You and a computer generated character walk through a Russian wasteland looking for things of interest. There is a lot of walking. The game often slips into Russian and Cyrillic.

202863.name: Grassland and Sheep and Wind
202863.description:
This is a card game in which players become members of a nomadic family, performing tasks necessary for the family's livelihood. If they work together, the whole family prospers.

Each player is assigned either 1 (4-6 players) or 2 (2-3 players) family members to carry out daily tasks and generate happiness. Players are each also assigned one secret family member (which may belong to an opponent) whose happiness is added to their own total at the end.

Task cards are drawn randomly and then played one at a time to a common area. Each task rewards an amount of happiness to specific family members when assigned a family member token as a worker, but the most rewarding tasks must have prerequisite cards finished before they can be performed.
