Happiness is measured in chips designed as full moons, half moons, and crescent moons. The player with the most full moon happiness chips at the end is the winner, with the remaining chips acting as tiebreakers.

boardgameartist: しろやぎとざくろ (Shiroyagi to zakuro)
202864.description:
A peaceful paradise is threatened by the Black Minions!
Your mission is to control the friendly minions to defeat the invaders!

This game is a dice solitaire game. You will place dice on the 5x5map, trying to create chunks of dice that show the same number. Doing well, you can create chain reactions of your minions levelling up, and gradually destroy the black dice that get in your way.

This unique solo game mixes a computer game-like playstyle with the joys of an analogue boardgame!
202864.name: Garden of Minions

202865.description: This is an exclusive promo for Hero Realms Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.
202865.name: Hero Realms: Bloodfang Promo Card

202866.description: This is an exclusive promo for Hero Realms Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.
202866.name: Hero Realms: Ren, Bounty Hunter Promo Card

202867.description:
This is an exclusive promo for Hero Realms Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.

This Necromancer is a champion that can put a zombie token into play every turn! These zombies are also champions, but because they are tokens, when they die they removed from the game instead of going into your discard pile.

If you can keep your Necromancer out for a few turns, you can build up a deadly swarm of zombies to attack your opponent. She isn't particularly tough, so you'll want to get some guards to protect her while she works her evil magic. (A guard is a champion that protects you and your other champions, like an outpost in Star Realms).
202867.name: Hero Realms: Necromancer Promo & 4 Zombie Cards

202868.description: This is an exclusive promo for Hero Realms Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.
202868.name: Hero Realms: Gorg, Orc Shaman Promo Card

202870.name: Arma
202870.description:
Arma virumque cano
(I sing of arms)

After the great golden giants, the gigas, had left, the servant race was left on the planet.
The former servants of the giants fought over the super weapons, the relics that the gigas had left behind, and a horrible war began. It was the start of the "kleeronomos makhia".

What race will win the relic and become the new rules of the planets?
This is the clash of heroes from all races.

Arma is a hardcore card effect management game.
Each player gets a deck of ten cards 1–10, and will need to choose 4 of which to use the special effect, and use these skills and the remaining numbers to gain the relics. Some skills are available to all races, some are unique. It's your choice how to use them.

It's a mix of numbers, hand management, timing of card effects and outsmarting the opponents. Only the winner can be the one who sings of arms!

202871.name: Neko Yashiki
202871.description:
Players in this card game are cat-lovers trying to attract stray cats from a nearby vacant lot to come live in their yards.

There are 6 different cat types ("suits"), of which players are striving to collect majorities for points, plus a "rare" cat type that acts as a wild suit at the end of the game. The cats in the regular suits can be values of 1, 2, or 3, while the rare cats are only value 1. There are also "item" cards that give special abilities.

Each player starts with 3 cat cards in the player's "yard." The vacant lot begins as 4 face up cat cards and the rest of the draw deck face down. There are two ways to obtain cards from the vacant lot. First, a player may simply draw from the face up cards either A) up to 2 cats of value 1, B) 1 cat of value 2 or 3, or C) all visible items. Alternatively, the player may take a card from the player's own yard and return it to the vacant lot, then draw the top card from the deck. If the top card matches any of the cards in the vacant lot, the player gains the drawn card plus any that match it. (If no cards match, the drawn card remains face up in the vacant lot.) This second option may be repeated as often as desired until the player gains cards.

When gaining cards from the vacant lot, the player must be careful of the suit. The suit(s) in the player's yard with the most cards is considered threatening to cats in any other suits. If a player gains a card in a suit of which the player already has more cards than any other, one cat card in each of the suits with lower numbers of cats will return to the vacant lot due to fear.

Points are awarded at the end based on the highest value cat in the yard in each suit. One point is added for the player with a majority in that suit, while one point is subtracted from each player who has at least one card in that suit but does not have the majority. Every player with 2 or fewer suits at the end of the game gets a "maniac bonus" of 3 points. The player with the most points at the end is the winner.

202872.name: Precedence
202872.description:
This 1906 trick-taking card game has a deck of 54 cards divided into six suits of nine cards each. The suits are ranked by color: Purple (highest), Red, Yellow, Green, Blue and Brown (lowest). Each suit has the following cards: King (highest), Duke, Marquis, Earl, Viscount, Bishop, Baron, Baronet and Knight (lowest).

The key difference from most trick-taking games is that there is no trump suit, only relative ranks. The Purple King takes anything; the Brown Knight loses to everything; the Brown King takes any card of any suit lower than King, but loses to all the other Kings.

Each trick taken during a hand counts as two points. Each Viscount taken counts an extra two points. A game is normally to 40 points.

After the deal, each player starting to the dealer's left has an opportunity to make a Single Call. He may call a Peerage (five tricks), House of Lords (seven tricks), Royal (all the tricks) or Misere (lose all the tricks). Any player making a call then plays against all the other players. A successful Peerage scores 20 points, Misere or House of Lords 30 points, and Royal 40 points . If unsuccessful, each other player scores 10 points against Peerage, 15 against House of Lords or Misere and 20 points against Royal.

The booklet includes rules for a partnership version, a two-player version and a variant called Game of Viscounts.

202873.description:
From the publisher:

Prepare for invasion with Robotech RPG Tactics! Take command of the deadly mecha fighting forces of the United Earth Defense Force, the Zentraedi Armada, or the Malcontents. Robotech RPG Tactics is an epic 6mm scale battle game where players control whole armies from the Robotech universe. Take to the battlefield to crush your friends in a dynamic tactical game where the outcome is always hanging in the balance. Give your Zentraedi legion greater firepower with these artillery and support Battlepods; four figures total. 4 Zentraedi Support Battlepods, each of which can be made into any of the following: Gluuhaug-Regult, Light Artillery Battlepod, Serauhaug-Regult - Heavy Artillery Battlepod, Telnesta-Regult, and Experimental Particle Beam Battlepod.
202873.name: Robotech RPG Tactics: Zentraedi Artillery Battlepods

202874.name: Rabbids Invasion: The Interactive TV Show
202874.description:
'It's Totally Bwaaah-Some!'

Rabbids Invasion, the hit TV show on Nickelodeon, is now a video game on Xbox One, PS4, and Kinect for Xbox 360. Rabbids Invasion: The Interactive TV Show gives kids an opportunity to watch, play and interact with their favorite TV characters, the Rabbids! With over 20 interactive episodes, kids will jump into the show by playing full motion mini-games with over 400 activities like Match the Pose, Speed Drawing, Dance Like Crazy, Sticker Hunt and more! Challenge your friends to see who can keep up with the Rabbids in their wacky adventures or invite the Rabbids into your home with augmented reality. Up to four players (four players on Xbox One, two players on Xbox 360 and PlayStation 4).

Key Features

Play Through 20 Rabbids Invasion Episodes
Watch, play and interact with the Rabbids while the episode is running. Enjoy a new experience where you actively participate to become both an actor and a spectator of your favorite TV show.

Have Fun with Over 400 Wacky Full-Motion Activities
Have a virtual egg battle with the Rabbids, try to quickly match their silly poses, play against the timer or scream out the iconic Rabbids "bwaah". You can even launch the Rabbids through the air! So, Jump up and get moving!

Play with Family and Friends in a Competitive Social Experience
Enjoy hilarious times with your friends and unlock new content while competing for the highest score. You can also challenge them and try to become champion of the episode!

Let the Rabbids Invade Your Living Room
The Rabbids will pay you a visit with augmented reality. Interact with the Rabbids in your own living room and even take selfies with them!

Score Points and Get Hilarious Rewards
Unlock new episodes, augmented reality capsules and iconic objects from the TV show by accumulating points with friends for a global score.

Source: The Publisher Website.

202876.name: Mobil 1 Rally Championship
202876.description:
Mobil 1 Rally Championship (officially called Mobil 1 British Rally Championship, unofficially nicknamed Rally Championship 2000) is a rally video game which is part of the Rally Championship series. The game was released for Windows and PlayStation on 31 December 1999. It is developed by Magnetic Fields, distributed by Electronic Arts and Atod, and published by Actualize. The PC version is notable for stages based on real-life Ordnance Survey maps. Magnetic Fields exists no more.

After the Network-Q RAC Rally Championship (1996), it is a sequel to the International Rally Championship (1997). It features 22 cars and 36 tracks (42 in PlayStation version), drivable in two directions: Simulation and Arcade.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobil_1_Rally_Championship Mobil 1 Rally Championship]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

202877.name: Synthicide Beta 2.0
202877.description:
From the introduction:

The game is set in a galaxy on the verge of collapse, where bullets are more common than food and equally essential for survival.

An evil mutant force called the Prodigravus attempted to absorb all of humanity. A millennium-long war ensued, destroying every civilized planet. The Milky Way has descended into a dark age.

A tech cult called the Tharnaxist Church retained scraps of scientific knowledge. They used it to gain power over the surviving humans and mutants, but these cybernetic Priests aren’t interested in the lives of organics. They only care about discovering more technology and building Synthetic beings to run their society. Under Tharnaxist rule, the murdering of a robot – also known as Synthicide – is regarded as the highest crime on any planet. If one commits Synthicide and is caught, they earn the ire of the Church.

With human life devalued, remaining social structures have descended into barbarism, extortion, and gang-rule. Anyone with the means has become a Sharper: an independent agent that drifts from world to world, scraping by on dirty work. For a Sharper, floating through space is preferable to settling down on any Tharnaxist-ruled hellhole.

202878.name: Quizduell Mini
202878.description:
The most popular quiz app in Germany can now be experienced as a board game! Now in a little box with 600 new questions. May be played with its bigger brother Quizduell: Das Spiel or as a stand-alone game.

Choose category and start the duel by drawing cards, reading questions and its 4 variants. Who chooses the correct answer during the 20 seconds earns a point after each qurestion and so on. After 6 laps the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

202879.name: Oddments
202879.description:
Enchanted Arms and Useful Items
System Neutral RPG Supplement

User summary:

A collection of magical items presented in a system neutral format, with suggestions for adapting to any of the common fantasy systems.

202880.name: One Page Dungeon Compendium: 2015 Edition
202880.description:
First Place Winners
Edward Lockhart - Furthest Farthing's Frog Pond
Michael Prescott - The Lantern of Wyv
P. Aaron Potter - A Stolen Song

Second Place Winners
Anna Costa - The Panopticon
Carlos Pascual Torres - The Heist
Joel Bethell - Sepulchre of the Abyss
Lorenzo Santini - Into the Awaroth Woods
Monkey Blood Design - Escape the Oubliette
Will Doyle - The Shambling Throne of the Death King

3rd Place Winners
Aleksandr Petrovic - Aeon Caves of Treasure
Alex Welk - Race to the Reckoning
bygrinstow - Future Tense
Isaac Gomez - The Dark Coven
Jackie Tremaine - Into the Hurricane
Jaxilon - Lost Blacklock Mine
Michael & Mathew Iantorno - Vesna's Refuge
Michael Raston - Kingdom of the Pale Giants
Michael Wenman - The Star Pit
Taylor Frank - A Troubled Mind
Tom Walker - The Princess and the Frog
Thomas Reichmann - Ticket to Hell
Ulo Leppik - Teeny Tiny Dungeon

202882.name: One Page Dungeon Compendium: 2016 Edition
202882.description:
Grand Prize Winners

Alex Welk: Thaw
Khelren: Orient Express
Maezar: Dungeon of Abkadev
Michael Prescott: The Sky-Blind Spire
Mike Shea: Chambers of the Dread Titan
PJ Cunningham: The Signal
Tim McDonald: Griswald's Shifting Dungeon
Will Doyle: The Quintessential Dungeon

202883.description:
Think you know who should be the President?

FINALLY A CARD GAME ABOUT BECOMING

PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

Electability is a 2 - 6 player card game that brings the madness of US presidential politics right to you!

Based on the 2016 US Presidential Election, Electability highlights some of the craziest rules, power plays, and historic scandals of US politics.

Do you wish your candidate didn't drop out early? Do you think you can beat your friends to become the next president? ELECTABILITY!

Play as Donald Trump! Bernie Sanders! Hillary Clinton! Ted Cruz! Marco Rubio! Ben Carson! and more!

We also include presidential greats pack where we bring back some of the best presidents in US History. Also our presidential hopefuls pack, where we let you run for president as sports stars, American Leading Ladies, Talk Show Hosts, etc.
202883.name: Electability

202884.name: Terrene Encounters
202884.description: A drafting battle card game about dueling time travelers. Draft from the past, present, or future and enlist legendary heroes and creatures to fight by your side. Group your characters to get them to share their abilities. Use this both offensively and defensively. Regroup often to adapt to the situation. Rewind time to prevent our own death but be careful, each time you must suffer judgement from Lovox the god of time. Get Lovox to invoke Judgement on a traveler with 5 time cards to win the game.

202885.name: Unsung Tales
202885.description:
From the introduction:

The person who plays the hero is responsible for deciding what the hero says and does. The world players will be throwing all sorts of danger and mystery at you, and you’re going to have to figure out how to deal with it.

User summary:

The entire game document is formatted to be printed as cards of the same size as the custom cards used for the game (thus making storage easy). The custom cards are not included with the game document.

202886.name: Unsung Tales: Motif Cards
202886.description:
User summary:

These "motif" cards are required to play the game. They are presented as print-and-play components and are intended to be printed double-sided.

202887.name: Unsung Tales: Location & Character Cards
202887.description:
User summary:

These "location" and "character" cards are required to play the game. They are presented as print-and-play components and are intended to be printed single-sided.

202888.name: Bug-Game
202888.description:
This 1951 game by J.W. Drueke is played with a "Bug Box" about 4" x 5", with a clear plastic lid, red sides and a green felt bottom. Inside the box is a single D6 with a different letter on each side: B, H, L, T, E, F. The name of the game appears on the felt along with an outline of a bug that has a round body, round head, two eyes, two feelers, six legs and one tail.

Each player has a sheet with 12 small boxes, each good for one game. Players take turns shaking the box, and the letter that appears determines what part of the bug they can draw.

They must roll a B in order to begin drawing the bug, and then an H in order to draw the head. After that, they may add whatever piece of the bug corresponds to the letter on the die. First player to complete a bug drawing wins.

202889.name: Les Petites Choses Oubliées
202889.description:
From the introduction:

Les Petites Choses Oubliées is an [English-language] game for two players whose goal is to narrate, using everyday life pictures, some of the bitter-sweet memories of a couple. A play lasts for about one hour.

The game is divided into three movements. The first is used to picture the meeting of the soon-to-be couple. Each player unveils their character by portraying some of their particularities.

At some point, their relationship becomes flawed somehow and they decide to break up. This is so painful that they willingly decide to undergo an erasing procedure. Each player takes turn in describing some memories of the relationship. They use pictures as inspiration and the partner may react to this by providing some nuance.

202890.name: Dreamhunters
202890.description:
From the introduction:

Dream Hunters is a storytelling scavenger hunt game for a technological world. Players are tasked with taking pictures of specific Images over the course of a predetermined Time-Limit. But just taking a picture is not enough. Players must also capture the story of a Dream in that picture. Whoever does so best will earn the votes of their fellow players in the Dream Council and the player with the most votes wins!

Dream Hunters is a game which can be played face-to-face, via digital corespondence, over social media, or by mixing any of these mediums. Because of the variety of ways in which this game may be played, some rules (such as the Time Limit and details for voting) are left open to the needs of your individual game.

202891.name: Above Top Secret
202891.description: Above Top Secret is a Strategy Card Game for 2-4 players, or multiplay to 6 players.

202892.description:
What's your favorite scary movie? If you were invisible, who would you punch in the face? Turn a Tom Hanks movie into a horror film. How would you answer these questions? Bet you have an answer already!

Ever want to act like a scarecrow in front of your opponents? Ever want to throw playing cards through the air and be rewarded for it? Ever want to punish someone for holding up your game night by going to the bathroom? Ever want to make everyone trade seats in the middle of a game? Ever want to stop a game from being over so you can win instead? Creature Cards let you in this game!

This is Halloweeja: the Halloween party, board game where you talk to the living, and bring your party back from the dead! Horror fans, haunters, and Halloween enthusiasts will enjoy Halloweeja year round, but anyone who observes All Hallows Eve will find this game frightfully delightful.

Take turns asking each other wacky, Halloween themed questions from the Book Of Hijinks. There are no right or wrong answers. Match players to their replies. Each YES lets you move that much closer to a letter you need. If the Halloweeja Board reveals your PASSWORD first you win.

But beware: Creature Cards can be either a trick or treat, and help or hinder anyone in the game. And that letter you revealed may be the exact thing someone else needs to win too.

DISCLAIMER:
For entertainment purposes only! Manufacturer, distributor, creator, and owner cannot be held responsible for the misuse, and nonuse of this product. Not a ‘spirit board.’ ‘witch board,’ ‘talking board,’ or other trademarked board that sounds like wedgie when mispronounced, and definitely not a surfboard. Do not use as a personal flotation device or you may die. This product was tested on animals (the cat enjoyed it.)
202892.name: Halloweeja

202893.name: The Game of Life: Empire
202893.description:
A new twist on an old favourite!

Choose a career, then choose your path to the big time!
Pick a token, spin the spinner, move around the board and start owning the world's top brands. Build up your empire as you advance through life!

A family-style game where you try to collect six brands, as determined by your 'Hot List' card and return to the center to win! Be careful though, as other players can steal your brands! You'll also collect 'Followers' on your journey that make you more money on payday!

The 'Action' cards keep things interesting and the 'Empire' cards give you the power to change the game!

202894.description:
Elksbane is a four-counter expansion to Shadows in the Weald appearing in the sixth issue of Yaah! Magazine. It introduces a new hero, Borr Elksbane, and his two Direwolf Hirelings.

Borr is very frail, and doesn't pack much of a punch. He's not someone that can last long on his own, and in fact is at his best when he's helping others to be at their best. He allows your Party to reposition itself and to move quickly, while his tough Direwolf Hirelings slow down the enemy. It's all about getting the most out of your Party as a whole, and that often requires a bit of finesse.

The expansion includes three new scenarios, as well as rules to use Borr in all five base game scenarios.
202894.name: Shadows in the Weald: Elksbane

202895.name: Bruce Lee: Quest of the Dragon
202895.description:
Bruce Lee: Quest of the Dragon is a pure beat 'em up, using a 3D graphics engine and consisting of normal section where the player is brawling against multiple common enemies, and of one-on-one boss fights. New Jeet Kune Do-style moves can be purchased for the coins gained by beating up enemies.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Lee:_Quest_of_the_Dragon

202896.description:
Package!? is an abstract strategy game, designed with very quick play in mind (roughly 5 minutes a game), and is played without the need for a board, or a great deal of space. Each player is responsible for depositing a number of packages to 5 different locations, as well as moving packages about between these locations, and creating openings to remove opposing packages from the game. Each turn the current player will roll the die, and take one of the available actions dependant on the number rolled, taking into account the current location of the player, and the number of opposing packages at surrounding locations.

Points are scored for each package left in play at the end of the game depending on its location. When all players have placed their packages, the one with the most points is declared the winner… Simple. Sort of!

The decision behind what’s in the packages, and what each player represents, is left to you… Maybe you are couriers taking parcels to businesses? Maybe you are spies leaving bombs in enemy facilities? Maybe you are fishermen bringing the days catch into harbour? – Lets be honest, if we told you who and what, then it wouldn’t be abstract anymore!
202896.name: Package!?
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 032 – Top 10 Designers

202897.name: Montenotte 1796
202897.description:
From the publisher (translated):
Montenotte 1796 is the first game of a new series on revolutionary and napoleonic campaigns: La Grande Tactique.
Units are divisions and brigades, a force point equals 1000 infantrymen or 500 cavalrymen. A hex is around 6 km (3,7 miles) and a turn is a day.

Units are hidden from the ennemy (on their back side) to preserve the fog of war. Activation of formations is determined randomly but the player with initiative gets a special advantage. Battles are resolved on the map and include tactical advantages and disdvantages, units can march to the sound of the gun.

Command, morale and fatigue rules complete a medium complexity system.

From the publisher (French):
Montenotte 1796 est le premier jeu d'une nouvelle série consacrée aux campagnes de l'époque révolutionnaire et impériale : La Grande Tactique.
Les unités représentent des divisions et des brigades ou équivalent, un point de force égale 1000 fantassins ou 500 cavaliers , la distance séparant chaque hexagone représente à peu près 6 km et le tour de jeu équivaut à une journée.
Les unités évoluent face cachée sur la carte afin de préserver le brouillard de la guerre, l'activation des différentes formations se fait de façon aléatoire mais le joueur qui a l'initiative possède un avantage à l'activation. Les combats ont lieu sur la carte et il est possible de manœuvrer tactiquement et de renforcer une attaque par une marche au canon. Des règles de commandement, moral, de fatigue complètent un système de complexité moyenne.

202898.name: Glydor
202898.description:
This 1931 title from All-Fair is a spin-and-move game with a twist. The 16-space spinner includes moves from 7 forward to 2 back. In addition, the players may move either the total of the two numbers at the pointer and base ends of the spinner, or the difference between them.

There is the usual-looking twisting track for movement, with some squares that have specific instructions. But the winner is not the player to get to the end of the track. Rather, the winner is the last glider to land, the one who can keep his playing piece up in the air the longest by avoiding either end of the track or a forced landing.

202899.name: The Capture of Mr. Raffles
202899.description:
This trick-taking card game has a deck of 54 cards. There are four "series" or suits (Trump, Star, Sun, Moon), each with cards numbered from 0 to 12. There are also two additional cards, The Detective and Mr. Raffles.

The rules show a normal process for trick-taking games: one player leads, highest card takes each trick, and any trump beats any non-trump. In this game, however, The Detective is a top trump: it may not be led, but can be played at any time unless the holder also has Mr. Raffles.

The Mr. Raffles card is automatically picked up by whoever wins the trick on which it is played, and that player in turn must play Mr. Raffles at the first opportunity (the first trick in which he does not have the lead). A hand ends whenever one player runs out of cards.

Each trick taken during a hand counts one point. Each 0 card taken or held counts 5 points, and whichever player ends up with Mr. Raffles scores 10 points. Game is to 100 points.

202900.name: The Last Photon
202900.description:
User Summary

Using a ball of light, you bounce to set exit points. A story, about a depressed boy who doesnt leave the house, works in counterpoint.

202901.name: C'era una volta una... Palude!
202901.description:
From the publisher website:
Da lungo tempo i Cartografi di Darkmoor sono svaniti nel nulla, non avendo granché da cartografare. Tuttavia, ci sono luoghi inesplorati in questo mondo. Uno di questi è, ad esempio, Ninfonia: la palude-paradiso di rospi, bisce, sanguisughe e altre creature striscianti e disgustose.

English translation:
Long time ago the cartographers of Darkmoor vanished, having nothing to map. However, there are unexplored places in this world. One of these is, for example, Ninfonia: the marsh paradise of toads, snakes, leeches, and other creepy and disgusting creatures .

202902.name: Dobus: de clownsneusjes
202902.description:
Dobus: de clownsneusjes (Dobus: the clown noses) is a childrens game in which children learn to recognize shapes based on a Belgium TV series.
The game starts with 44 tiles faced down on the table. Each turn a player picks a tile. If the picture on the card has the same shape (e.g. a square) as depicted on the player's clown card the player keeps the card. Otherwise it is left face up on the table (and can be taken by another player). The game ends when a player has collected ten tiles or when four "Petunia" cards are revealed. The player who found most cards with the right symbol wins the game.

202903.name: A Night in Rottenburg
202903.description:
From the back of the book:
A Night in Rottenburg takes players into the heart of the Quarantine Zone, to the walled community of Rottenburg. There, the air thrums with necromantic energy, and the dead walk the streets alongside the living, serving as their silent protectors amidst the chaos of Malifaux City's forgotten districts.

202904.name: Lights On
202904.description:
From the game website:
Quando le luci che illuminano quotidianamente le nostre vite si spengono cosa succede agli H.E.R.O.es?

English translation:
When the lights that illuminate every day our lives are switche off what happens to H.E.R.O.es ?

202905.name: Le Compagnon - Aides de Jeu pour Planète Hurlante
202905.description:
From the back of the book:
Recueil d'aide de jeu pour le jeu de rôle Planète hurlante.

English translation:
Player Aid Codex for the role play Planète hurlante.

202906.description:
Ktizo is a 30 minute, easy to learn game that’s great for families and gamers. Players are looking to build up a new ecosystem on a new planet after Earth becomes uninhabitable.

Players will have a hand of cards, a deck to draw from and a tableau where they will place different species and connect different food chains to earn points. Each species card must match what that species needs in order to survive, with the resources provided by a species that is lower on the foodchain.

Every turn you have 3 actions in which you can manipulate your hand by drawing and discarding cards in order to get the right species for your ecosystem. The first to 100 points wins!

It’s a simple draw/play cards that challenge card management skills with a focus on nature and the beautiful diversity of species that we currently have on our own planet.
202906.name: Ktizo: An Ecosystem Building Cardgame
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Final Roll - 48 Hours Left to Go! - Episode 46: Wednesday, July 20th

rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
202907.name: A Thousand Years of War
202907.description:
From the introduction:

It is the year 2975, T.A. A millenia since the witch-king waged war on the realms of Arnor, in a series of battles of which their was ultimately no victor. Men have forgotten this time, but the witch-king has not. At his masters behest he is to test the resolve of the occupants of the Northern Realms to see what remains of their ancient lineage, and strive to lessen what aid they could possibly send to the Southern kingdom of Gondor, come the eruption of the next war.

202908.name: Dalwych
202908.description:
Publisher blurb:

A populated, system-less village, complete with map, that can be dropped into any fantasy or medieval campaign.

202909.name: Face Down in a Muddy Road
202909.description:
From the introduction:

The adventure starts with the players riding on one of the ubiquitous traveler wagons towards the small coastal town of Bray’s Bay. Each player may have a different reason for heading there, but fate has them all traveling together. With them are their driver, a couple of Imperium bureaucrats, and an out-of-work laborer.

The group will come across a couple of farmers attempting to repair a broken down cart. The "farmers" reveal themselves to be Kan Demon just as a stream of arrows and spears fly at the party from multiple directions.

User summary:

An introductory adventure for a party of 1st level characters.

202910.name: Descent into Shadows
202910.description:
Author's blurb:

Descent into Shadows is an adventure designed to be run by a moderately experienced Games Master in order to introduce players who are both new to role-playing and / or new to the Shadowrun game.

Play duration is variable and can be from 3 to 8 hours depending upon how the players decide to play things. This adventure can be run as a demonstration game at conventions and other events, however if the adventure looks to be going to over run the normal 4 hour slot, the later scenarios can be omitted and the action wrapped up earlier.

202911.name: In Blackest Knight
202911.description:
Author's blurb:

A short side trek adventure for the Savage Worlds setting.

From the introduction:

In Blackest Knight is a Hellfrost mini-adventure for Novice heroes. It is intended as a short side trek in an ongoing campaign and should provide for a session’s worth of play.

202912.name: In Darkest Day
202912.description:
Author's blurb:

A short side trek adventure for the Savage Worlds setting.

From the introduction:

In Darkest Day is a Hellfrost mini-adventure for Novice heroes. It is intended as a short side trek in an ongoing campaign and should provide for a session’s worth of play.

202913.name: Jelthien's Daughter
202913.description:
Publisher blurb:

In the Forgotten Realms, it is the year 1364 by the reckoning of the men of the Dales. Agents of the evil Zhentarim have kidnapped Silke Stenraiden, the young daughter of Lady Jelthien, the Second Morninglady of the Spires of the Morning temple in Waterdeep. The child has been spirited away to Zhentil Keep, and placed in the keeping of the priestesses of the temple of Loviatar. But why? What evil plot is the foul Black Network hatching now? And what do the depraved priestesses of the Lady of Pain plan to do with the little girl? In the foreboding fastness of Zhentil keep, can anyone save her now?

202914.name: Let's Be Friends
202914.description:
From the introduction:

The characters are called into an emergency briefing – several members of SG-25 have gone AWOL a few days after returning from P4X-932-C, a world orbiting a red giant star. While military police and SGC security teams attempt to track down the missing people on Earth, the PCs are asked to go to P4X-932-C and see if they can figure out what might have caused SG-25 to vanish.

202915.name: Meanwhile, Back at the Ranch
202915.description:
From the introduction:

Little Jimmy Parsons went playing where he shouldn’t. Everyone said the played-out Ghost Rock mines were a bad place to go, being all haunted and what have you, but he wouldn’t listen. Hell, telling a kid not to go is the only thing surer than Hell to make him.

Well, the Manitous got him. Hollowed out his mind and got in the drivers seat for some fun and games.

202916.name: Murder Incorporated
202916.description:
From the introduction:

Open Eye investigators receives a call from Professor Van Fleet at the Reynolds Museum, a small museum attached to the University of London which maintains a valuable collection of artefacts from the ancient Mediterranean and Near East. Van Fleet is a tall, very thin man in his fifties, almost bald with a sharp beak-like nose and glasses. His voice is very soft and quiet and he behaves with great politeness.

A week ago, Professor Van Fleet was shown a nearly complete Etruscan wine bowl, of excellent quality and condition. The curious thingwas, it was shown to him by a band of teenagers who found it in the alleyway behind the Corinthian Building in the City. The kids brought the bowl to the museum in the hope that it ‘might be worth something’. Van Fleet and the museum’s patrons at the university would very much like to know how a valuable and potentially important artefact should end up discarded in a pile of rubbish. If there is an underground trade in such artefacts, the University wants it tracked down and stopped before more items of historical value are lost.

Van Fleet is to be Open Eye’s contact at the museum. The University of London will pay Open Eye’s retainer and fee.

202917.name: New Horizon
202917.description:
From the introduction:

New Horizon is an adventure designed to be run by a moderately experienced Games Master in order to introduce players who are both new to role-playing and / or new to the Shadowrun game. Play duration should be approximately 3 to 4 hours and it can thus be run as a demonstration game at conventions and other events. Unlike most Shadowrun adventures this takes on more of a horror theme, as it concerns some of the worst new phenomenon encountered during the Year of the Comet.

202918.name: Newcomb: Prison Planet
202918.description:
From the introduction:

Newcomb: Prison Planet details an Imperial prison world in the Solomani Rim subsector, Newcomb / Banasdan 2913. There are over 301 billion inhabitants in the Solomani Rim, and the 40,000 or so relatively law-abiding inhabitants of Newcomb reside alongside around 1,700 of the most dangerous captive criminals among that population.

The Solomani Rim is of course politically divided between the Imperium and the Solomani Confederation, and this is invariably refl ected upon Newcomb. The prison facility is a rough and ready institution, socially isolated, politically neglected, and severely lacking in investment over a number of years. It is a run-down, relatively low technology facility, operated by people who don’t want to be there, but have no choice other than to be.

202919.name: Night of the Ghoul
202919.description:
Author's blurb:

This scenario is designed as an introduction to the World of Darkness for new characters. The style of game is a supernatural thriller, along the lines of the X-files, and may be used to begin a campaign exploring the paranormal.

This scenario is different in that although events appear to be supernatural, in the end they are discovered to have a mundane explanation. This scenario can therefore teach an important lesson to players to not automatically assume the paranormal to be the cause of mysterious events.

rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
202920.name: Of Ports, of Spirits, and a Sea of Rum
202920.description:
From the introduction:

The Party embark on an expedition down the River Running to the regions around the Sea of Rhún. The reason for the journey is partially up to the narrator, and the backgrounds of the characters, the suggestion giving involves knowledge of wines, agriculture, markets etc. Hopefully a member of the party has such knowledge. It is envisaged the party are familiar with the Dale region.

202921.name: One of Us
202921.description:
From the introduction:

Investigators are all 'freaks' (used in its historical and colloquial sense to reflect contemporaneous attitudes). Each has taken part in the murder of two other Circus performers and is traumatized by it.

The Circus is moving from town to town when one of the other freaks (Constance) starts to conduct sacrifices and ceremonies intended to bring about an earthly gateway to the Dreamlands that the Great Old One Atlach-Nacha can use.

202922.name: Quickfire
202922.description:
From the introduction:

Quickfire is an adventure for Shadowrun 4th Edition that has been designed to be run by a moderately experienced Games Master in order to introduce players who are both new to role-playing and / or new to the Shadowrun game. Play duration should be approximately 4 hours and it can thus be run as a demonstration game at conventions and other events.

202923.name: Shower Scene
202923.description:
From the introduction:

Due to an incident in the gateroom, the PCs are going to discover they and they alone can see evidence of an alien “skin infection” amongst SGC personnel. The infected (which includes General Hammond) are displaying some odd behaviour and may be under alien influence. The source of the infection is SG-31 and one member of SG-16, recently returned from a world devastated by the Replicators. The players should try to contain the infection on the SGC, and will discover that it is caused by nanites. The nanites are designed for use with genetically engineered animals to create “programmed caretakers” for an alien city. In the absence of any animal life with sufficient smarts to get their creators’ civilisation up and running again, the nanites are “reprogramming” people to assist in a rebuilding programme on the planet.

202924.name: Siren's Song (2005)
202924.description:
From the introduction:

Helen has been infected with Necanthrope virus. She has the irresistible sexual charm of a permanently switched on Nec. It will eventually kill her, through the psycho virus it is inducing. For now, all those that come within 5 meters of her become entrapped by her spell, and the desire to love and possess her.

202925.name: Strike Team Tango
202925.description:
From the introduction:

Strike Team Tango is an adventure designed to be run by a moderately experienced Games Master in order to introduce players who are both new to role-playing and / or new to the Shadowrun game. Play duration should be approximately 2 to 3 hours and it can thus be run as a demonstration game at conventions and other events.

202926.name: Cards: Die Partie deines Lebens
202926.description:
Cards: Die Partie deines Lebens is an unusual card game, one in which you have to master crazy tasks and tricky riddles. You play on your own, and the game can take weeks, months, or even years to complete. Each card provides a new challenge that works its way into the player's life. Only when you fulfill the condition on a card may you reveal the next one.

Cards: Die Partie deines Lebens contains fifty cards, and as soon as you have fulfilled the last card, you have completed the game.

202927.name: The Dogs of War (2003)
202927.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 903, 18 April. Domino Dogs have been with SLA Industries for over two years now, the prototypes for almost three. SLA has used them to trace and hunt cannibals, carrion, rogue operatives and it has been rumored rogue Necanthropes. They are dangerous creatures, but the World of Progress has learned to work with them, if not trust them.

Dr Strand has been very pleased with the work of the Domino Dog and its Head, Dr Taro Toyama. The work on the Domino Dog allowed Phantom Pregnancy Inc to acquire additional funds for further projects.

Domino Dogs were seen as the future, to deal with the increasing incursions of carrion and cannibals. The work they undertook in Downtown and the Cannibal Sectors led the populace to believe that their savior, Mr Slayer, had once again led them from destruction to the promised land.

202928.name: You Only Live Twice (2003)
202928.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 590, 23 August. Rubenz, Ebon Investigator (SCL 6D), chooses steel. His controlled gasp as life leaves his body echoes around the chamber. Only one other hears his last breath in the lower dungeons of the Gothic Cathedral that is known as Dark Lament HQ, Central, Mort. He was a model employee of SLA Industries and had built on his reputation as class investigator to climb the ranks of Operatives before transferring to Internal Affairs. During the last 13 months he fought the dream demons, though eventually they plagued his waking hours. In the end the noise was too much and the drug was seriously affecting his work.

rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
202929.name: The Dragon's Ring
202929.description:
Author's blurb:

It is three years after the attack by Smaug on the Lake Town Esgaroth. A ceremony of remembrance, and celebration of the new re-building, and racial unity, will take place on the evening of the first day of the adventure proper. Just as the characters get into the spirit of the occasion, they will spot movement near the lake, to the south of the ceremony and thus will begin the adventure.

202930.name: We'll Meet Again
202930.description:
Author's blurb:

The character team is off on a standard recon mission. The MALP images showed summer weather. Trouble is, when the team steps through the gate, it is winter and all the locals recognize them and hail them as heroes of a big battle that happened several months ago...

202931.name: Run For Gold
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette (Alternative Software re-release) edition
English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition
English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
English / European Commodore 64 Cassette (Alternative Software re-release) edition
English / European Commodore 64 Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Alternative Software re-release) edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
Spanish / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
202931.description:
From the inlay:

The ultimate challenge for middle distance runners: to win the Olympic Gold against the worlds top athletes AND to break the world record in three events - 400m, 800m and 1500m.

Run For Gold allows you to train two runners for this task: both a 400m runner and a 800m/1500m runner. There are four major championship finals: first Crystal Palace, then the European Championships, thirdly the World Championships and finally the Olympics. Your runners will have to race in local meets in order to gain entry to each of these finals.

But there are forty other runners who share your dream of Olympic Gold. Each runner uses individual, realistic tactics. And, as you improve, so they will improve and the harder it will become to qualify for major championships. As you strive for the world record, so they will also strive for the same goal. The race for gold is on.

202932.name: A Most Potent Brew
202932.description:
From the introduction:

This first-level adventure is designed for D&D veterans and complete beginners alike. It only uses rules, items, monsters and concepts found in the free basic ruleset that can be downloaded from the Wizards of the Coast website.

That means that you and your friends can play this without having to buy anything other than snacks, drinks and maybe some dice - though even these can be replaced by the many free Dice Roller apps available for phones and tablets.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive containing four files:

- Scenario (4-page PDF)
- Printer-friendly Scenario (4-page PDF for printing)
- Player Handout (1-page PDF print-and-play component)
- Map (1-page PDF)

202933.name: Explore the 50 States
202933.description:
From the publisher:

Explore the 50 States from Maine to Hawaii - and all points in between. Explore the people and places that make the United States such a unique country.

Question cards teach kids interesting facts about the geography and history of the fifty states, while Travel cards add a fun twist - moving players forward or backward on their adventure. Additional facts are included on the cards to make the topics more interesting.

Addition information:

Players spin to determine which type of card to draw. Three of the four decks include questions about history, geography, or state flags. Answering correctly means the player can move forward. Drawing a travel card simply moves a player forward or backward. The player who circles the board first wins.

202934.name: Wyatt Derp
202934.description:
User Summary

You shoot at enemies running towards you in a 3d-ish game, collecting bonuses.

202935.name: Trial High
202935.description:
User summary:

Characters are defined primarily by which clique they belong to and a couple things they are good at doing. Their clique association may vary during the game. Game play involves boasting about one's abilities primarily by denigrating others' abilities.

202936.name: Grim Prospects
202936.description:
Explore an abandoned mine shaft in search of lost gems and ore while being careful to avoid the previous tenant's pitfalls. Draw cards by digging (draw two) or prospecting (look at the top three and choose one) from the deck until it is depleted, trying to avoid Dynamite and Gas Leaks, sure signs of disaster.

Players may also return to their base camp in order to stash their finds for safe keeping, or throw Dynamite at other players in order to make them drop their haul. Once the deck has been depleted, players tally the value of cards in their hand and stash to determine a winner.

202937.name: Mein Friedberg Spiel
202937.description:
Mein Friedberg Spiel is a collection of games related to Friedberg (hometown of Pegasus) to celebrate the 800th city anniversary in 2016.

Contents


Loveletter version, themed around the visit of the Tsar in Friedberg
Roman circular (3 Mens-)morris
Snakes&ladders, themed around the Friedberg main street, Kaiserstrasse
Advanced Mau Mau, themed with local arms and special Friedberg features
Mindmaze, with questions from the history of Friedberg
32 standard playing card deck, illustrated with Friedberg pictures
Memo game with Friedberg illustrations
2 different sized puzzles showing Friedberg views

202940.name: Captain Number
202940.description:
Two great pirates, one called Plus and the other By, try to get the mythic treasure of mathematics. They go through epic monsters and great difficulties.
He who arrives first at the mythic island will be the great winner taking with him the treasure of maths.
And he will be, "Captain Number".

Captain Number is a game of knowledge and math, there are 2 people or 2 teams, trying to go through puzzles where one makes the math problems and the other one tries to solve it, plus answering in the course of the game, cards with questions.

202941.name: Koboler
202941.description:
Help your devils to walk through your path of fire.
But watch out thievery and water can make it more difficult to reach your goal.

Each die roll gives an other variaty of options, Find de best way to secure three points.

boardgamecompilation: Operational Matters: An OCS Guide (w/ Sicily II game)
202942.description:
Published and packed with Operational Matters: An OCS Guide (w/ Sicily II game).

(from the publisher:)

Sicily II is a full-sized game covering the amphibious invasion of that island in the summer of 1943. This new edition is quite different from Dean Essig's original game from back in 2000. It features a revised order of battle, modified rules, and a new map. The most obvious change is in scale: hexes are now 3.5 miles across and there are two turns per week (the original had 2.5-mile hexes and four turns per week). This makes for a smaller, faster game that conforms to the scale chosen for Beyond the Rhine and the upcoming games set in Western Europe. We think Sicily II is a perfect way to give new recruits their baptism in the fire of OCS, and is also a worthy entry in the series for players who have already earned their stripes.

Here are some of the game’s highlights:


The entire campaign lasts just 16 turns.
There are six scenarios in all (three using the entire map, and three using just a portion).
The Allied airborne fiasco is recreated with simple scatter rules.
The amphibious landings can be played out using standard OCS naval rules, or players can mostly skip these and begin with the bulk of Allied forces already ashore.
The Luftwaffe’s Do.217K makes its series debut, armed with exotic Fritz-X missiles.
Rules for Italian unit wavering and surrender make every game different.
Several interesting options are provided, including revised Axis deployment and variable entry of the 29th Panzergrenadier Division.


Game Scale:
Turn: 3 to 4 days
Hex: 3.5 miles / 5.6 Km
Units: Company to Brigade

Game Inventory (Operational Matters magazine version):

One 22 x 34" full-color mapsheet
Two dual-side printed countersheets (560 1/2" counters)
One 16-page Sicily II rules booklet




Players will have to use OCS v4.2 rulebook/charts & tables for another OCS game or download them from http://www.gamersarchive.net/theGamers/archive/ocs.htm

Complexity: Medium
Solitaire Suitability: Medium
Players: 1 or more
Playing Time: 2-20 Hours
202942.name: Sicily II

202944.name: Bajevar Critter Book
202944.description:
From the introduction:

To call Bajevar (pronounced BAH-hay-var) a Campaign Setting would be inaccurate. A true campaign setting shows a full world with maps and descriptions of regions. This ain’t that. Instead, we’ll call this an Adventure Setting.

In this book you will find some of the monsters which may be encountered across Bajevar, in addition to the creatures in the Cypher System Rulebook.

In the companion Bajevar Guidebook you will find some hints and clues as to what the world is like. You will discover the four races of the world along with some of their societies and habitats. You will discover guilds, gear, new artifacts, and even a few new skills.

You will, if you put all the pieces together, discover the flavor of the world. What you will not discover is the world itself. You can build the world however you like. It is yours to create.

202945.name: Zona Mágica
202945.description:
Zona Mágica is a game where each player will compete against its adversaries to make the most points in a magic presentation tournament, and at the same time trying to mess his opponents presentation using varied effects from the different spells.

Each player will represent a mage with a unique power, and will acquire magic items with different unique powers enabling many possible strategies to win.

With simple rules, but alot of strategic possibilities, Zona Mágica will be enjoyed by both new board game players as well as experienced ones.

In Zona Mágica all players have some chance of winning, luck exists but is a minor factor, the player choices makes the biggest difference in who will win the game.

Play Zona Mágica, and enjoy looking at the hundreds of different references to the geek and pop culture that are hidden in the illustrations and flavor texts.

202946.name: Bajevar Guidebook
202946.description:
From the introduction:

To call Bajevar (pronounced BAH-hay-var) a Campaign Setting would be inaccurate. A true campaign setting shows a full world with maps and descriptions of regions. This ain’t that. Instead, we’ll call this an Adventure Setting.

In this book you will find some hints and clues as to what the world is like. You will discover the four races of the world along with some of their societies and habitats. You will discover guilds, gear, new artifacts, and even a few new skills.

In the companion Bajevar Critter Book you will find some of the monsters which may be encountered across Bajevar, in addition to the creatures in the Cypher System Rulebook.

You will, if you put all the pieces together, discover the flavor of the world. What you will not discover is the world itself. You can build the world however you like. It is yours to create.

202947.name: Bajevar Introductory Adventures
202947.description:
From the introduction:

The Bajevar adventure setting is defined in the downloadable docs Bajevar Guidebook and Bajevar Critter Book. You will need those books to play these adventures.

The Introductory Adventures are three mini adventures for three or four Tier 1 characters. It introduces the players to the town of Brin and to the playable Orlo.

202948.name: Soylent Platinum
202948.description:
From the introduction:

The time is a few years from now. The global economy is in turmoil. Trade conflicts, regional destabilization, war, and corruption have led to widespread poverty and food shortages.

Cannibalism has quietly become commonplace -- just another way to feed the family. The wealthy don't need to eat people . . . but transgression has a peculiar allure. Of course, the rich don't eat the poor; that would be disgusting. Instead, the rich eat the famous.

202949.name: Campaign Backdrop: Hills & Mountains
202949.description:
Campaign Backdrops give you, the busy GM, all the tools you need to run a campaign set in a particular wilderness environment. Each instalment brings together—for the first time in one place—previously released material into one handy, GM friendly package. Featuring wilderness dressing, detailed random encounters, fully fleshed out villages and even a place of power all ready for immediate use in your campaign. Campaign Backdrops are the perfect accompaniment to your wilderness campaign.

Campaign Backdrops: Hills & Mountains is a compilation product. This GM’s Essential features material previously released in the following books:

• Wilderness Dressing: Hills
• Wilderness Dressing: Mountains
• Random Wilderness Encounters
• Random Wilderness Encounters II
• Urban Dressing: Mining Town
• Places of Power: The Prismatic Tower
• Village Backdrop: Denton's End
• Village Backdrop: Feigrvidr
• Village Backdrop: Hjalward
• Village Backdrop: Silver Bluff

This product is a Dual Format PDF. The downloadable ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

202950.name: Return to Freeport Part Two: The Abyssinial Chain
202950.description:
Publisher blurb:

A silent threat grows in Freeport’s streets, even as the city’s newest heroes bring the terror of the Brine Witch to an end. One of the pirate city’s own leaders brings Freeport ever closer to war, lining his traitorous pockets even as he plans to open the city to foreign invasion.

202951.description:
Extra Things is a 9 card expansion with 2 more cards added as stretch goals. Without giving away all the secrets, all players will now have an attack of 15, Joey Greco (from the TV show Cheaters) as a gecko, the CEO dressed as John Oliver wearing a trench coat and bunny ears and even The Spanish Inquisition shows up.

The first expansion to Black Slither's first game.
202951.name: Bear vs Gorilla vs CEO vs Hippie: Extra Things

202952.name: Unstable Equilibrium
202952.description:
User summary:

The game rules are provided as print-and-play cards with the game rules. Play involves a card game with resulting decisions based on the rules on the cards. This method of play is intended to make entry into a roleplaying game easy for inexperienced players.

202953.description:
Hat-Trick: 'Players' Expansion, the first expansion for the card-driven soccer simulation Hat-Trick, includes rules and components for the following:


22 player roles – from now on you will be able to customize your line-up by assigning roles like Playmaker, False no. 9, Wingback, etc. to your players.



44 player skills – each of the 22 player roles has 2 unique skills - a stronger and weaker one. Depending which side a given player is on, he will be able to use one of these skills.



45 unique national teams – by means of the new system, the game recreates 45 national teams, each with different strength, line-up and playing style.



12 style cards – from now on each team will have an assigned playing style – technical, tactical, physical or total – and, thus, will be able to use the corresponding Style Cards to perform style-unique plays.



6 match events – the expansion introduces 6 match events like corners or substitutions.



3 budget cards – the Budget Cards make it possible to customize teams of different mentality (attacking, balanced, defensive) and affluence. This way you will be able to recreate any team in the world.
202953.name: Hat-Trick: 'Players' Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Final Roll - 48 Hours Left to Go! - Episode 46: Wednesday, July 20th

202954.name: Leo (2014)
202954.description:
From the introduction:

The Consortium is a corporate entity that is attempting to establish holdings in the Scythe. They offer many of the benefits of civilization, but at a cost of some freedoms.

The players may choose to play the crew of a Consortium ship, or the crew of a free Scythe ship.

This game setting is not intended to represent good or evil, heroes or villains. Neither faction is entirely right or wrong, and there are no moral absolutes in the Scythe.

User summary:

The game document includes print-and-play components.

202955.description:
The Mega Boss Expansions enhance your board game experience. These models are big - the Gaping Dragon is around 12-15cm tall! They also come with additional items to support their gameplay:
A Tileset for the Mega Boss Encounter (vary in quantity dependent on the boss)
1 Boss Dial for tracking damage
A Unique Mega Boss AI Deck that fully replicates their movements and attacks within the actual game itself
Specific Mega Boss Treasure Cards
202955.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Gaping Dragon Boss Expansion

202956.name: There Is No Game
202956.description:
From the introduction:

Player characters are common people who have received a spark of knowledge of things that no longer exist. They must restore the missing pieces of reality by somehow reinserting them into the common cultural landscape, before they are lost forever.

User summary:

The game is implemented as a sort of object properties map, nearly like a flowchart. Accessibility is quite good though the presentation is very unusual. Although the game is provided on a single sheet of A4 paper (one side), it needs to be greatly zoomed (300-400%) to be readily legible.

202957.name: How the Stars Came to Be
rpg: How the Stars Came to Be
202957.description:
From the introduction:

Aside from what is printed on the cards, there are no pre-existing rules to follow. In fact, many of the rules have been left ambiguous on purpose; just as each population has created their own method for their oral traditions, each Village will develop their own set of house rules to handle the situations that are not explicitly spelled out. These rules will then be passed on and modified from group to group.

User summary:

Nearly the entire document is intended as a print-and-play component.

202958.name: In Short
202958.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game uses simple cards to spur the development of a shared narrative. Cards are either characters or items. Each card includes only the simplest description (usually, just a single noun). Nearly the entire document is a print-and-play component.

202959.name: Le Livre des Règles
202959.description:
User summary:

This French-language free-form game is played as a minimal live-action game. Players use a fragment of a found "book of laws" (provided as a print-and-play component) to speculate about mythical underlying laws of everything, where anything is possible but only with a cost. A steep cost. For great rewards.

202960.name: Quilt of Yarns
202960.description:
From the introduction:

Quilt of Yarns is an informal storytelling game with elements of role-playing and bibliomancy. Ironically, it is played with a stack of books. To begin, each player takes a book, turns to a random page, selects a passage from that page (one or two sentences or a particularly distinctive phrase), and writes that phrase on a scrap of paper.

User summary:

Game play requires access to a variety of books - nearly any sort with words will work.

202961.name: En rolig historia
202961.description:
En rolig historia is a somewhat educational roll-and-move game published by the Swedish Tourist Association and printed on a large trifold sheet of stiff paper. The game is history-themed and the back of the board has three pages of historical overview.

To my knowledge playing pieces were not supplied and there is no stated player count. The rules are rudimentary and game events include the usual "lose a turn", "move X spaces forward/backward" and "take a detour" among others.

Published in 1980 or 1981.

202962.name: Bara vanligt vatten
202962.description:
Bara vanligt vatten is a somewhat educational roll-and-move game published by the Swedish Tourist Association and printed on a large trifold sheet of stiff paper. The game is water-themed and the back of the board has three pages of related physical and environmental information.

To my knowledge playing pieces were not supplied and there is no stated player count. The rules are rudimentary and game events include the usual "lose a turn", "move X spaces forward/backward" and "take a detour" among others.

202964.name: Short Straw
202964.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game have a few attributes that vary during play - "Darkness" and "Hit Points". Characters otherwise are summer camp instructors with limited supplies. Game play uses straw draws (e.g., don't draw the short straw) and primarily involves narrative resolution.

202965.name: Starjump
202965.description:
User summary:

Starjump is a free-form live-action game that uses a ball to control narrative input. The game primarily is about word association leading to narrative development, but is played in a live-action method.

202967.name: The Crescent Path
202967.description:
User summary:

The game is played in a series of phases controlled by numbered note cards. The sequence of play is determined by randomly ordering the cards. Action primarily is narrative, though play does generate a large number of written play card artifacts.

202968.name: Siljanspelet
202968.description:
This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

Though this particular game is not branded as Kunskapsspelet - it encompasses four towns around the lake of Siljan rather than a single town - it is clearly the same design by Knut Helleland, with some others contributing trivia questions.

202969.name: Sports Bogglers Baseball
202969.description: 1-2 players compete in a baseball game simulated by the rolling of dice, marking baserunners on a pegboard, and keeping score on paper. Follow standard baseball rules.

202970.name: Wynton Grove
202970.description:
User summary:

The game is distributed in a ZIP archive containing:

- One JPG art image
- One PNG art image
- Credits (1-page PDF document)
- Read Me First (2-page PDF document; introductory instructions)
- Rules Reminder Sheet (3-page PDF concise guide)
- Major Arcana: Town Guide (4-page setting overview)
- Minor Arcana: Memory Guide (24-page setting)

In addition, the game requires the viewing of three separate YouTube videos (unfortunately no longer available for viewing).

Note that the town's name is given as Wynton and Wyton; Wynton appears to be correct.

202971.name: In Business
202971.description:
In In Business, players have to trade goods from one continent to the other. Starting off with a loan from the bank, players have to earn money to pay back the loan and finally make a profit. The first player to own a certain amount of money (depending on the number of players) wins the game.

In order to do so, players have to make the most profitable bargains by buying cheap and sell expensive. Each country has its own prizes.

At the start of the game each player gets a goal-card, which shows:

The type of good which have to be traded
Purchase area
Sell area
Purchase and sell prizes




Players move along the board by rolling two dice. For each continent they can choose whether to walk the long- or short route.

During the game, players can get additional goals, loose or win money at the stock market, or get additional smaller bonuses or losses. Also players can lose their cargo by a casualty during transport, unless their goods are ensured.

The additional rules for experienced players involve a more extensive stock market.

202972.name: Dreams of the Next Age
202972.description:
User summary:

The game is distributed as a ZIP archive containing seventeen separate files. Sixteen files contain print-and-play cards (mostly faces, a few distinct backs). One file contains the game "poster", or introductory rules, which is displayed on a large sheet. Game play involves using cards from multiple deck types - Traits, Challenges, Items, etc.

202973.name: The Book of the Teachings of the People
rpg: The Book of the Teachings of the People
202973.description:
From the introduction:

In the beginning, there were the stones and the plants and the beasts. And, to name them all came The Ancients.
The days in the garden were simple for the ancients. For food they need only reach to the trees, for drink to the clear stream. They still dwelt in instinct, rather than wisdom.
Being delivered to the garden, The Ancients had all but forgotten the dark Before Time. But it was still strong in the hearts of the Prophets and their kin. And Strong in the lands outside The Garden.

In this book, we record their teachings for the ages.

User summary:

While the game text is provided as a text-only file for reading, the PDF version is required as a print-and-play version for actual game play.

202974.name: Forged in Battle
202974.description:
The Alliance to Restore the Republic rests on high-minded ideals, but its battles must still be won in the trenches. The Rebellion’s troops go into every battle outnumbered and outgunned. Its soldiers know that they're fighting a war against long odds, but they remain undaunted. Instead, they rally together, using their cunning, their skill, and their courage to ensure that the hope for freedom persists in the galaxy.

A Soldier sourcebook for the Star Wars®: Age of Rebellion™ Roleplaying Game, Forged in Battle offers these brave warriors a wealth of new options and resources with which they can better take the fight to the Empire. Its 96 full-color pages introduce new species, specializations, and signature abilities. A sizable collection of new weapons, armor, gear, and vehicles adds more firepower to your campaign, and Game Masters will find helpful hints on running combats in different terrain, using the changes in environment to better suit the tastes of your Soldiers, as well as all other characters interested in standing on the front lines.

202975.description:
Galatune is an anime battle tabletop card game set on the fantasy planet of Lyra. The United World Government maintains peace and prosperity through the monopoly of advanced ancient technologies, but utopia comes at a steep cost. Will you join with the government to protect unity, or will you join the rebels and fight for freedom and independence?

2-5 players each lead a Champion warrior into battle and earn a Victory Point each time an opponent is defeated. You win the game by being the first to earn 3 Victory Points by defeating 3 opponents. BUT there's a twist! The game doesn't end for you when your Champion falls in battle. Instead, you just get back up on your feet, respawn your Champion, and continue fighting! Think of it as a sort of card-based battle-royal, like a Battle Arena game, where you play for KOs.

Unlike other battle card games where players take their turns one-at-a-time, in Galatune everyone attacks simultaneously! It's an exciting formula that keeps the game moving and encourages players to predict and react to each other in real time.

Great game for first-time gamers or serious pros! Easy-to-Learn, impossible to master!
202975.name: Galatune

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Winner
202976.description:
A pantheon from several civilizations — including Greek, Egyptian, and Middle-Eastern — gets added to 7 Wonders Duel in 7 Wonders Duel: Pantheon, with each god having its own power to help you or hinder your opponent.

During Age I you collect mythology tokens — which allow you to choose which deities have a place in the Pantheon — and during Age II you collect offering tokens, which help you court those deities. Then, during Ages II and III, you can activate a god or goddess in the Pantheon instead of taking a card from the pyramid. To do so, you pay whatever that god or goddess demands from you in offerings, then place it next to your city.

With Isis on your side, you can use a card from the discard pile to construct one of your Wonders for free. Zeus, whose nod determines what happens and what does not, enables you to discard any single card from the card structure that you want, as well as any mythology or offering token that may be on it. The Phoenician goddess Tanit, whose people were renowned for trade, fills your coffers with twelve pieces of gold. Enki, the Sumerian god of crafts, technology, and creation, lets you choose one of two progress tokens. Minerva's ability to stop the conflict pawn from moving toward you can assist with a military victory or save you from military defeat.

What's more, instead of adding three guild cards to the deck for Age III, you add three of five Grand Temples. Each Grand Temple belongs to a different Mediterranean culture, and if you possess a mythology token from that culture, you can build the temple for free. These temples are worth a total of 5, 12, or 21 points, depending on how many you build.

7 Wonders Duel: Pantheon also includes two new Wonders: the Sanctuary (which gives you an additional turn and allows you to invoke deities at a reduced price) and the Divine Theater (which grants points and access to additional gods).
202976.name: 7 Wonders Duel: Pantheon
boardgameaccessory: 7 Wonders Duel: Pantheon – Metal Minerva Pawn
boardgamepodcastepisode: #34: Double Six-Pack Review! 7 Wonders Duel & Agamemnon; 7 Wonders on Tap; iOS game reviews
#39: Two Player Games six-pack; Citrus on tap; Isle of Skye & Avenue
Ep 043 – Essen Part II Expansion Preview
Episode 196
Episode 32 - The Essen Games We Have to Have
Episode 36 :: Essen 2016 Preview + Stephanie Straw Interview
Episode 38 - What Exactly are We Using Kickstarter For?
Episode 5: The one about Essen Spiel 2016
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 73 - Spiel ‘16 Treasure Hunt Part 3

202977.description: Cytosis: A Cell Building Game is a worker placement game that takes place inside a human cell. Players start out with a number of workers and on a player’s turn, they will place one of their workers in any available location within that cell. Some of the locations provide players with resources (e.g., mRNA, ATP); some with actions (e.g., convert resources, collect cards). Resources are used to build enzymes, hormones and/or receptors, which score Health Points. The player with the most Health Points at the end of the game wins!
202977.name: Cytosis: A Cell Biology Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 30. Devon Dice podcast: Not Too Busy To Play Games
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 160
Vox Republica 141: Science Is Your Friend

202978.name: The Temple of No
202978.description:
User Summary

A comedy adventure Twine game written by The Stanley Parable’s William Pugh and released by crows crows crows.

202979.name: XITA
202979.description:
1. Yes, another abstract strategy game, however the smallest 4 player abstract strategy game in the world (4" x 4").
2. First objective is to win. Second objective is to not come in last.
3. Each player has a player piece ("Gamer").
4. On the Board are 13 cork pieces (1 Black in the center, 4 Red around the black, 8 Green around the Red))
5. In turn, each Gamer moves 3 spaces, or "passes".
6. A cork piece is captured when a Gamer lands on it.
7. Game ends when the Black cork is captured, or all players have passed twice in a row.
8. Most points wins

202980.name: Troll Country
202980.description: In Troll Country 1-4 players take on the roles of a tribe of trolls trying to thrive in a dangerous land and survive against their ancient enemies, the Elfin. The game has a modular hex board where players move their trolls around to conquer lands and build improvements. Players get resources through gathering or hunting via a "Hunt Deck." They work to appease their deities and receive boons through rituals and works. While players may squabble, the main enemy is the Elfin who take their actions as determined via a special AI die. Theme and artwork is similar to "Overlord" and "Dungeon Keeper" video games.

202981.name: Cosmos
202981.description:
This rare 1978 title is a game of space combat played out on a huge map featuring a stylized solar system and a massive web of connecting stars within a grid of squares. Eight of the nine planets are used as bases for between two and eight players. Each player has five ships, with the objective of either eliminating an opponent's five ships or getting one of his ships onto an opponent's planet.

Ships can either fire or move in a turn but not both. Range is measured not by star links but by number of squares counted orthogonally. Combat results are Hit or Miss, with the chance of a Hit increasing as range decreases. There are nine Firing Cards of 10 cards, with the number of the deck equal to the range and to the number of Miss cards it contains. Some of the result cards also trigger events through Space Conditions cards.

The movement and combat systems interact. When a ship succeeds in hitting and eliminating another ship, it gets promoted, by a degree that varies with the difference in ranks between the two. A ship's level does not affect combat, but does determine how many stars it can move in a turn. Ship rank ranges from 1 to 12.

202982.name: Scrawl
202982.description: Revealing the terrible artist in all of us, players in Scrawl start off with a loaded phrase, doodle it, then pass it on. By the time your masterpiece of an "OAP Conga Line" passes through your friends' weird minds and wonky pens — and makes it back to you — things will have gone horribly wrong. Points are awarded for the most disastrous doodles and godawful guesses. Most grins wins.

202983.name: Flight of Faeries
202983.description:
User summary:

Characters in this light-weight but intriguing game are generated by drawing template cards that provide a broad overview. Remaining characterization takes place during narrative development. A set of specialized dice is used to generate events in the game, though the nature of the events is variable depending on player input. Game progress is tracked by moving through a board with two possible pathways (player selects the path) - one is a modern genre path, the other is a fantasy genre path.

202984.name: The Wild Woodlings and the Blight
rpg: The Wild Woodlings and the Blight
202984.description:
User summary:

This ingenious game can be played either as a board game or as a roleplaying game, using the same components. In the roleplaying game, the board serves as an area map and the character spinners are used as (small) character sheets. Various cards used during board game play are used by the game master, in roleplaying, to generate adventure happenings and ideas.

The game can also be used both way as a method to introduce inexperienced or, especially, younger players to the concepts of the game as a board game and then transition to a roleplaying game in an already-familiar setting with already-familiar characters and adventures.

202985.name: Cry of the Wilders
202985.description:
User summary:

The game uses fairly simple character creation, with narrative trait definitions. Action resolution uses a simple die roll. The game usually is accessed via a brief descriptive HTML page that has several embedded links. The links primarily point to MP3 audio files that explain the game. Components include:

- HTML Entry Page (description, links)
- Play Sheet (3-page DOCX file with basic game processes)
- Brief audio intro (MP3, 11:05 min)
- Longer audio intro (MP3, 16:05 min)
- Q&A Session (MP3, 20:00 min)

202986.name: Bright/Dark Histories
202986.description:
From the introduction:
