Humanity is constantly evolving, but it faces two possible futures. In one, humanity grows in spirit and ascends to become the fae, creatures of light, happiness, and creation. In the fae future, good has prevailed: society has matured; war is unheard of; and so on.

In the other future, humanity grows in hatred and descends to become the undead, creatures of dark, fear, and destruction. In the undead future, evil has prevailed; society is selfish; peace is unheard of; and so on.

Thanks to the quirks of quantum reality, both timelines have already happened--yet that is not guaranteed. Timelines are fluid. Fae and undead existence could simply cease to have happened at any time. The only way to guarantee that a future is safe is to change the past--to go back in time to before humanity evolved and push history towards that future. That’s why both fae and undead agents travel back to the same past. It can go either way, and thanks to the agents’ meddling, it will.

You are not just fighting for good or evil. You are fighting for your entire existence.

202987.name: Bourse
202987.description:
User summary:

Although credit for inspiring the Parker Brothers' 1904 hit game Pit is often given to the 1903 Gavitt's Stock Exchange (GSE), this 1903 game from Flinch Card Co. is more obviously Pit's parent.

While GSE involved the trading of railway shares, Bourse (like the later Pit) was about trading commodities. All three games use the open-outcry method of trading cards (shouting a number of cards willing to trade but not their nature), and the goal of collecting all the cards of one kind.

Bourse uses a deck of 80 cards, ten each of eight commodities: Wheat (80 points), Corn (70), Cotton (60), Oil (50), Beef (40), Pork (30), Mutton (20) and Stocks (10). There are no special cards like GSE's Fatal Telegram or Pit's Bull and Bear.

202988.name: Super Loopers
202988.description:
Dexterity game where two players shoot marbles at the same time through two loops (one each) trying to land them on different point values.

Each player has five color-coordinated marbles, highest score wins.

202989.name: Under the Southern Cross
boardgamefamily: Flying Colors: Naval Actions of the Age of Sail
202989.description:
Description from the publisher:

Under the Southern Cross: The South American Republics in the Age of Fighting Sail is the fourth volume of the highly regarded Flying Colors series of games on naval combat. The focus is on the southern part of the South American continent: Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, Chile, Peru, Bolivia, and Ecuador, from the Wars of Independence starting in 1810 through the last naval war fought completely under sail between Argentina and Uruguay in 1841. These wars attracted naval officers recently unemployed by the end of the Napoleonic Wars as well as providing a proving ground for the first generation of naval heroes native to Latin America. 

Updated rules introduce river and tidal currents, modified grounding rules for operations in the Rio de la Plata and Uruguay rivers, and the use of ship’s boats to tow stranded or becalmed ships. In all, over two dozen battle scenarios ranging in size from a handful of ships per side, to full-blown fleet actions are presented. Also included is the return of the popular ship duel map and activation cards originally found in Serpents of the Seas (Flying Colors volume II), along with 18 ship duel scenarios. 

Like the preceding volumes in the series, Under the Southern Cross is completely independent of, while being fully compatible with, the other volumes in the series. Everything needed to play is included! 

Can you, as the Spanish, strangle the rebel American governments and preserve the centuries old Spanish Empire, or will you help the Patriot forces throw off the Imperialist yoke of the European monarchies? Now you can try with Under the Southern Cross!

Components:

1 Rulebook
1 Playbook
1 Player Aid Chart
1 Deck of 55 Action Cards
2 22x34" Maps
2 Counter Sheets
2 10-sided dice

What’s New in Flying Colors Vol IV?

"Under the Southern Cross: The South American Republics in the Age of Fighting Sail", designed by Mike Nagel and Steven Paul, covers the battles between the South American Navies from 1811-1841. Like "Serpents of the Seas", the focus is primarily on frigates and smaller vessels. The Duel Map and Action Cards from that volume will be reprinted for this one.

Due to the varied nature of naval warfare in this theater, “Flying Colors” will address riverine battles for the first time. Among the new rules included:


More detailed shoals and grounding effects
River and tidal currents
Change in wind force from breezy to dead calm
Towing and refloating by ship's boats


Under the Southern Cross is a stand-alone title and comes packed with more than two dozen fleet actions and 18 ship duels, each of which is informed by in-depth historical research; scenario-specific rules, for example, recreate the unique features of the actions that took place in and around Montevideo Harbor and Arroyo de la China, hospital ships, hostage rescue, and much more.

Most rules will be specific to this volume; the core “Flying Colors” system will not change apart from minor rules updates and clarifications.

202990.name: Generations
202990.description:
User summary:

The game is implemented as an online wiki. Play involves collaborative creation of several world/setting elements followed by individual character development and collaborative setting development. The game wiki allows for login and standard wiki functions, as well.

202991.name: Faerie Raed
202991.description:
User summary:

Faerie Raed uses a folklore event (the "wild hunt") as a framework for a collaborative storytelling experience that is generated through a card game. The game is designed for three players but can also support a fourth player. The game is distributed in three documents:

- Faerie Raed (2-page RTF instructions)
- Cards (8-page PDF, print-and-play components)
- Role Cards (1-page PDF, print-and-play components)

202992.name: Moment of Destiny
202992.description:
User summary:

Moment of Destiny is a minimalist storytelling card game. Play involves narrative development with hands of cards. The wiki includes instructions and also a large number of print-and-play components (cards).

202993.name: Timecube!!!
202993.description:
User summary:

Timecube!!! is a little-known but notorious roleplaying game, famous primarily for being unplayable and nearly incomprehensible. The game assumes a d20 will be at the core of combat and offers a few other cohesive sentences, but gameplay remains largely undefined.

202994.name: Amasser Dragons
202994.description:
Amasser Dragons is a fantasy adventure game that allows you to become a dragon. As the dragon, your ultimate goal is to amass the largest treasure hoard to solidify your place as the most formidable dragon of all time. The other dragons will envy your success and try to stop you at every turn, while they try to amass their own treasure. Only greed, strategy, cunning, and ruthlessness will allow you to prevail and take what is rightfully yours as all others will bow before you.

Each dragon has its own strengths and weaknesses, along with their own preferred terrain, breathe weapon and special ability. The dragon will fly from its lair, encountering challenges, ranging from easy to extremely difficult. If a dragon chooses to fight an encounter tile, dice are rolled and if the dragon is successful it gets the gold that the encounter is worth. Dragon versus dragon combat is a possibility if you wish to test your strength against the others and gain additional rewards. Once all the encounter tiles have been removed from the playing area, the game ends and the dragon with the most gold wins.

There is a 110 card deck in the game that allows players do a variety of things. There are cards that can strengthen your dragon and there are cards that can hinder other dragon’s abilities (i.e. Attack Power, Speed and Carry). Additionally, there are cards that have the ability to manipulate game play of your choosing.

The playing area is modular and customizable depending on the amount of players and the size of game you wish to play. Recommendations are included in the rules, but you make each game as big or small as you like. While gathering gold is the main objective of the game, the underlying intent is to bring friends and family together to have fun.

202996.name: Timecube: the RPG
202996.description:
User summary:

Timecube: the RPG presents an unintelligible approach to a tabletop roleplaying game where apparently all things exist in a cuboid relationship with non-opposite unrelated things. The game uses specialized dice which must be a four sided "cube" (e.g., impossible). The game was authored as a parody though several groups have reported on making significant efforts actually to play.

202997.name: Za Vstrechu!
202997.description:
From the introduction:

Za Vstrechu! (named after a traditional Russian toast) ... [is] a game about a masked ball on the eve of the Russian revolution. All the instructions are either on the invitation or on the masks themselves, hence the minimalist rules.

User summary:

The game requires several print-and-play components, including the invitations and the masks.

202998.name: Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – U.S. Army
202998.description:
The U.S. Army Expansion covers the U.S. Army’s involvement on Guadalcanal from late October through December 1942.

Mine counters and rules are introduced in this expansion. Also included are the National Guard, Melanesian Police who assisted U.S. forces on Guadalcanal, and the Marine 2nd Raiders who arrived on Guadalcanal in November, after the Battle of Henderson Field

202999.name: Terra Lander
202999.description:
A Homage to classic retro games and especially the lunar landing genre. Pilot your craft through 20 increasingly difficult levels.

Source: The Developer Website.

203000.name: Taking of Taidian
203000.description:
Taking of Taidian is a deck-building game for 2-6 players. It is character based and set in the near future. Due to the many different choices, players can make, such as do I buy attack cards or defense cards, and the variety of character skills Taking of Taidian has a lot of replayability. The game is designed to encourage table talk and group strategy. Build your own deck while keeping your eyes open to what others are doing.


Each player starts with 150 health, 0 energy and a deck of 15 cards: 5 coin cards, 1 cash card, 4 energy shield cards, 3 kick cards, 1 robber card and 1 shotgun card.
You will use attacking cards to lower your opponents' health while using defense cards to keep yourself alive.
You may also buy new and better cards or try to power yourself up with energy cards.
The goal of the game is to be the last person or team standing.
Table talk and trash talk are not only allowed, but encouraged.


Have fun while making your friends hate you.

202501.description:
From the publisher:

Throughout the Opposition cycle, the rivalries and feuds between affiliations dominate the game. The Jedi against the Sith. The Rebellion against the Galactic Empire. The galaxy’s scum and villainy against the loyal smugglers and spies. Now, with the third Force Pack in the cycle, you’ll have the chance to choose your side and battle to decide the fate of the galaxy.

Meditation and Mastery is the third Force Pack in the Opposition cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game, and this expansion offers ten new objective sets (two copies each of five distinct sets), granting new options to every affiliation. Here, you’ll find new affiliated fate cards for the Rebel Alliance and the Imperial Navy, alongside some of the other new fate cards introduced in this cycle. You’ll also gain the opportunity to fly and fight alongside recognizable characters from the Star Wars saga, including Wedge Antilles, Nien Nunb, and Admiral Screed.
202501.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Meditation and Mastery
boardgamefamily: Star Wars: The Card Game LCG

202502.description:
Keira, Wolf Caller is a promotional card for Epic Card Game that is included in the Epic Card Game Long Box, along with 200 Epic Card Game card sleeves and 4 corrugated cardboard dividers, one for each faction.

Keira, Wolf Caller
Wild Human Champion
Cost: 1
Ability: Ambush • Blitz Your wolf tokens have blitz, +1 attack and +1 defense. Tribute → Put two wolf tokens into play.
202502.name: Epic Card Game: Keira, Wolf Caller Promo Card

202503.name: COSMOS
202503.description:
Manipulate the Universe using stars, comets, supernovas, black holes and gravitational waves to impose other players !!!


Use the Stars to create your constellation.
Use the Comet to destroy stars.
Use Supernova (massive explosions) to rotate the adjacent tiles (which are not on their side of the Universe).
Use Black Holes to engulf and disappear adjacent tiles (which are not on their side of the Universe).
Used Gravitational Waves to alter the SPACE (move an adjacent tile to another place) or TIME (rotate a tile for example, a Black Hole disappear or to make it appear a Star that was destroyed).


Game Turn:
In his turn a player can do one of the following:

Steal tile (depending on the level of difficulty, store up to 2 in hand) and place it.
Not steal or play tile and activate the effect of a tile panel (Gravitational Wave one, for example).
Do not steal or play tile and activate GRAVITY (move any tile to an adjacent space)




Victory:
CONSTELLATION Game Mode (2-8 players):
The player who first represent their constellation on the board, wins.

UNIVERSE Mode game (2-4 players):
The player with most stars in his "universe", after playing all the tiles, win.

GALAXY Game Mode (1 Player):
If the player manages to form a 10 star galaxy adjacent, he wins.

202504.description:
Cycling card game, the player who can deplete the other players deck wins.
Each card features famous cycling champions including Laurent Fignon, Roger De Vlaeminck, Tom Simpson, Joop Zoetemelk, Eddy Merckx, Bernard Hinault, Fausto Coppi, Jacques Anquetil, Alfredo Binda, Eugène Christophe, Gino Bartali, Fabian Cancellara, Bradley Wiggins, Mark Cavendish, Cadel Evans, Erik Zabel or Marco Pantani.

Via hand management players have to beat the other players using skils from their champions like panache, climbing sprinting or stamina.

The player who can run the other player's deck down wins the game.
202504.name: Cycling Stars

202505.description:
A Cyclo-Cross / mountain bike board game published in 2013 in the UK.
There are two editions of the game, named "Slim" and "Pokket". The rules for the smaller "Pokket" game are a simplified version of the already simple rules for the bigger "Slim" game.

The game uses a roll & move mechanic as the players race over a track that features mountains, to reach the finish line first, he who crosses the line first wins.
202505.name: Hillocks (Slim Edition)

202506.name: Trickin’ Camel
202506.description:
Collect as many bottles as possible by winning Trickin’ Camel challenges and/or by catching the bottles he flings out of his bottle crate.

There are 3 types of challenges in this game.

Guessing game: the lights flash on the game base and players must remember the last light flashed - If the player chooses the correct light, the camel will make a victory noise and the player can take a bottle out of the crate otherwise camel spits a little bit water.
Memory game: the lights flash on the game base and players must remember the sequence of flashing to earn a bottle.
Speed game: Players must press the lights until the sequence stops to earn a bottle.




As soon all the 20 bottles are taken the player with the most bottles wins the game.

202507.name: Fairytales: Three Heroes
202507.description:
User Summary

You can switch between one of three Slavic heroes as they complete tasks.

202508.description: Includes 5 standard Ceremonial Ashes dice, identical to the dice that come with the Rise of the Phoenixborn base set.
202508.name: Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn – Ceremonial Dice 5-Pack

202509.description: Includes 5 standard Charms Ashes dice, identical to the dice that come with the Rise of the Phoenixborn base set.
202509.name: Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn – Charm Dice 5-Pack

202510.description: Includes 5 standard Illusion Ashes dice, identical to the dice that come with the Rise of the Phoenixborn base set.
202510.name: Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn – Illusion Dice 5-Pack

202511.name: Tornado, Featuring Operation Desert Storm (CD)
202511.description:
Box Back Description

January 17, 1991, 0100 hours, somewhere over Iraq. Your Tornado Squadron has received its instructions -- to annihilate Saddam Hussein's airfields. You're flying through the most impenetrable air defenses in the Gulf. In this hostile desert landscape, there is nowhere to hide.


18 Desert Storm Missions, preplanned for instant action.
3 European Combat Arenas featuring 54 missions of unsurpassed detail.
With design input from RAF aircrew and British Aerospace, Tornado is unequaled in authenticity.



Ultrasophisticated Mission Planning allows you to strategize each sortie, set waypoints, altitude and airspeed.
Includes 4 highly detailed war zone maps for precise mission planning.



Choose from a wide array of weapons: Laser Guided Bombs, ALARM, JP.233 Dispensers, BL755 Cluster Bombs and more.
Go it alone or take the squadron -- the choice is yours.



Penetrate the enemy's airspace at ultra low level altitudes, flying under variable weather conditions, in day or night.


"...the most technically realistic and involving military flight simulator available for the P.C."
Score: 92%
PC Home - Lance Concannon

202512.description: Includes 5 standard Natural Ashes dice, identical to the dice that come with the Rise of the Phoenixborn base set.
202512.name: Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn – Natural Dice 5-Pack

202513.description:
BattleGoats is a War-style card game where players alternate turns in card battle to determine a winner using the highest number value. Number values change as the game goes on. The person with the last card in play wins. Rules are easy to pick up and games play in as little as 5-30 minutes for groups of 2-6 players.

How to play:
1. Each player gets a random Hero and recruits an army of goats to battle with.
2. To build an army, all players are dealt 8 additional cards from the deck at random. Any remaining cards are set aside and not used for that game.
3. With 9 cards in hand, each player lays them out face down in a 3x3 pattern to set up their battlefield.
4. The player that finishes laying their battlefield out the fastest gets to choose who attacks first.
5. To attack, select one of your cards, then choose any one of your opponent’s cards.
6. Both cards are flipped over and the higher number after any modifiers wins. Special abilities or modifiers are shown on the bottom of each card. If the numbers are equal, both cards are defeated.
7. After the attack is finished, the losing card is discarded and the winning card flips back over, then it is the next players turn. (Here comes the Memory effect into play, just remember where you can attack cards with a lower number on it.)

The player with the last card in play wins.
202513.name: BattleGoats
boardgamepodcastepisode: 36 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Learning through Games
45 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Tucker Smedes – CardLords

202514.name: Kort på kanten
202514.description:
Kort på kanten ("Card on the edge") is a shameless party game in norwegian, where the purpose is to make funny, absurd and unfitting combinations of words, phrases, persons and situations.
To generalize, it's the norwegian version of Cards against humanity, with some new rules.

Play begins with a judge, choosing a red question or fill-in-the-blank card from the top of the deck and showing it to all players. Each player holds a hand of ten white answer cards at the beginning of each round, and passes a card (sometimes two) to the judge, face-down, representing their answer to the question on the card. The judge determines which answer card(s) are funniest in the context of the question or fill-in-the-blank card. The player who submitted the chosen card(s) is given the question card to represent an point, and then the player to the left of the new judge becomes the judge for the next round. Play continues until the players agree to stop, at which point the player with the most points (red cards) is the winner.

In addition there are some new rules:
"Bestemor" (gradma) - draw an extra white card from the draw pile. If that card wins, agree on a punishment.
"Sidesprang" (side step) - before you read the white cards, draw another red card and use that instead.
"Kapitalisme" (capitalism) - discard one of the red point cards you have won to "punish" other players or switch 3 white cards.
"Folkestyre" (democracy) - Judges are stupid! Everone can vote. The card with most votes win!
"Samspill" (Interaction) - Too many players? Team up with more people on each team.

From the publisher (translated):
"Kort på kanten is distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 4.0 license - that means you can use and remix the game for free, but you can't sell it..."

202516.name: Blank Marry Kill
202516.description:
A card-based variant on the old game "Screw Marry Kill", where one of the existing verbs (screw, marry, or kill) is replaced with a random new verb. Players secretly vote on which verb the Judge will choose for each of 3 given characters. They then take turns adding attributes to each of the candidates in an effort to sway the Judge's final decision to match their vote.

Players receive points for each correct guess and the Judge role rotates until each player has had a turn to be the Judge. Once each player has been the Judge once, the round ends; the player with the most points at the end of an unspecified number of rounds wins.

The game contains several sets of cards:

3 purple cards for the original set of verbs (screw, marry, kill)
White cards containing alternate verbs
Green voting cards for each player (screw, marry, kill, blank - where the blank card is used for the alternate verb)
Black character cards
Red attribute cards
Orange cards to represent points

202517.name: Wordstacker
202517.description:
WordStacker is a card game of stacking, stretching, and mixing up words to score points to win. Quick to set-up and easy to learn and play. It's for 2-6 players over 15-30 minutes.

Create new words every time you play, win points and stack your way to victory... BUT BEWARE you may get sabotaged by your opponents. Anyone can win this game of strategy and wordplay.

It’s great for family gaming. Kids love it because they get to play without help from parents, AND they can win. Adults love it because it's not always about what you know, there's strategy and challenge in the game which is compelling and fun.

HOW TO PLAY

Object of the Game: Make new words by stacking, stretching and mixing-up letters to score points. First to score 100 points wins!

Set-Up:
1. Split the cards into blue (Action cards) and yellow (Letter cards).
2. Lay out a set of 4-letter words according to the number of players in the game (2-3 players = 3 words / 4-5 players = 4 words / 6 players = 5 words)
3. Separate the Letter cards into two decks: vowels and consonants. Shuffle both. Deal 2 vowels and 4 consonants to each player, then shuffle the Letter cards back together and place face down to create a Letter card draw pile. Shuffle the Action cards and deal 3 cards to each player. Place face down to create an Action card draw pile. Keep your hands secret! The player to the dealer’s left goes first.

Playing the Game: There are 2 types of Action cards in the game;

Score cards which have a score value and;
Sabotage! cards which sabotage your opponents




Score cards include:

Stack 2, 3, 4 and 5 letters
1 letter word stretch & multi-letter word stretch
1 Word Mix-Up & Mega Mix-Up
New Word




Sabotage! cards include:

Miss a Go
Reverse Play
2 Card Swap
Find a Letter
Steal a Letter




On your turn you can:

Play 1 Score card or
Play 1 Sabotage! card or
Do both!




Once played, Score cards remain face up in front of you where the other players can see them. Add up your Score cards during the game to keep track of your score. At the end of your turn, restock your hand to 9 cards choosing any combination of Letter and Action cards. Play then passes to the next player.

Winning the Game - First to score 100 points wins!

202518.name: Stratospheria
202518.description:
Stratospheria is a realm of contradictions, showcasing the terrible tension between the Umbra and the Eidolon as they carry on their ageless battle-by-proxy. Above a tempestuous gas giant covered in ravaging super-storms, floating cities of brilliant technology hover amongst the clouds. Aliens and humans zip about in lightning-fast airships, one step ahead of the storms, each other, and those damn sky pirates. Ancient secrets and elder forces lurk deep within the planet, making this landless land far from breezy.

- Publisher's description

202519.name: Burgers & Beasts
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Final Roll - 48 Hours Left to Go! - Episode 46: Wednesday, July 20th
202519.description:
Burgers & Beasts is about building the best burger for the masses of adventuring customers that come your way. These adventurers will face many great foes, but their greatest challenge will be in finding a good meal. That's where you come in. Customers will be pouring out the Adventuring Cave, hungry for their favorite food: Burgers! Along with those Adventurers also come the fearsome Beasts that attack the nearby castle. Your job is to create the best burger to attract the strongest fighters and defeat the Beasts that threaten the castle…and gain a little treasure while you’re at it!

Build Burgers: Defeat Beasts; Gain Diamonds!

202520.name: The Books Of The Undead, Volume 2: Zombies
202520.description:
[From the Introduction.]***




Within its pages you’ll find such terrors as the Brain Zombie, Colossus, Fast Zombie, Rotting Zombie, Zombie Warrior, and various monster and beast zombies.

These zombies are the perfect minions for such villains as:

Necromancers, sorcerers, Dark Lords, evil high priests,




liches, and other powerful Fantasy adversaries

Voodoo priests in Pulp Hero and Horror Hero campaigns
Mystic supervillains and organizations in Superhero campaigns. For example, in the Champions Universe, villains such as the Takofanes the Archlich, the Demonologist, Dark Seraph, and Black Paladin might have zombies serving them, and the Morbanes of DEMON could easily raise some zombies from the dead to further their fiendish schemes.

202522.name: The Books Of The Undead, Volume 4: Mummies
202522.description:
[From the Introduction.]***




Each volume is devoted to a specific type of undead. This one, the fourth in the series, looks at mummies — the terror of tomb-robbers everywhere! Within its pages you’ll find the Bog Mummy, Godshead Mummy, Space Mummy, and much more.

These mummies are the perfect minions for such villains as:

Necromancers, sorcerers, Dark Lords, evil high priests, liches, and other powerful Fantasy adversaries
Evil mystics and insane archaeologists in Pulp Hero campaigns
Mystic supervillains and organizations in Superhero campaigns.




For example, in the Champions Universe, villains such as the Takofanes the Archlich, the Demonologist, Dark Seraph, and Black Paladin might have mummies serving them, and the Morbanes of DEMON could easily create some mummies to further their fiendish schemes or guard valuable facilities.

202524.name: The Books Of The Undead, Volume 5: Ghouls
202524.description:
[From the Introduction.]***




This one, the fifth in the series, looks at ghouls — terrifying corporeal undead who subsist on the flesh of both the living and the dead! Within its pages you’ll find the Bestial Ghoul, Ghoul King, Ghoul Shaman, and much more.

These ghouls are the perfect minions for such villains as:

Necromancers, sorcerers, Dark Lords, evil high priests, liches, and other powerful Fantasy adversaries
Evil mystics and insane archaeologists in Pulp Hero campaigns
Mystic supervillains and organizations in Superhero campaigns.




For example, in the Champions Universe, villains such as the Takofanes the Archlich, the Demonologist, Dark Seraph, and Black Paladin might have ghouls serving them, and the Morbanes of DEMON could easily create some ghouls to further their fiendish schemes or guard valuable facilities.

202525.name: Ab Chaos (Number 1 - 1990)
202525.description:
From the first issue:

The Chaosium Gossip Zine
The Straight Scoop from the Well* of Chaos

(and not so well)

202526.name: Loki's Wine (City State Module CS2)
202526.description:
From The Back Cover:

You and your party of intrepid adventurers find yourselves relaxing in a local inn after your latest quest. Taking inventory of your hard earned treasure, you notice that one of the black chests you assumed to have contained gold, actually contains an old bottle of wine wrapped in red velvet. The bottle is made of blackish green glass and the label has a pattern of red and black flames. Reading the label you find it is a red burgundy, soft, fragrant, and well balanced, from the fine wine vineyards of Pandemonium. The cork still has its seal of red wax imprinted with a shape of dancing flames. After the bottle is opened and allowed to breathe everyone smelling it's bouquet, all within ten feet of the bottle, will be forced to try a glass of this rare and expensive bottle of wine.

After drinking your glass of wine you find yourself in a three foot diameter, ten foot tall cylinder. The body you possess is not your own, your memory has events and knowledge stored that you have never experienced. You realize as you explore your memory that you have been brought to this place, by the gods to fight for your life, honor or country. On the inside wall of the cylinder is a set of floor plans for this mansion and a list of facts about the duel.

CS2: Loki's Wine is the second module published in the Tarracina Port city state module series. Loki's Wine is a tournament competition module designed for 2-9 players who have a good grasp of the AD&D rules. CS2: Loki's Wine is a generic universal module appropriate for any campaign setting using the 1st or 2nd edition AD&D rules. The city state series of modules are independent modules which all take place entirely within Tarracina Port. These modules cover different genres including: mystery, espionage, action, adventure, horror, quests and suspense. All the modules are appropriate for AD&D's mythical medieval setting. Ownership of Tarricina Port is not required to play this module.

202528.name: Animal Inspector
202528.description:
User Summary

In a dystopian future where there are too many animals, you play a government agent in charge of approving or disapproving pets for the civilian population. Do well at your job and you just might get to keep your dog... but at what cost?

The game is available under a pay-what-you-want scheme on itch.io

202529.description: Alternative art promotional card for the Raging T-Rex given away at Origins 2016.
202529.name: Epic Card Game: Raging T-Rex Alternate Art Promo Card

202530.name: Sea of Clouds: Kitty, Unicorn, Love Ray
202530.description:
Sea of Clouds: Kitty, Unicorn, Love Ray is a set of three promotional cards for Sea of Clouds.
Simply shuffle them with the other Loot cards after setup. Whenever one of them shows up on top of the draw pile, the game is momentarily interrupted. The active player picks the card, reads it aloud and immediately applies its effects. Then, the card is discarded and the game goes on normally.

202531.description: Alternative art promotional card for the Patrol Cutter given away at Origins 2016.
202531.name: Star Realms: Patrol Cutter Alternate Art Promo Card

202532.name: Supernim
202532.description:
From the magazine:

Supernim is a tactical game of skill which goes one better than the old traditional game of Nim.

An ideal candidate for computerisation, Nim has roots stretching back far into the Middle Ages. From a line up of pieces two players take it in turns to remove 1-3 from the board. However if more than one is taken then they must be removed adjacently, either horizontally or vertically. The player with the last piece on the board wins the game.

Nim has already proved a popular computer game with the machine a worth opponent, taking pieces from a screen display. Howver it is normally played in one dimension. In Supernim another dimension is added to make the game a great deal more thought-provoking.

202533.name: Cryptic Entry
202533.description:
From the introduction:

The intrepid Reslin Kine spent many of his years as an adventurer. A life of exploring ruins and fighting monsters garnered Reslin a modest reputation and a modest fortune, enough so that he could retire young from the dangerous career to live out the rest of his life on his plunder.

Unfortunately, the rest of his life would come too soon. It was only a week after he learned his wife was with child that Reslin fell ill to the malady which would ultimately lead to his death. He’d be denied the chance at being a father, but he’d be damned if anyone could deny his son his inheritance.

User summary:

For a party of 4 - 5 1st level characters. The scenario is distributed in two versions - a standard (screen) version and a "printer-friendly (print) version without page backgrounds, etc. The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive that includes both PDF versions as well as several high-resolution PNG map images and a 3-page PDF print-and-play player's handout.

202534.name: Broken Gizmos
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
202534.description:
User summary:

This brief supplement offers random tables and a process for generating numerous methods to "damage" or partially destroy any type of item. For example, a ship is hit for "27 points of damage" and the game master needs to determine what cargo items have been damaged and how they have been damage. This sourcebook will help.

202535.name: 6 Feats for Summon Spells
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
202535.description:
Summon Monster & Summon Nature's Ally

From the introduction:

Six feats designed to augment the most iconic and popular conjuration (summoning) spells, so summoning-focused characters have the same range of options as characters who use feats to improve their metamagic powers, weapon attacks, or skills.

202536.name: 7 Feats for Shamans
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
202536.description:
From the introduction:

Seven feats designed to augment the options and utility of shamans from The Genius Guide to the Shaman. If shamans aren’t used in your game, these feats can instead be used by classes that have the shaman class name or archtype, with any feats that grant bonuses to spirit companions applied instead to animal companions or cohorts.

202537.name: Up for Grabs
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
202537.description:
User Summary

The inlay for this game gives very little away as to what the game is about or how to play. It merely states "To win the game, you must be at Lumbago Seaport before the other players with the required amount of money."

It then gives brief instructions about the basic options open to each player on their turn. These are Travel, Sell, Buy, Discard or Hinder. Travelling involves moving to another location, for a cost and possibly requiring a particular item, or requiring certain items to be left behind. Buying, Selling and Discarding relates to items. Some items allow you to advance in the game, others are traded in an attempt to make money. Finally Hinder is used to slow down your opponent. Other options may appear as required in the game.

The inlay goes on to say "Like any true adventurer, the rest is for you to discover, and always remember, in this game, everything is 'Up for Grabs'."

Credits:

By Don Priestley

202538.description:
Vintage cycling board game made in China, it has a magnetic board and comes with 4 large 6cm plastic riders with a magnet on the bottom. The game works with a roll & move mechanic and a mechanism that allows you to select a gear that determines the speed of each cyclist.
Players put bets on each, after the race has finished bets are revealed and the player who put his bet on the winning cyclist wins.
202538.name: Worldchampionship Cycling Race Game

202539.name: Uncommon Callings Book 1: Archetypes for Outcasts, Vagabonds and Pariahs
202539.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the imagination of Secret Wizard comes this collection of ouctasts, vagabonds and pariahs.

Within this work you will find eight archetypes that prime the stealthy, dark and skilful and focus on less common paths:

Brigand (Unchained rogue)
Eye Collector (Slayer)
Lurking Predator (Hunter)
Shawled Viper (Swashbuckler)
Torrent Duelist (Fighter)
Vault Raider (Occultist)
Wildshot (Brawler)
Studied Theosophist (Cleric)




and one shadowy Cavalier Order:

Order of the Veil

202542.name: Back to School in Black Tokyo
202542.description:
From publisher blurb:

This short collection of magic items are all based around school uniforms and some related weapons and accessories.

The entire concept of “School Uniform as armor” was developed to allow players to dress their Black Tokyo adventurers according to anime tropes- save the world, dodge the tentacles, and look super cute doing it! School Uniforms provide a meager AC bonus, but they’re easy to wear, don’t impede spellcasting, and provide a nice framework for additional enchantments.

202545.name: Gateway Pass Adventure Path Part 1: Brighton Road
202545.description:
From publisher blurb:


Where the adventure comes to you!

Adventuring is hard! Inconvenient!

You have to find the dungeon, check for traps, set up camp, go back to town when supplies run low... Wouldn't it be easier if the adventure came to you? Now, with the Gateway Pass Adventure Path, it will!

Bring your 6th-level characters to two action-packed weeks at the Brighton Outpost in the Gateway Pass, and experience the intrigue and excitement first hand! Uncover conspiracy! Face bloodthirsty bandits! Hunt awful creatures intent on consuming the locals, and destroy them!

This story of betrayal, corruption, and revenge takes place on the frontier of two small kingdoms, in a small border fort struggling to return to prominence. When the player characters arrive on the scene, adventure follows close behind them. The Gateway Pass series offers opportunities for a developing location and regular NPCs as the characters discover adventure in their own backyard! The first in a six-part adventure path for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, come explore just what happens when adventure comes to you!

202547.name: Omega
202547.description:
From publisher blurb:

I Was the Beginning. I Shall be the End.

Thousands of years ago, a strange young man named Fitsum rose to power among the warriors of Kush. One of the first Metas of this world. He ate the flesh and blood of his enemies to gain their powers. Establishing himself as a god among men, his cult grew. They called him the Omega (PL 13), as he proved the end to many things.

Omega finally met his match in Princess Sthenia, who fought him to a standstill.The Cult of Omega locked him in stasis to heal. Here Omega remained until recently freed by the last member of his old cult.

Omega now seeks out the most powerful metas to assist him in reforging the world.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

202549.name: Agent Chase
202549.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Queen and Country!

Agent Christine Chase worked for the SIS during WWII. Her efforts to assist the super powered heroes of the day helped win the war for the Allies, and placed her in the category of capable and dangerous women not to be underestimated! Though her relationship with Pendragon was cut short, she remained in the SIS until she retired to the United States.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

202554.name: Opportunist
202554.description:
From publisher blurb:

Opportunity Doesn't Knock... it's Made

I grew up in the favelas, destitute and desperate. I always felt life had more to offer me than poverty and an early grave, but I could never seem to catch a break. That’s when I realized that life doesn’t happen to you—you have to go and get it yourself. So I scrounged up what resources I could and started putting them to use for me.

I may not have formal business training like some people, but I have knowledge of the local area and dozens of contacts on my side. I’ve learned it doesn’t take an educated know-it-all to collect money from people who are willing to give it to you as long as you’ve got the charm to make them think it’s the right thing to do. That’s not something everyone has, but it’s my gift and I’m not about to waste it.

Psi-punk Archetypes: Opportunist is for characters who specialize in making the most out of every situation. This supplement provides further insight into the archetype and offers suggestions for skill selections, Gifts, Faults, and Gear that would be useful to any Opportunist.

202555.name: Frog Prince
202555.description:
From the publisher:

Our story begins with a rash promise made by the well in the castle courtyard. The princess was playing with her golden ball on the edge of the well when the ball fell into the water. The princess was sobbing… in her despair, she even promised the frog who hurried to help her that in exchange for the ball, he may go with her to the palace.
The frog helped gladly, hoping that this girl would finally break the curse and turn him back into a handsome prince once again with her kiss, but when the princess held her favorite toy in her hands again, she didn’t want to keep any of her promises anymore, and she left him. The frog went after her to remind her of her forgotten promise…

User summary:
Game play:

Each player plays with a frog figure.




Starting from the 4 corners of the maze , frogs advance on tiles that are laid face down. When your frog lands on a tile path is discovered.
Make sure you avoid the maid though, she chases the frogs.
When a frog is caught by the maid, it has to start again from a corner of the maze and the path will be hidden again so memorizing what is on which tile is important.

the first player to reach the castle via the path (avoiding the maid) in the middle of the board may kiss the princess, the frog will become a prince now and that player wins the game.

202556.description:
From the publisher:
Every evening, Uncle Bob takes the two dachshund siblings, Spot and Louise, for a walk. While playing with her brother in the park Louise s ball rolls away. Louise runs after it, but she is so tiny that she gets lost among the bushes and objects of the park. When she realizes that she can not see Uncle Bob anymore, she starts to look for them right away.

In the meantime Spot also starts searching for Louise. Which doggie will find the other? A strategy game for children who love to play hide and seek.

User summary
Game play:

The goal is to find the opponent's dog (pawn) before it finds you.
Pawns (dogs) moving on a grid of 5 × 5 squares of 7 × 7 squares depending on the selected difficulty level. Each row and each row contains a decorative element: a leaf, a kite, etc.






On your turn, you roll two dice. The pink dice shows how many questions (1 to 3) you can ask.



The questions are of the "Looking to .... what do you see? ".
We can look to the city (north), the park (south), River (west) or the road (east). With luck, the answers may give the exact location. Often uncertainty remains.

You can then move the maximum number of spaces shown on the black die (1, 2, 3, 3, 4 or 4) to try to reach the opponent's piece.

In this game of hide & seek the player who finds the dog of the other player before his dog is found wins!
202556.name: Hide & Seek In The Town

202557.name: Lovecraftian Horror Namer
202557.description:
From the introduction:

In some dark corners of the world lie creatures and beings that are almost indescribable. To hear their name is to invoke terror, to see them is to bring madness down on a fragile mortal mind. There are simply things in the universe you were not meant to know. And each of them has name.

User summary:

A a formulaic process and random tables to generate "Lovecraftian" names for use in any campaign. Some samples generated with this product include:

- The Abominable Thing of Lenogguathunzalsogoth
- The Abyssal Attendant of Khaxenurathendoxthorc
- The Night Swimmer of Eha-gha
- The Mouldy Ones of Oththoa

202558.name: All that Glitters
202558.description:
User summary:

The game is played in defined stages, with players assuming different roles in each stage, or phase. Event cards are used to generate random events during play (examples are presented in the document, but a complete set would have to be created prior to play) and a simple die roll is used to resolve certain situations. Typically, however, the game entirely is narrative and resolution is attempted through voting.

202559.name: A Village in the Wilds
202559.description:
User summary:

Characters belong to one of four archetypes (Elder, Hunter, Mystic, Guardian), each associated predominantly with one of the four classic elements. Characters have an Attribute in each element which determines how many dice they use in a pool to resolve actions based on that element.

The game was submitted partially incomplete; additional work would be needed before the game would be fully playable.

202560.name: Football Director
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Cassette (Cult re-release) edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Cult re-release) edition
202560.description:
From the inlay:

We think Football Director is the most realistic strategy game you can buy. It uses the absolute Maximum 48K, and if you are into Football then you will enjoy the ultimate Football Challenge.

Can you win the 1st division?

FEATURES

Four Leagues
20 Teams each
38 Game Season
Home + Away
FA/League Cup
Replays: European Cup
U.E.F.A. Cup
Cup Winners Cup
2 Legs: Aggregate
Penalties: Players
Morale: Skill
Field Position
Scored: Conceded
Played: Fixture List
P W L D F A PTS
Scouts: Coach: Physio
Youth Team
Substitutions
Sendings Offs
Postponements
Midweek Games
Injuries: Free Transfers
Bank Repayments
Retirements
Transfer Market
Internationals
3 Levels
Manager of the Month
League Pos
8 Reserves: Promotion
Relegation
Weekly News
Borrowing: Mortgage
Save Game: Interest
Tax: Sponsors
Full Results
Season Tickets
Next Game
Gate Money
Season Counter
TV Cameras
Crowd Violence: Wages
Manager Approaches
Testimonials
Weeks Profit
Name Editor
Tax Rebate
LMTG Counter
League Titles
Sackings
Build Stands

+ Much More

202561.name: Storm of Spears RPG
202561.description:
User Summary

Prepare for an epic 10 hour adventure in the world of Galager.

202562.name: Sport of Kings
202562.description:
From the inlay:

Experience all the thrills and excitement of a day at the races in this icon driven simulation for up to 5 players.

202563.description:
From the publisher:
In Bananas there are cards showing monkeys in three different positions, and banana cards. When it is your turn, you can lay down one, two or three cards to line up three monkey cards. At the end of the game the winner is not the player with the most monkeys, but the one with the most bananas!

User Summary:

Game play:

The 60 cards Bananas are divided into 24 banana cards and 36 Monkey cards. The goal is to recover as many bananas as possible.

When playing cards, rows are formed under a stack of banana cards (banana cards or played in one of the banana pile stacks, the monkey cards in one of the rows), the , a player who can play three different monkey cards under a row wins all the banana cards in that row.
The player who has the most banana cards at the end og the game wins.
202563.name: Bananas

202564.description:
You are working in a popular bakery where cookies sell like...well, hotcakes! With orders coming from all sides, you must be quick when making a box of nine cookies as the client ordered. Once you are done, ring the bell!

In Cookie Box, you need to rearrange cookie tokens to match the order card, then quickly ring the bell and take the order card. The first player to collect four order cards wins, but you must not make too many mistakes in your packing. If you mess up orders twice, you're eliminated from the game!
202564.name: Cookie Box

202565.name: Hector Tayleplufor
202565.description:
The princess is imprisoned in the castle.
All the knights come rushing to save her…To earn a kiss from the princess they will have to: win a sword, trek over the mountain, collect the key to the keep, then cross the river.

(text from publisher's website)

Are you the knight that will save the princess? The first player who can overcome the obstacles and save the princess from the dungeon where she is kept captive wins the game.

How the game is played:

each player (up to 4) has a wooden figure representing a knight, they start in the (4) corners of the board.
the wooden figure of the princess, who is trapped in the dungeons of the castle, start in the middle of the board (castle)
the two dragon figures start in the caves.
during the game the players can gain swords (these are neede to defend against a dragon) or keys
via dice rolls (the dice have no pips but images on them) the swords can be won
in the caves the players can gain cards but beware of the dragons! These cards are needed to gain a key
once they key is obtained the players still need to pass a bridge (a dice is rolled there) and when they do they can free the princess with their obtained key.

the player who succeeds in releasing the princess from the castle wins the game

202566.name: Fly High
202566.description:
Fly me to the moon! Fly High is a quick-playing memory game of flying high and low and pushing the luck to score the most points.

At the start of the game, you lay out a 3x3 grid of cards face down which are valued 10-60 (jumping up by tens). On your turn, you roll dice to determine a minimum number of cards you must turn face up. Now try to fly high by finding the right cards to go up in ascending order. If you flip a card that has the same value or lower, then all cards are turned face down again and it is the next player's turn. Try to push your luck and flip more cards than the dice tells you, and maybe you can even earn a set of three cards of the same color for bonus points.

When you score, you remove cards, then fill the gaps in the grid. When the deck runs out, the game ends, and whoever has earned the most cards wins!

202567.name: Babel 2.0
202567.description:
User summary:

Characters are defined by Traits and Skills. Characters can also have Abilities (e.g., "photographic" memory, etc.), Conditions (e.g., "Bad Reputation", "Exhaustion", etc.) and Relationships. Skills, whether physical or Knowledge based, are used to modify card draws during action resolution. The game uses a stripped pack of French playing cards for these draws; a custom card deck is used to generate narrative events (provided as a print-and-play component in the document).

The game assumes the setting will be collaboratively created, then specified by the game master.

202568.name: Band Together
202568.description:
User summary:

This experimental and highly unusual game attempts a storytelling roleplaying session created by and through musical improvisation. The game requires the use of a software audio package called Audacity, distributed as a free download (it is an open source project).

The game is distributed as four Google Documents:

- Game Chef 2014 (1-page introduction)
- The Dossier (4-page rule set)
- How to Audacity (2-page Audacity how-to)
- Video Scripts (5-page play sample, transcript)

202569.name: Bar Boasting
202569.description:
User summary:

This exceptionally simple game involves the characters sitting in a public space after a successful adventure and telling tall tales to the locals. The trick of the game is to impress the locals without contradicting the lies being told by the other characters.

Characters are defined by simple traits - a Heroic Nature and a Fatal Flaw. Resolution involves flipping two coins.

202570.name: Scribble Space
202570.description:
User Summary

Draw a ship and fly it, blasting away paper drawn animation.

202571.name: Tic-Toc-Tower
202571.description:
User Summary

You must exit a room within a certain time limit, 10 seconds.

202572.name: Cool Kids
202572.description:
From the introduction:

We will play through four days of school. The first three will be right before some impactful event the opening night of the next Harry Potter movie, or the Student Council mandated My Little Pony Day, or the school trip to the lake. We’ll each have to decide something which character to dress up as, which pony to wear on your shirt, or what activity to dress for. The cool kids will all make the same choice. The cool kids are the ones who make the same choice.

The fourth school day will be right before the big party. Here, you'll decide whose party to go to. The cool kids all go to the coolest party. The coolest party is the one the cool kids go to. The pecking order at the time of the parties will determine the winner of the game, as well as the second place, third place and so on. This is a game in which you play for position. After all, most people know they'll never be the queen, so they vie to be her favorite drone.

User summary:

The game includes three files

- Index (1-page PDF with links and short description)
- Cool Kids (5-page google doc - game rules)
- Reference Sheets (6-page PDF - supplemental rules and materials)

202573.name: The Great Reaping
202573.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are thinly defined, with all characterization emerging during play. The game uses a system of establishing a list of potential "core values" for a society. Players then eliminate core values they don't like until only three remain. Next, a list of heresies is established. The Great Reaping then begins with the characters examining the values and the heresies to make determinations.

boardgameintegration: Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies
202574.description:
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest is a non-collectible expansion to the Ophidian 2350 arena combat game as well as a standalone game that pits futuristic gladiators against each other using unique and thematic mechanisms.

In the game, each player brings a team of up to four gladiators to the table, along with a customized deck that's driven by the selected gladiators. Gameplay revolves around a momentum-based system that allows the player with the momentum to continue to take actions until they lose momentum, at which point their opponent picks up and continues.

Players use resources to supply their gladiators with equipment and minions (support characters). The crowd gets involved through cheer and also provides an alternate victory condition. Win the crowd, and you win the game!

Mix and match cards from any Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest decks:

Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies




Playing with four players will require a total of four playable decks.

Many character options, 4 different win conditions, and a large number of in-game choices/options makes this a truly unique and engaging game!
202574.name: Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard

202578.name: Spy Party
202578.description:
From the introduction:

You have received an invitation from a friend named Anna to attend a makeover party, to try out a line of cosmetics she's selling as a side gig. You have reason to believe that you will meet contacts at the party to whom you must pass on the vital secrets you have learned from your spy work, and from whom you may learn more details to flesh out your partial intel. But when you arrive, you don't recognize any of the others – at least in their current disguises. For all you know, there are some normal civilians (or worse yet – double-agents betraying your homeland to the USA!) at this party. You'll need to disguise your exchange of intel in the form of trivial gossip until you're sure who you can trust.
...
Your secret briefing contains a code for painting other party-goers' nails. When certain events occur, you should paint one nail of the appropriate person the indicated color.

202579.name: Emoji Wars
202579.description:
Emoji are not new to this earth...

They have lived in an unseen parallel dimension for thousands of years engaged in fierce battles to find their one, true ruler. Now you can join the fight.

In Emoji Wars, players choose a commander, form an army of allies and use magic and weapons to battle their opponents for dominance over the Emoji empire.

When a player's commander has been killed, that player is out of the game. The player with the last commander standing wins Emoji Wars and rules the Emoji Empire... until the next battle!

The general idea is easy - Players pick a Commander, choose 3 Allies and then battle their opponents with magic spells and weapons. The numbers on the cards line up so you can see if a character has the ability to wield a particular spell or weapon. You can also see how many "Life Points" a character has or how much damage he has taken from a weapon or spell.

1. Card Types
Gold: Commander
Green: Ally
Blue: Spell
Red: Weapon
Yellow: Energy

2. Reading the Cards
Each card has information about the character, spell or weapon in the numbers below the image. A character card shows life points, magic or strength ability and the energy needed to launch an attack. Weapons and spells cards show how much ability is needed to use them and how much damage they will do to a character by reducing his life points.

3. What a Hand Looks Like
After a player has their "Army" assembled, they draw weapons and spells cards from the blue and red decks. Energy cards are included in these decks and get chosen randomly. A player's hand is visible to the rest of the table. Note that there are also "Shield" cards that add to a character's life points.

4. Attacks
On each turn a player can attack his opponents if they have the weapons and engergy needed to do so. As an example attack, Orin is using the Deep Freeze against Garlon. The spell card is placed under Orin to show that his life points have reduced by 30. On a later turn, the player draws a Shield, which he adds to Garlon to increase his life points to 30. This is how much damage it will now take to remove him from the game.

5. Win
When a player's Allies have been killed off, he fights with his Commander. If his Commander is killed he is out of the game. The last player with a standing Commander wins Emoji Wars.

202580.name: Globetrotters' Guide to London
202580.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life; for there is in london all that life can afford.”
—Samuel Johnson

In London one can stroll past grand buildings, marvel at the cultural wonders of the many museums and art galleries, and sample exquisite food at exclusive restaurants. Take a wrong turn, though, and one enters a world of poverty and thievery; a world where human life is cheap and citizens are packed into slums like rats who cannot leave the sinking ship. This Ubiquity-powered guidebook to Victorian London in the 1890s includes…

An overview of how London works, including topics such as accommodation, climate, communications, death, entertainment, lighting, policing, and transportation.
A tour taking in over 120 locations.
Statistics for 39 major historical and literary personages and 20 stock characters.
The names of important ambassadors, government official, military leaders, museum and gallery curators, newspaper editors, and religious leaders.
Advice on how to run city-based adventures and 19 adventure seeds.
Four Leagues of Adventure, six sample player characters, and eight henchmen.

boardgamepublisher: Bushiroad South East Asia Pte. Ltd.
202581.description:
Ascendants of Aetheros is a thrilling stand-alone card game combining strategy, skill and a little bit of luck. The game is ideal for 2 to 4 players. Set in the magical world of Aetheros, players take on the role of an Ascendant, recruit Lightbringers to their cause and compete to become the next Sage by acquiring the rarest Sky Shards.

Players are supported by their Empyreans, their partners who will assist them in their quest. Empyreans, Lightbringers and even Sky Shards have unique and interesting abilities that will help the player achieve victory. In addition, players can use Action cards to hinder their opponents, protect themselves, and even power up their cards!

Sky Shards grant the player Ascension Points, and the first player to attain 125 Ascension Points wins the game. If there are no more Sky Shards left, the player with the highest amount of Ascension Points wins the game.
202581.name: Ascendants of Aetheros
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016

202582.name: Trellis
202582.description:
The trellis is blooming, and flowers begin to decorate the interweaving pattern of vines. On this trellis, 2-4 players will compete to grow their vines the longest and bloom their flowers first and fastest.

In Trellis, players have a hand of hex tiles depicting a variety of vine patterns, as well as an inventory of 15 individual flowers in their color. The goal is simple: Be the first out of flowers, and you win. When you place a tile, you may place a flower on an unclaimed vine. In addition, all vines that connect to claimed vines on other tiles also receive flowers. If you help out an opponent (or opponents) with flowers, you receive extra flower placements, first on the tile placed, if possible, or anywhere on the board if the tile has no further choices.

202583.description:
In ancient prehistoric times, you have discovered a new land with plentiful lakes, mountains and forests (and apparently many stone rocks that shall be called dice). Your people can develop new things like basketry or find oxen or simply grow and conquer.

In Rise of Tribes, players control a tribal faction in prehistoric times that's looking to grow, move, gather, and lead their people. The board is modular, composed of hexes in various terrain types. Each turn you roll two dice, and may select from four actions. The power of your action depends on your die roll PLUS the last couple of dice on that action card. Victory is possible in a couple ways: gathering resources to build villages and/or completing development and achievement goals for your civilization.
202583.name: Rise of Tribes

202584.name: Stripes
202584.description: In Stripes, players have a row of seven cards on the table featuring many horizontal lines in a variety of colors. The goal is to make a single stripe of one color across your card set. Each turn, you select one of the action cards to change your cards: flip, swap, steal, draw, etc. There are a certain set of actions available each round, depending on the number of players. How many moves will you take to complete your stripe and win?

boardgameintegration: Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
202585.description:
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest is a non-collectible expansion to the Ophidian 2350 arena combat game as well as a standalone game that pits futuristic gladiators against each other using unique and thematic mechanisms.

In the game, each player brings a team of up to four gladiators to the table, along with a customized deck that's driven by the selected gladiators. Gameplay revolves around a momentum-based system that allows the player with the momentum to continue to take actions until they lose momentum, at which point their opponent picks up and continues.

Players use resources to supply their gladiators with equipment and minions (support characters). The crowd gets involved through cheer and also provides an alternate victory condition. Win the crowd, and you win the game!

Mix and match cards from any Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest decks:

Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies




Playing with four players will require a total of four playable decks.

Many character options, 4 different win conditions, and a large number of in-game choices/options makes this a truly unique and engaging game!
202585.name: Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve

202587.name: Linelight
202587.description:
User Summary

Linelight is an abstract puzzle/stealth game where the player takes on the role of a bright line that can move along slightly less bright lines. While avoiding red lines and manipulating the world by using switches and unlocking doors with keys, the player must guide the bright line to the diamond to continue it's journey through the world.

202588.name: 20th Anniversary Edition Vampire Ready Made Characters
202588.description:
From the back of the book:

Running a one-night game of Vampire: The Masquerade 20th Anniversary Edition?

Wanting to start up a new chronicle, but your players aren’t sure what to play? Looking for some examples of how to use the material in Lore of the Clans?

Thanks to our generous Kickstarter backers, these thirteen ready-made characters cover each of the vampire Clans. Each character is provided with background, roleplay suggestions, art, and some potential coteries and plot hooks — everything you need to start your endless nights as one of the Kindred.

Vampire: The Masquerade — 20th Anniversary Edition and Lore of the Clans are needed to use these characters.

This book includes:
• Thirteen pre-generated player character, with both starting and experienced character sheets.
• A brief break-down of the character’s history and roleplaying suggestions.
• Six possible coteries for these characters, complete with coterie charts.
• Seven plot seeds to help the Storyteller jumpstart her chronicle.

202589.description:
A huge meteor containing some form of extra-terrestrial life crashes to Earth somewhere in the icy wasteland of Antarctica. The American government sets up a secret facility whose goal is to contain and examine these new and unfamiliar lifeforms — but something goes wrong. A huge storm damages the station, destroying vital systems. The alien microbes escape and begin to spread and conflict with each other, while the station's human inhabitants rapidly succumb to the cold. The last survivor, afraid of what the microbes could do to humanity, initiates a self-destruction procedure. There are four minutes left...

Chromosome is an asymmetrical, tactical board game for 2-4 players. As an alien microbe, unaware of your impending doom, you struggle to survive and to escape the laboratory. As one of four microbe species, you have four general and four unique actions to take during your turn. You use them to spawn your microbe, fight other microbes, manipulate energy, create radioactive spaces, and finally mutate – to get new genes (four different types) that will help you to fight better, grow faster, and overcome your opponents. Your goal is to create the most effective set of genes to thrive in an environment that might be different each time you play.

You win the game and escape the station if you have more population tokens on the board and more enemy microbes destroyed than any other player.
202589.name: Chromosome
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys
The Game Pit: Episode 74 - Spiel ‘16 Treasure Hunt Part 4

202590.name: Trap House
202590.description:
Trap House is a 1-8 player top-down competitive brawler where players MUST leave friendships behind in order to ensure their own escape. Can you outlive your friends?

Source: The Developer Website.

202591.name: Alice in Shroomland
202591.description:
Alice returns from Wonderland only to go back to her same, old, absolutely boring life. She wakes up, has tea, plays croquet, strolls through the gardens, and then goes to sleep at night only to soon repeat her daily, mundane, routine.

Alice becomes very disappointed with the simplicity of her life and decides to go out on an adventure. She travels to where she fell down the rabbit hole but alas, there is none when she returns. She sits and thinks and thinks and sits.

All of a sudden, a flower wiggles out of its seedpod underground, squiggles through the grass, and grows right up in front of her. Before her very eyes a wild white rose blooms and when the petals open, a small vial is revealed. “Eat Me” reads a tag on the bottle. Alice cocks her head to the side and thinks, “This seems familiar. Eating organic is safe, so this must be safe”.

In a dimwitted manner, she opens the vial, chews the contents, and swallows, tossing the vial behind her when finished. Alice sits there and stares at the clouds, as she often does. Not soon after, Alice begins to feel light headed. She then finds herself falling down a hole that opens up beneath her. Here we go again…

There are (3) game modes in Alice in Shroomland; Cooperative Board Game (1-4 Players), Competitive Board Game (2-4 Players), and Alice in Shroomland The Card Game (2-4 Players).
Cooperative Game Mode (Approximately 2 - 3 Hours): In Cooperative game mode Players control Characters called Trippers (the good guys). Players work together and take turns moving their Trippers around the open game board to enter flipped down areas called Dimensions. Dimensions contain lurking Evildoers (the not as nice guys). These Evildoers must be defeated!!! They are trying to ruin the trips and fun of Shroomland's denizens!

Next comes battle. When all Trippers who intend to engage in battle are ready, the Tripper calls out "I'm ready to Trip!" When this is done, all entrances and exits to the dimension seal and battle commences until all Evildoers or all Trippers in that dimension have been defeated! A defeated Character is called "Unfortunately Sober.” After 3 turns, Unfortunately Sober Trippers return to The Rabbit Hole which is in the center of the game map. After all Evildoers in the dimension are defeated, each Player gets treasure. Evildoers do not come back after being made Unfortunately Sober.

This process of traversing the map and defeating Evildoers is completed until Players reach The Dark Forest. The Evil Magic Mushroom Leader resides in The Dark Forest. This is the final battle! Lose against The Evil Magic Mushroom Leader and the game is lost.

A few things to note:
- The Dimension tiles are drawn randomly so every time you play is a different board layout.
- Each Dimension has a random "What's Here" card. It contains the number of Evildoers in the dimension, who controls the evildoers in the dimension, the number of treasures each Player receives after battle, and the random Dimension effect affecting the dimension, which could be either beneficial or hindering to the Trippers and Evildoers.
- Players gain additional Trippers as they adventure Shroomland. These Trippers are hiding! Traverse Shroomland to find them all!
- Power-ups and curses are found while adventuring Shroomland. They help or hinder a Character. Some permanently increase the number of dice rolled to attack, others reduce Trip Speed, along with other effects.
- Magical Shroom Effects only affect the Characters YOU control. If you cause it, you deal with it!
Competitive Game Mode (Approximately 1 - 2 Hours): In competitive game mode, Players control BOTH Trippers and Evildoers on an open game board collecting mushrooms throughout Shroomland. Each Dimension a Player ends their turn in yields mushrooms. The first Player to 80 Magical Shrooms wins! But watch out! Battle between Players occurs and it is either you or them! Who’s it gonna be?

A few things to note:
- After (3) turns, Unfortunately Sober Characters do not return until a "Freshen Up" card is played.
- The Magical Shroom Shop is open and ready for business! You can expend mushroom tokens in this shop to buy additional Characters, Curses, Power-ups, Curse Removals, Freshen Ups (Revives), etc.
- Magical Shroom Effects affect the Characters YOU choose. If you cause it, you deal it! Backstabbing at its finest!

Alice in Shroomland The Card Game (Approximately 30 - 45 Minutes): In Alice in Shroomland The Card Game, Players go head to head trying to destroy opposing Players' Magical Shroom supplies! But hurry! At the end of each Player's turn, they will discard a Magical Shroom Token. It's a race against the clock!

A few things to note:
- Players begin the game with 20 Magical Shroom Tokens. These Shrooms are protected by Trippers and Evildoers. Don't leave your defenses open!

- If you end your turn with 0 Magical Shrooms, you lose the game!
- At the end of each Player's turn, that Player discards a Magical Shroom token.
- Players control BOTH Trippers and Evildoers.
- Each turn could mean the difference between winning and losing. Luck and strategy are EQUALLY important in this game mode!
- Players are able to buy from the Shroom Shop! Be careful! You only begin with 20 Magical Shrooms. Spend them wisely!
- The same game components that are used in the Cooperative and Competitive game modes are what is used for Alice in Shroomland The Card Game. No need to buy additional game components to play!

What’s included in Alice in Shroomland???

The components of Alice in Shroomland include:

(2) Alice in Shroomland game boards
(6) Boss Dimension Tiles
(16) Fun Dimension Tiles
(12) Tripper Stat Tiles
(24) Tripper Level Up Double-Sided Stat Tiles
(8) Boss Evildoer Stat Tiles
(40) Fun Evildoer Stat Cards
(4) Curse Cards
(30) Magical Shroom Effect Cards
(21) What’s Here Cards
(72) Treasure Cards
(60) Character Standees
(40) Green Trip Duration Tokens of 1’s, 5’s, and 10’s
(40) Purple Magical Mushroom Tokens of 1’s, 5’s, and 10’s
(51) Green and Yellow Temporary Power-up Tokens
(4) Double-Sided Tiles (1 side lists out the turn phases for all 3 Game Modes and the other side lists which Characters are powered up in each Dimension).
(1) Rule Set
(1) Set of 8 Custom-made jade green Mushroom Dice with golden Mischievous Mushrooms representing the 1’s on the Dice.

What does my Character get to do???

(Use an image of The Sly Cheshire Cat Stat Tile as an example)
How to read a Character Stat Tile:

Trip Duration is a representation of "Health". Every time a Character takes damage they add (1) Trip Duration Token by the amount of damage dealt. A Character who reaches the Trip Duration listed on their Stat Tile becomes Unfortunately Sober. The Sly Chesire Cat can take 6 points of damage before she becomes Unfortunately Sober.

Trip Speed is a representation of how many actions a Character can take on their turn. Trip Speed resets on a Character's next turn. The Sly Cheshire Cat can take 1 action on her turn.

- Each Character may perform (1) of (5) available actions on their turn. Each action costs (1) Trip Speed. They can either:
(1) Move. Each Character has a “Trip Speed” which is the number of spaces a Character can move each turn.
(2) Brutally Attack. A Character may attack an adjacent Character. This is done by rolling the custom made mushroom dice, calculating the total, and subtracting this from the Character’s current Trip Duration. A Character with (0) Trip Duration is Unfortunately Sober. The mushroom dice scores are Mushroom = (2) points, 3 or 5 = (1) point, and 2, 4, and 6 = (0) points.

(3) Use a Magical Shroom Ability. Each Character has a special power that they can expend mushroom tokens to use. Players start out with a set number of mushroom tokens and find more in treasure chests by adventuring Shroomland and defeating Evildoers. Tripping is unpredictable. It could be the best or worst experience of their life! Each player needs to draw a number of Magical Shroom Ability Effects after using their Magical Shroom Ability. They range from healing, to teleporting, to making Trippers unfortunately sober. Do you dare to shroom?
(4) Move. Sightseeing is fun! Go visit another Dimension!
(5) Do nothing. Simply chill and do nothing.

Brutal Attack is a representation of how many dice a Character rolls when attacking a Character. The Sly Cheshire Cat rolls 2 Brutality Dice while attacking a Character.

Magical Shroom Ability is, as with real mushroom tripping, a personality trait that is amplified when a Character consumes Magical Mushrooms. The Sly Cheshire Cat's Magical Shroom Ability is called "Where did I go?" This means that when The Sly Cheshire Cat activates her special ability, she turn invisible and take no damage until her next turn. While invisible she can also attack a Character.
Magical Shroom Ability Cost is a representation of how many Magical Mushrooms a Character must consume (discard) to activate their special ability. Players start out with Magical Mushrooms (different for each game mode) and gain more the further they traverse Shroomland. When The Sly Cheshire Cat activates "Where did I go?" the Player controlling The Sly Cheshire Cat must discard 2 of the Magical Mushrooms that they have.

Magical Shroom Ability Effects is a representation of how many Magical Shroom Ability Effects cards a Character draws when activating their Magical Shroom Ability. As with real mushroom tripping, tripping in Shroomland is unpredictable. These cards have beneficial and hindering effects. The Sly Cheshire Cat must draw 3 Magical Shroom Ability Effect Cards whenever she activates her "Where did I go?"!

Level Up: All 12 Trippers (The Nice Characters) are able to level up in any game mode (up to Level 5) at the cost of (5) Magical Mushrooms each time they level up. Leveling up a Character changes that Characters current Stat Tile to a more powerful Character Stat Tile.

(Use the image of all The Denizens of Shroomland)
Meet The Denizens of Shroomland!

It wouldn't be a party without guests! Meet the denizens of Shroomland!

There are 24 different Characters inhabiting Shroomland. Of these 24 Different Characters, the 12 Trippers are able to level up from Level 1 to Level 5.

Trippers (the good guys) include:
