The Beguiling Alice - Although dimwitted, she loves to adventure. She enjoys running into unknown areas of Shroomland called "Dimensions" without thinking first. Wait, where did she go? I was just introducing her and she's already gone. Oh! She's over chewing on a boulder. I'll go get her.
The Insane Mad Hatter - Does he really need an introduction with a name like that? He can really take a beating since he can heal himself. Who knew ingesting arsenic for so many years would come in handy for this guy.
The Sly Cheshire Cat - A cat like no other. Enjoys laying in trees, playing with butterflies, and occasionally turning invisible to attack unsuspecting Evildoers. He'll really claw your eyes out if you get on his bad side.
The Pure White Rabbit - The fastest Character in the Shroomland. The Tart Queen has toughened him up over the years which has caused him to learn how to create a magical damage-absorbing shield.
The Tart Queen - Don't mess with this lady! She gets what she wants, when she wants it! Period!
The Tiny Little King - I don't know what he sees in her, but this is The Tart Queen's husband. While very... petite, he controls an army of Mischievous Mushrooms to do his bidding.
The So Stoned Caterpillar - He's off in his own little world. In fact, he hardly moves at all. He is so in tune with his own mind that he can telepathically attack any Character from anywhere in Shroomland.
The Wingman March Hare - This guy has game! He's up for anything and just goes with the flow. You'll see what I mean when you activate his special ability.
The Drunk Dormouse - The exact definition of a lush. He may be tiny, but you would be surprised how strong this little guy can become after having a few too many cocktails!
The Flightless Dodo - While he may not be able to fly, that hasn't stopped this ambitious bird from soaring to the top! Watch out! He lays egg bombs and knows exactly how to throw them!
The Badass Duchess - Nobody ever gives this woman any credit! She picks up after the spoiled Obnoxiously Whining Baby! If she can handle that and put up with The Tart Queen, then she can surely take down some Evildoers... and if she doesn't want to deal with them, then she can just use her awesome black arts skills to curse Evildoers and let someone else deal with them.
The Obnoxiously Whining Baby - Have I said enough? If you are near him, his deafening cry will not only paralyze you, but will also make your eardrums bleed.

Junior Evildoers (the weak bad guys) include:

An Unbelievably Fake Chair - Did that chair just move? Watch out! This chair throws splinters at passerby's.

A Mischievous Mushroom - These little guys are the minions of The Evil Magic Mushroom Leader. Wherever these little scamps go, magic surely happens.

A Scandalous Oyster - Just one look at these little cuties and you will lay down your weapons... or at least that's what they want you to do. Talk about a bait and switch... pun intended!

A Smelly Flower - After you realize your companion didn't fart you'll realize your in danger. These flowers pack a powerful and toxic stench.

Boss Evildoers (the really strong bad guys) include:

The Cannibal Cook - He would love to have you over for dinner... literally. The Cannibal Cook enjoys throwing pepper at anything that moves. When the victim starts sneezing uncontrollably is when he makes his move.

The Ninnyhammer Tweedledee and The Ninnyhammer Tweedledumb - Twin brothers to eachother, and 30 seconds apart. The two brothers have grown up and walked different paths through life. One brother has become a bonafide healer using reason over strength while the other brother smashes everything in sight while focusing on strength over reason.

The Tart Queen's Ugly Reflection - Okay I have to admit if I were stuck in a mirror with The Tart Queen all day I would probably be Evil too! Don't get too close! The Tart Queen's Ugly Reflection can swap bodies with her victims.

The Vapid Daisy Sister - One of three unique sisters, The Vapid Daisy Sister is the youngest of her sisters and is also dumber than a rock. However, her cheerful personalty makes up for what she lacks in brain power.

The Vapid Rose Sister - The second of three sister, The Vapid Rose Sister is a seductress like none seen before. She lures her partners in with her curvaceous appeals until within her grasps and then lets loose with her thorns.

The Vapid Tiger Lily Sister - The third of three sisters, The Vapid Tiger Lily Sister knows what she wants and takes it! She is able to rally followers and take what she wants by force.

The Evil Magic Mushroom Leader - The Evil Magic Mushroom Leader is the unofficial Evil King of Shroomland. Nothing happens in Shroomland that he doesn't know about. He has the power to release spores causing any Characters nearby to instantaneously trip.

LET THE PARTY BEGIN!!!

202592.name: Star Wars: The Force Awakens – Beginner Game
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
202592.description:
Description from the publisher:

The perfect entry into the Star Wars roleplaying experience for players of all skill levels, Star Wars: The Force Awakens – Beginner Game introduces a complete, learn-as-you-go adventure that carries you from the sands of Jakku deep into the heart of a mystery that could change the course of the galaxy. Everything you need is right at hand. Pre-generated character folios introduce the basic rules, while custom dice and an exciting narrative gameplay system advance your story with every roll. Open the box, select your character, and let the Force flow through you!

Star Wars: The Force Awakens – Beginner Game draws upon the core mechanisms shared by Star Wars: Age of Rebellion, Star Wars: Edge of the Empire, and Star Wars: Force and Destiny. Players interested in continuing their Star Wars adventures can do so through any of these fully compatible systems.

202593.name: The Endless Dwarven Land
202593.description:
An expansion for The Endless Land, this brings the Dwarven realm into to the mix. Adds the ability for up to 5 more players to join the game.

Includes 4 modular map boards, 5 characters, over 300 tokens, and over 30 quest cards.

202594.name: The Endless Elvish Land
202594.description:
This expansion for The Endless Land adds the expansive Elvish realm to the game. This expansion adds up to 5 players to the game.

Includes 4 modular map boards, 5 characters, over 300 tokens, and over 30 quest cards.

202596.name: OESE
202596.description:
OESE is a game about travelling across the galaxy in search of a planet to colonize. Along the way, you'll encounter various alien races, unexplored planets, asteroid fields, old satellites and many others to shape your journey and lead you down a unique path to your new home. Assigned a ship of 50 loyal crew members, you must make choices that determine the outcome of these encounters in an effort to make peace with your neighbours in the universe. Through research and a few useful ship modifications, you will gain more and more control over the outcomes of the encounters you face. Making friends might not be so easy when you're low on power and the only way to get some is to take out a Xenerian. Perhaps if you show an enemy compassion they will send someone to help repair your ship.

​OESE is about decisions and consequences. Good luck captain...get out there and earn your place in the universe.

Source: The Game Website.

202597.name: Kaiser's Gate Field Manual: Mounts
202597.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In war there are many secrets, and in Field Manual: Mounts for Kaiser's Gate the secret of mounted cavalry is revealed. This book, written by Bill Ogden, introduces you to the various cavalries being used during World War I. From the Pegasus mounts of Greece to Russia's magical huts, you will find it all. The book includes more than just information on mounts, this Field Manual builds upon some of the items alluded to in the original Kaiser's Gate. Just some of the topics waiting to be discovered include: Background on the war's origins in Serbia, the effects of the war in Greece, introduction of new Savage Worlds characters, new magic rituals to add to your game, new magical equipment, and a selection of new creature. All of this and more awaits your discovery.

202598.name: Al Abordaje!
202598.description:
English translation of product description:

This playset takes place in the Caribbean of 1672, during the Golden Age of Piracy.

The military power of imperial Spain in the New World is in decline, while the English, French and Dutch are rising as colonial powers. In the Caribbean, it falls to the governors to confront new threats. The islands change from dream to stew and these countries can only send token military forces, so some governors are forced to enlist the help of buccaneers as mercenaries and corsairs to defend their colonies and markets not only from other nations, but from the multitude of pirate ships that dwell in the region as well.

One of these ships, The Lady Lisbeth, has put into port at Santa Catalina in search of a little fun and supplies before a long voyage out to sea.

This playset is written in Spanish and is not available in English and uses art recycled from Jason Morningstar's Fiasco playset covers.

202599.name: Benavente
202599.description:
English translation of product description:

In a place where drugs, fights, smuggling and bribery are quotidian things surprising no one, what new surprises can we give Benavente? The truth is nothing, but there are always new stories and people to tell them or change them...

This is a Spanish language playset and is not available in English.

202601.name: Ikiseutu: The Pocket-Dimension in Between
202601.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Ikiseutu ("Timeless Parts"), a small hexcrawl location surrounded by inpenetrable fog. You must travel through this mysterious place to get out. In your travel you will meet weird places, people and dangers.

No stats, so you can throw this easily in any game you prefer to run!

202602.name: Hipsters and Hamsters
202602.description:
From the publisher:

Hipsters and Hamsters is a light card game for individual or team play. To begin play, each player is dealt four cards. In a unique twist, players can win the game in one of two ways. Players win as a Hipster by having no cards in their hand at the end of their turn. Players win as a Hamster by having eight (or more) cards in their hand at the end of their turn.

There are four card types. Object cards serve as simple discards. No action is taken when Object cards are played. Action cards trigger the action shown on the card when played, helping players eliminate, or accumulate, cards. Calamity cards can be played at the start of an opponent’s turn, forcing the opponent to take the action on the Calamity card. Comeback cards can be played on Calamity cards, in which case it becomes the turn of the person playing the Comeback card. Depending on the Comeback card, that person either takes the action on the Calamity card, or ignores it, before starting their turn.

Despite its pick-up-and-play game mechanic, Hipsters and Hamsters is filled with dynamic and precisely-balanced strategy, as opposing sets of victory conditions cause players to flip between playing styles in reaction to draws and opponent actions, all while attempting to control turn order to alter the flow of play.

In the Basic game, players do not declare which character style (Hipster or Hamster) they are playing as and can switch between styles at any time, as many times as they wish, allowing them to adjust their strategy on-the-fly. In the Advanced variant and Team play, players declare their character style in advance and receive bonus points for winning the round as their declared character.

202603.name: Fiara Gravenrune
202603.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fiara is a neutral good female elf with magus levels utilizing the esoteric archetype. She combines arcane casting with unarmed combat techniques and excels in grapples and holds. Fiara utilizes magical tattoos granting her a variety of spell-like abilities to supplement her martial prowess.

Product Overview

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

202604.name: Sector K-6 Supply Depot
202604.description:
From publisher blurb:

The government-run Supply Depot in Sector K-6 isn't the best place on the planet to work. The team of clerks, drivers, loaders and security that staff it are usually bored. There's not much to do in the Southern Wastes - in fact people aren't really sure why the government bothered to establish a supply depot there. So, staffed by disinterested 2nd-rate staff, miles from anywhere, forgotten by everyone - which makes it the perfect place for a raid by smugglers!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting a futuristic supply depot on a dry wasteland planet. Crates and boxes crowd the concrete courtyard, and fill the warehouses and store rooms of the facility. Ideal for W40K, Firefly and Star Wars games.

Also included is a 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT. (n.b. gridless version only available as jpeg)

202605.name: The Arcane Initiate and Arcane Patrons
202605.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of the Player Paraphernalia offers an alternate look at the witch, providing a bookish archetype along with eight new patrons based on the eight traditional schools of magic. In addition, two new feats and a new hex is included that work well with the Arcane Initiate archetype.

202606.name: Monastery of the Marble Palm
202606.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the ocean’s shore, amid steep-sided sand dunes, stands Alrakkham’s Glory—a 50-foot-tall, salt-encrusted hand carved from a single piece of blue marble. Despite being older than recorded history, the gigantic monolith shows little sign of weathering or damage and is famed for the many bizarre—and no doubt magical—phenomena plaguing the surrounding area. Localised earthquakes are common here and at night the veins in the blue marble seem to pulse in an almost rhythmic fashion.

Centuries ago, a forgotten mason carved out the interior of the hand to create living spaces that a variety of hermits, eccentrics and strange beings have since occupied. Now occupied by a group of monks who study the mysteries of the marble hand and its unique effects on their ki powers the place is known as the Monastery of the Marble Palm.

Places of Power are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a flavoursome locale such as a remote temple, borderland fort or reclusive wizard’s demesne. Ready to be plugged into almost any home campaign, each installment can be used as a waystop on the road to adventure, the home of a powerful NPC or even as a mini-adventure site in its own right.

202607.name: Portentous Dreaming
202607.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fascinating and mysterious, the world of dreams and nightmare are rarely trod by the average adventurer. But for some, dreams are a potent source of prophecy, direction and warning. Unlocking and interpreting the true meaning of dreams can gift an adventurer great advantages on his quest and provides a valuable tool for a GM seeking to subtly guide his PCs on their quest.

Portentous Dreams provides the tools for a GM to craft exciting and evocative (but maddeningly vague) dreams to guide and/or confound the PCs. Also provided are 18 sample dreams, easily customisable for immediate inclusion in almost any campaign!

202608.name: Living Legend
202608.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Psionics Augmented: Occult project, Dreamscarred Press is working to integrate the new psychic magic from Pathfinder RPG: Occult Adventures into the psionics system from Ultimate Psionics and related products. Within the pages of these releases you'll find new feats, archetypes, items, and more, bringing psionic takes on psychic classes, psychic takes on psionic classes, and everything in-between.

This first release includes the Living Legend, a brand-new soulknife archetype that gains its power by using psionics to invoke aspects of stories. Similarly to the medium, it has a large variety of abilities based on the mythic paths, and chooses which to gain each day.

The release also includes information on playing Soulknives in high-psionics campaigns, and a new crystalline focus item, the crystal bookmark, specifically for Living Legends.

rpg: Daring Comics: The Super-Powered Role Playing Game
202609.name: Daring Comics Training Room Rules
202609.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Daring Comics Training Room Rules is a free PDF download that allows you to see what the Daring Comics Role-Playing Game has to offer.

Included inside the PDF are:

A One-Shot adventure
Ten (10) Player-Character archetypes, ready to play.
The basic Daring Comics RPG rules needed to play the adventure and give the game a test drive.




Curious about the game but haven’t purchased it yet? Let the Training Room Rules give you an idea of how it plays and some of the basics it offers.

Have the game and want some player-character archetype ideas for your group? Download the PDF for free and claim the 10 that are provided here.

Remember, this is not the full ruleset, and does not included a full listing of powers or stunts, invention rules, super-team rules, and lots of other features provided by the complete rulebook.

202610.name: The Witching Wood
202610.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Starting Adventure by Erik Scott de Bie!

A sinister force lurks in the woods, one that has begun to prey on the innocent folk of Respite, a religious community on the edges of civilization. In this adventure, the player characters must come together to save their town against the horror lurking in the haunted forest that stands steeped in darkness and horror. Whether you're just getting started with Shadow of the Demon Lord or you are looking to launch a new campaign, The Witching Wood is one hell of a place to start!

202611.name: The Undercaverns of Gaxmoor
202611.description:
From publisher blurb:

Risen from the ashes the city of Gaxmoor is now enjoying a renaissance. Count Gunshoffhas taken the city under his wing and has begun rebuilding it. To solidify his claims, heturned to other nobles, seeking their aid and vassalage with promises only he could offer.

For with him stands Velparun, a stonemason of ancient lineage and singular abilities, onewhose family hails from ancient Gaxmoor. Through him Gunshoff has promised to build a grand temple to both show his power to all and to have Velparun train master masons for each of those who support him.

With this the locals flocked to join him and travel even now to Gaxmoor to sign withtheir signets.

But Velparun has gone missing, kidnapped and hauled to the caverns far beneath Gaxmoor. All attempts to rescue him have failed and the Count now looks to outside help, professional adventurers to enter the caverns and rescue Velparun. But time is running out, for the nobles are in route, and if they feel as they have been duped by the Count then the only promise they’ll bring is the promise of war.

Plunge into the undercaverns of Gaxmoor! Save the ambitions of a powerful man and rescue a mason of wondrous ability for the promised wealth, the song and the glory that all will remember for time without count!

The Undercaverns of Gaxmoor is a stand-alone adventure for fantasy role-playing games. Although it is set in the Lost City of Gaxmoor in the World of Aihrde, it may be adapted for use in any setting desired with little effort on the CK’s part.

202612.name: Into the Veil: The Matoriksu
202612.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Matoriksu is an angler fish of incredible proportions, twisted by the fell magic of the Veil into a monstrous killer that has a uniquely effective means of ensnaring prey. While squids and sharks may have adapted combat based techniques unrivaled in nature, the Matoriksu has evolved a way to consume lesser creatures without struggle, although the method is far more horrific than gnashing teeth or twisting tentacles.

A free Veranthea Codex encounter for nautical adventurers of 4th level or higher!

202613.name: The Troubleshooters (Pathfinder)
202613.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the deal of a lifetime is put in jeopardy, local businessman Demetrius Flannigan hires the PCs to ensure the meeting goes smoothly. Can the adventurers stop an interfering rival, and ensure the other party, a skittish elf with access to important information, doesn’t abandon the deal?

The Troubleshooters is designed to accompany Tangible Taverns: Trio of Taverns and is suitable for four 6th level characters.

202614.name: Ludothèque
202614.description:
Ludothèque is a game of games collecting and club development. It uses Games Cards system. Players are owners of the game clubs trying to buy good games, organize game tables in order to acquire the most prestige points.

On your turn, you may (1) sell and buy games, and (2) add 1 game to make game table more attractive for gamers. New game on a table must has the same or wider player range, that a previous game's one. Game tables with 3 games are considered completed and give income to their owner.

Game table with easy games gives 1 prestige point, with medium weight - 2, and with heavy games - 3 prestige points. In order to win the game, you must reach 15 prestige points before your opponents do.

202616.name: El Concilio de Elrond
202616.description:
English translation of item description:

The Council of Elrond has met to learn of the situation in Middle Earth, just in time to find a solution to the threat of Sauron. But can they resist the corruption that emanates from the One Ring? We are all that is left, in this meeting of crafty mouths that speak only nonsense; if this brotherhood of the ring should fall, certainly everything with fall with it. Who tells me that the man of Gondor does not want it for himself? Why give it to these chubby hobbits, just so that they can destroy it? This will not happen! The Ring should be mine, only mine, my treeeeeasuuuure...

This is a Spanish language playset and is not available in English.

202617.description:
Trolley Car companies of Cleveland, Ohio. This is an 18xx style train game that begins in 1848 and ends in 1980. There are nine public trolley car companies and one government controlled company. The game also includes eight private companies that are auctioned off at the beginning of the game. Players struggle to keep their trolley car companies from falling into the government controlled railroad. The game ends when the $12,000 bank runs out of funds. The player with the most personal money plus stock share value wins the game.

The game has eight phases. The first permanent trolley car is the '8'. Phases 4 and 5 represent the Great Depression and revenue declines during this period of the game in which brown tiles are available. Brown tiles only contain one station space. Upgrading a two station space green tile to a single station space brown tile removes a station marker from the board, which simulates trolley companies shrinking during these two phases.

Another unique feature is that a board of directors (3 players) controls the government railroad, which is determined by the player that controls the priority deal card from the previous stock round. This will change at the end of each stock round assuming a different player holds the priority deal card.
202617.name: 18CLE
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good The Board and The Jerks That Went to GenCon: Episode 78 “GenCon Reviews”
The Good The Board and The Unfurled: Episode 80  “Expansions”

202619.name: The Devil's Deck
202619.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Part the aether and delve into the future

What does your future hold?

Are you making the right decision?

Ask and the Devil’s Deck will answer.

The Devil’s Deck allows you to look into the future and discern what your best course of action should be. Harness the power of the deck to make binding agreements with your demon. Chain the demon’s malevolence with the power of the cards and gain the upper hand in negotiations. This deck includes 70 cards meant for play and two card-sized quick guides.

202620.name: Deja la Sangre Correr
202620.description:
English translation of item description:

The finest whitecoats and nurses will fall to the floor with each other at the slightest opportunity. While they fight for the lives of their patients, they fight to stick out in a highly competitive profession. They manage drugs, lives, and organs, spending more than half of their lives between these green walls and under this artificial fluorescent light, and yet we hope that they save us. These messes put on the mask and wait at every corner that passes with a stretcer. The hospital is alive, and through its veins circulate the made and the sick hoping for salvation.

This is a Spanish language playset and not available in English.

202621.name: Shipwrecked
202621.description:
You have been shipwrecked on a deserted island. Can you escape?


=

This is a adventure I wrote for my game group using Memento Mori Theatricks' Parsely system. Please feel free to play it and give me feedback. Hope you enjoy it!

202622.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac (Volume 1 - Jul 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
202622.description:
The Gongfarmer's Almanac
A Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG Zine
Written, illustrated, and produced by the DCC RPG G+ Community

Volume 1: Men & Magic

202623.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac (Volume 2 - Aug 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
202623.description:
The Gongfarmer's Almanac
A Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG Zine
Written, illustrated, and produced by the DCC RPG G+ Community

Volume 2: Monsters, Treasure & Patrons

202624.name: 80's 90's Trivia Game
202624.description: Relive the glory days of Michael Jordan, Iron Maiden, Ghetto Blasters, and Nintendo. 80's 90's Trivia is a totally radical blast from the past! Categories include movies, TV, music, sports, and culture. A card based trivia game featuring questions from the 1980s-1990s.

202625.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac (Volume 3 - Jul 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
202625.description:
The Gongfarmer's Almanac
A Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG Zine
Written, illustrated, and produced by the DCC RPG G+ Community

Volume 3: Adventures

202626.name: Gold Digger
202626.description:
You find a sleepy little gold mining town. How will you make your fortune?


=

This is a adventure I wrote for my game group using Memento Mori Theatricks' Parsely system. Please feel free to play it and give me feedback. Hope you have fun!

202627.name: Entre Rejas
202627.description:
English translation of item description:

Inside a prison, contained by its walls, all the world boils down to getting just a little more freedom and feeding your needs. Smuggling, theft and the extraordinary are the order of the day.

This is a Spanish language playset and is not available in English.

202628.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac (Volume 4 - Aug 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
202628.description:
The Gongfarmer's Almanac
A Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG Zine
Written, illustrated, and produced by the DCC RPG G+ Community

Volume 4: Rules & Campaign Miscellany, Part 1

202629.name: Pop Culture Trivia
202629.description: Pop Culture Trivia party game is hours of trivia fun for fans of everything Pop Culture. From Marlon Brando to Miley Cyrus and Walkmans to iPods, this game is littered with the people, products, and trends that have shaped our world.

202630.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac (Volume 5 - Jul 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
202630.description:
The Gongfarmer's Almanac
A Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG Zine
Written, illustrated, and produced by the DCC RPG G+ Community

Volume 5: Rules & Campaign Miscellany, Part 2

202631.name: Radiotapes Intercept (Issue 1 - Oct 2015)
202631.description:
Radiotapes Intercept #1
Riding the Rails to the Stars

Galaxy War 1939 - Space Operations Executive

202632.name: Imperial Wars
202632.description:
English translation of item description:

A special station the size of a small planetoid. Who was the megalomaniac who imagined this? Do you know how much it's going to cost in sheer resources? And how are we going to hide it from those nefarious rebels so that they don't blow it up before it's finished? The Death Star, they call it. Good name, since they're going to kill us all building it. And that Vader, I get the shivers just hearing his name. They say he's coming to personally supervise all the work. And people have the tendency to die in strange ways when he's around. I don't know, I don't like this new posting. I'd have preferred to stay on at Kashyyyk, as a wookie wrangler.

This is a Spanish language playbook and is not available in English.

202633.name: Quest (Issue 1 - Sep 1990)
rpgissue: Quest: Le Magazine des Jeux de Simulation
202633.description:
Quest: Le Magazine des Jeux de Simulation
Septembre/Octobre 1990

202634.name: Mar del Norte
202634.description:
English translation of item description:

The discovery of oil north of Escocia, this means that Europe can supply its own oil needs, without depending on Middle Eastern nations. People of all social classes, reduced to the same conditions. The food in the canteen, sleep in the habitation compartments, little space and little entertainment. The helicopter brings in new workers every 15 days, the ship brings the food... if time permits it.

This is a Spanish language playset and is unavailable in English.

rpgitemversion: Scenario Two of the Great Game Campaign
202635.name: The Emerald Scarab
202635.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A tale of assassination, murder & terrorism. Can the Globetrotters uncover a terrifying Commonist plot?

As the Thames ices over and the country grinds to a halt, a scientist is found murdered in the north of London, and the globetrotters are called in to investigate the theft of a mysterious device. What they find is a conspiracy that brings the British Empire to the brink of war!

In this adventure, the globetrotters again encounter the mysterious Commonist League, anarchists hell-bent on ushering in revolution through a cataclysmic war, a violent offshoot of the scientific utopian Cosmist League. This time, the globetrotters uncover assassination, murder, and terrorist atrocities reaching to the highest levels of society.

But is everything as it seems? What lies behind the Commonists’ actions, and the disappearance of Nikolai Fyodorov, the mysterious Cosmist leader, in the distant Pamir Mountains? Can the globetrotters solve the mystery before war consumes the Empire?

The Emerald Scarab Conspiracy is the second action-packed scenario in The Great Game campaign. Leagues of Adventure is a Victorian Steampunk setting that is powered by the Ubiquity ruleset.

202636.name: Super Prédateur
202636.description:
To win Super Predator, you must be the first player to host on your territory the super predator - lynx , bear, wolf or eagle - which will populate your area if all the pantry is present. So you have to plant trees and hedges, and maintain your rivers to accommodate wild animals and constitute the fauna - flora balance.

Winning condition:
The first player to have in his territory:

in his forest: a deer, a doe & a boar
in the plains: two partridges, a hare & a sparrow
in the river: a duck, a pike & a carp





If all of the above animals are present the conditions are ready to introduce a super predator (lynx, bear, wolf or eagle) in your territory, the first player to do this wins the game!


Gameplay:

In the beginning of the game each player gets a pawn, 3 event cards and an intervention card.
turns are played clockwise
on his turn a player rolls the dice and moves his pawn the corresponding number of steps. If the pawn lands on a forrest spot he may either plant or remove a tree, on an agriculture spot he puts or removes a parcel, on a fauna spot he gains or removes an animal, if the pawn lands on an event spot he may play an event card.




The moment that a player reaches the winning conditions so that he can introduce a super predator, he wins the game.

202637.name: There Might Be No Christmas
202637.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Santa's presents are gone! We need them back tonight!

Your guests will play the roles of various inhabitants of the North Pole, including elves, reindeer, snowmen, and other creatures from Christmas folklore. Santa Claus has summoned everyone to his workshop. The normally jolly old man has a stern look on his bearded face as he solemnly tells us that his workshop has been broken into and his magic sack of Christmas presents has been stolen! Without the sack, there can be no Christmas.

202638.name: Malachai $tout's Family Reunion
202638.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Everyone predicted a bad reunion. Few expected murder...

Your guests are going to be playing the roles of the largely dysfunctional members of the Stout family, who have gathered at their ancestral home for a family reunion, hosted by the elderly Malachai Stout. None of the Stouts have ever gotten along particularly well with each other, but the promise of a substantial inheritance has encouraged them to at least put on their friendly faces and attend Malachai Stout's occasional gatherings.

rpg: Don Carrasino and the Murdered Mobster
202639.name: Don Carrasino and the Murdered Mobster
202639.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Someone killed the Don's right hand man. He wants answers...

Your guests will play the roles of one of the crooks, killers, mobsters, or gang-members employed by Don Carrasino, a notorious (and notoriously ruthless) mafioso. All of you are regulars at The Joint, Don Carrasino's personal bar.

202640.name: The Thing in the Cellar
202640.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Friendly monsters work together to solve a Halloween mystery.

The guests will be playing the roles of monsters sharing a haunted house. Every year, the monsters open their home on 213 Elm Street to the public on Halloween for a fright-filled haunted house tour. They use the proceeds from the haunted house to buy household supplies for the rest of year, during which time the house stays boarded up and we stay inside. If the townspeople ever discovered the monsters in the haunted house were real, they would certainly drive them away – or worse.

The success of the haunted house hinges on a climactic scene in the cellar, when The Thing is revealed. Advertised for hundreds of miles on every billboard in every direction – “See The Thing!” “What is The Thing? See for Yourself!” – thrill-seekers and the merely curious come from distant cities to see The Thing, and it never disappoints. Those who have seen The Thing eagerly attest that it is the scariest sight they have witnessed in their entire lives. No one seems able to describe The Thing, and they all agree: you have to see it for yourself.

202641.name: An Inquisition of Vampires
202641.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Murder in a town of vampires. The inquisition begins...

Your guests will be playing the role of the eight vampiric inhabitants of the city of Grayston, who have come under suspicion of the murder of Archibald Crane, the Elder of the city. Despite keeping order in the town, Archibald had a knack for inciting the contempt of its residents. Each one of your guests has reason to want to see the Elder dead...

202642.name: A Pryce in Blood
202642.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A treasure-hunting adventure takes a bloody turn...

The guests will be playing the roles of surviving crewmembers of the wrecked pirate ship Retribution. While navigating toward a remote Caribbean island, the purported resting place of the famous Treasure of the Lost Grotto, a huge storm erupted and the ship hit a large reef, splitting the hull. The ship was within sight of the island, and nine pirates, including their leader, Captain Bartholomew Pryce, were able to salvage planks from the wreckage and use them to assist in the swim to shore. The rest of the crew perished.

202643.name: Toy Chest Trauma
202643.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A missing teddy leaves Alicia's toys worried...

Your guests will play the roles of toys belonging to little Alicia Smith, age six. Your lives have always been carefree and happy, until now. Something terrible has happened! Sometime during the night, Theodore Rosy-Felt the Stuffed Bear has disappeared. He isn't in the toy chest, he isn't on the bed, and he isn't on the shelf or behind the door.

202644.name: Murder on Two Wheels
202644.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Who killed The Snake? Find out before cops show up!

Your guests will be playing the role of different members of a sleazy motorcyle gang living in a small town in the middle of nowhere. Most nights are spent drinking and talking bikes at the gang’s favorite hangout, Ma's Roadside Saloon.

202645.name: The Great Canine Follicle Debacle
202645.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Find out which dog will win Best in Mischief this year...

Your guests will be playing the roles of the canine contestants in the Bestbred Dog Show, one of the most prestigious and long-running competitions of its kind. Each year, top dogs of every breed gather at Bestbred, and, groomed to look their very best, compete to be best in their breed, best in their group, and finally, best in show. This year, something terrible has happened and Petunia the Poodle has met with a horribly embarrassing fate! Winner of the top prize in the non-sporting group and the odds-on favorite to take the best-in-show title, Petunia went for her grooming but emerged from her bath completely BALD!

202646.name: Murder of the High Wizard
202646.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your guests will be playing the roles of wizards and faculty of the prestigious College of Wizards.

Murder! The body of High Magus Wilburton was discovered this morning. It appears he died late last night, the night of a full moon. His body was discovered by the College’s head of security, who has gathered the faculty here today to solve the murder.

202647.name: Riversea
202647.description:
In Riversea the players are participating in a fishing contest.

Gameplay:
The board features two tracks, on which your pawns can move. An external track (on the 4 sides of the board) for fishing in the river and an internal track (in the center part of the board) for fishing in open sea.

Each player starts with 15.000$ cash and 15 equipment cards. During the game the players can upgrade & buy new / better equipment.

The first player to accumulate 200.000$ value in money, fish & equipment wins the game.

202648.name: Crésus
202648.description:
The goal of this economic game is to get as rich as possible during the 10 rounds that the games last, so that you can afford yourself to buy a private island.

Gameplay:

Each player starts with 100 million $ starting capital, a pawn and a personal player board in his color that states the possible actions.
Each round consists of 5 phases: in phase 1 an event card is revealed, in phase 2 each player choose secretely in which market he is going to be active (this is revealed simultaneously), in phase 3 each player (in turn order) may choose an open card from the center of the board, in phase 4 player can buy in the markets via a blind bidding mechanism, in phase 5 the player can sell to the markets.




The game ends after 10 rounds, he who accumulated the most money wins Crésus.

202649.description:
A simple Australian children's roll-and-move game produced around the time of the Second Anglo-Boer War (October 1899 - May 1902). Probably published just after Federation in 1900, the game celebrates Australia's new nationhood as well as its participation in the South African conflict, in which the various Australian Bushmen's Contingents played a major part. It follows the path of a typical Bushman, proceeding from his enlistment to training, embarkation, arrival in South Africa, and engagements with the enemy.

The game is basically a re-implementation of the traditional Game of goose, with players rolling dice and moving around a 60-space track. Most spaces have a themed text: Riding test, promoted to lieutenant, ordered to the front, taken prisoner, etc. Some of these spaces also incur bonuses or penalties (moving forward or back a number of spaces, to a particular space, or miss a turn).

The board includes coloured illustrations of bushmen rounding up cattle in the Australian outback prior to enlistment, a street parade of a Bushmen's Contingents, transport ship, field hospital, field prison, troop ship S.S. Medic, and battle scenes showing Australian prisoners guarded by Boers, and Australian troops attacking a Boer position.
202649.name: Australian bushmen

202650.description:
Simple Australian roll-and-move race game around a 100-space oval horse race track. Unlike the real Melbourne Cup which is a straight race, the game features 4 jumps.

The board is monochrome, which suggests an early publication date. The race was first run in 1869 and annually since.
202650.name: Melbourne Cup race game

202651.name: Chinese Card Swap
202651.description: Collect all four cards of your color by swapping with your opponents and the pool, but you can't see what you're swapping for. This game is elegant in its simplicity and will test your memory. It's great for families!

202652.description:
DragonStones are the most sought after precious gems in existence. Be the first to gather a set and harness their power!

Gameplay:

Each player starts with two stones played on their tower and two cards in hand.
Player take turns Mining Gems (taking gem stones from a bag) and following the gem specific rules for that particular gem.





Next, the player draws a card and then gets to choose any of the following three actions:


1. Play a card OR
2. Discard a card to mine and stack 2 gems OR
3. Draw another card


The final turn begins when one player completes (caps) all six spires; then each other player takes one last turn. Then all players count their points.
Points are totaled based on number of gems with bonus points for spires that are all single colored or that contain all 5 colored gems!


The player with the most points wins the game.
202652.name: DragonStone Mine!

202653.description: Simple roll-and-move race game, with a yacht race theme. The board consists of 75 numbered spaces. Players roll dice and move along the track (which looks like the track of a tacking yacht) from the wharf to the winning post. Some spaces have bonuses and penalties.
202653.name: National yacht race

202654.name: Resacón en Las Vegas
202654.description:
English translation of item description:

Being rich hasn't stopped one of you guys from having been dumped by his girlfriend Carlota five days before the wedding. Which of these is the most mature and sensible courses of action for getting over it? 1.- Show up at the church the day of the wedding in case she changes her mind. 2.- Go with your wedding guests to Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, sin city, intending to get back Sindy Dollar, a well-known striptease artist and your highschool sweetheart. 3.- Get drunk, lose yourself in some whores and go raving with your wedding guests. Things quickly go out of control in a suite at Caesars Palace: Drinks, drugs and some past-their-prime porn stars.

This is a Spanish language playset and is not available in English.

202655.description: Simple roll and move race game around a 60-space track, with a yachting theme. 12 of the 60 spaces offer bonuses or penalties. Unusually, each of the 4 players has his own path, parallel to each other, but separate. Probably published in the 1930s.
202655.name: Yacht race

202656.name: La Secta del Mar
202656.description:
English translation of item description:

A group of young people are celebrating the grand opening of their new dot.com business, enjoying a peaceful vacation on board a sailing ship off the coast of Galicia. In search of supplies, they put into shore at the poor fishing town of Imboca, which appears to be deserted. The inhabitants, however, are not pleased with these annoying, noisy interlopers.

They are chased throughout the night by the strange inhabitants of the town, getting isolated from one another, kidnapped and imprisoned by Deep Ones that look like fish. Those that are able to escape quickly discover the dark secret of Imboca: they all worship Dagon, a monstrous god of the sea, to whom all the strangers are offered in a dark ritual...

This is a Spanish language playset and is not available in English.

202657.name: 28 Días Después
202657.description:
English translation of item description:

A powerful virus has been let loose in Great Britain after a break-in at a primate research lab by a group of animal rights advocates. Transmitted through the blood having devastating and immediate impact, the virus leaves the infected in a state of permanent murderous rage. In 28 days, the entire country is infected and a handful of survivors struggle just to stay alive, because the killer virus isn't the only thing that hangs over them, threatening them all.

London is a cemetery. The crowded streets are now empty. The stores are vacant. And total silence reigns supreme. In 28 days the epidemic has extended to the entire country and only a small handful of survivors remain...

This is a Spanish language playset and is not available in English.

202658.name: They Met in a Tavern
202658.description:
An Old School One-Shot Adventure

From the introduction:

They Met In A Tavern is a single set-piece scenario which includes four pre-generated characters. It was originally written for one shot or convention use. Notes are also included for using the content in an ongoing campaign.
...
About a day’s journey by loaded wagon from a good sized trading city, at the edge of a small farming community, sits a moderately successful inn and tavern called The Merchant’s Rest. Due to an unlikely confluence of circumstances, four exceptional people with as many reasons to mistrust each other as they have to cooperate, are about to be caught up in a tide of violence and dark sorcery which will threaten not only their own lives but those of the local populace.

202659.name: The Carlsburg Catacombs
202659.description:
From the introduction:

The village of Carlsburg stands as an end to the Dragon Empire’s longest trade road, ripe with grapes and wine. Most make their way in life by farming, ranching, making wine in the cellars, or working the inns and taverns. The denizens of Carlsburg are an easygoing sort — so long as the soil is fertile. And the soil is always fertile.

Deep underground, beneath the sewers, another service is offered. A vast catacomb accepts the departed (dearly or not) from as far away as the capital. This would normally poison the land above, destroying crop yields and worse still—souring the wine. However thanks to a fungus affectionately called, Gloom, the poison of rot is consumed and in its wake is left an incredibly nutrient rich compost.

Lately though, new tunnels have been appearing on their own. Old corridors seem to move or disappear completely! What the devils is going on down there?

202660.name: Runny Bunny
202660.description:
One player plays the bunny and others play as hungry wolves. Bunny is trying to get to rabbit hole and Wolves are trying to catch the bunny. Bunny wins, if it gets to rabbit hole and wolves win, if they catch the bunny.

The basic mechanism is same as Wings of War. Every card shows were you can place your next card. You just play a card underneath your previous card and that's the place were you animal is. Bunnys cards make it bit slower, but more dexterous than wolves.

In addition to moving cards there is few rabbit holes and fences to make the game surface more varied.

202661.name: Terror In Tarracina (City State Module CS1)
202661.description:
From The Back Cover:

CS1: Terror in Tarracina is the first module published in the Tarracina Port state module series. The city state series of modules are independent modules which all take place entirely within Tarracina Port. These modules cover various genres including: mysteries, espionage, action, adventure, horror, quests and suspense. All modules are appropriate for AD&D's mythical medieval setting. Ownership of Tarracina Port is required to fully appreciate these modules. CS1: Terror in Tarracina is a 40 page murder mystery with a horror twist.

CS1: Terror in Tarracina has been designed for 6-7 characters of 10th level and above. A party wishing to survive this adventure should have a couple of fighter types, a mage, cleric thief and possibly a druid or illusionist. For the best results the party should be equipped with magical items equivalent to their level. The average playing times was around 22 hours. IF YOUR PARTY IS NOT YET READY, BY ALL MEANS PUT ASIDE THIS MODULE FOR LATER, and introduce them to the city and it's inhabitants. Many exciting and enjoyable adventures and mishaps await, for any DM thoroughly knowledgeable about the city and the Advanced Dungeons and Dragons system. No pre-generated characters have been provided because this module has been designed for campaign use. CS1: Terror in Tarracina includes sections with new monsters, encounter tables, victory conditions, and rules for adjudicating illusions.

202662.name: Drakensang Online
202662.description:
Drakensang Online is a browser-based, freemium online role-playing game of the German enterprise Bigpoint. The gameplay is similar to the Diablo game franchise and is developed by Bigpoint Berlin. It is one of the few MMORPGs developed in the European Union. The title was in an open beta phase from August 2011 to July 2012. According to Bigpoint's own statement, there are currently 35 million registered accounts. However, the real number can differ because multiple registrations are allowed. A retail version was released in November 2011.

Source: Wikipedia, "Drakensang Online," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

202663.name: Overhell
202663.description:
User Summary

The theme is supposedly horror as you go up the floors in Satan's hotel, but the emphasis is on shooting and running, all the while clearing a level of bugs and robot to get in the elevator. You can pick up guns on different levels and score HP and ammo bonuses after certain rounds.

202664.description: In Lucha Jefe, you are competing with another fight boss to see who can take home three Championship belts first. Players will draft fighters from a starting pool of 8, each with different powers. They will know which of the four fighters their opponent has to choose from, but not which one they're ultimately sending into the ring. Whoever has the highest strength will win the match, unless their fighter's powers change who wins.
202664.name: Lucha Jefe

202665.name: Cally's Trials
202665.description:
Cally’s Trials is the updated, roguelike version of Cally’s Caves 2 made for Steam.

Source: The Game Website.

202667.name: Mad Scientists!
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP - Launch Episode 11
202667.description:
Test your patience with this 2-6 player card drafting game.

Each player controls a scientist that has one thing on their mind... Irritating the other scientists! This frustratingly fun card game takes aim at the family audience, and is most fun with 6 players.

There are two decks (a community deck and an idea deck), and six 20 sided die that come in each game.

At the beginning of each game, a player receives ten cards. Each player will roll their die and whoever rolls the highest goes first. This will continue clockwise.

From the community deck players find resources to help them along with making their awesome ideas come to life!

To create an idea, each player will need 1 lab coat, 2 schematics, and 2 chemical sets.

In the idea deck are patience testers. Everything from monsters, contraptions, to your favorite TV show!

When coming up with an idea, you never know what you'll get. Idea cards are marked with a + or - on them and can either be played against a player, or on yourself.

When playing a - against a player, this will make their patience go down. Say you come up with a -3 patience card and you play it against someone. Their patience die will go down from 20 to 17.

Also in the deck, are + patience cards. If your patience die is at 17 and you play a +2, you will turn your die back to 19. Players may not go above 20. If a player reaches or goes past 0, the player has lost all patience and is mad. (They are out)

202668.name: Glorantha Phantasma
202668.description:
User summary:

A Japanese-language compilation of Glorantha-based art and articles derived primarily from fanzines and other published sources. Includes several character sheet options, fiction, and summary of Glorantha products available.

Reads "back-to-front".

202669.description:
Promo cards (one for the players, one for the ghost) introduced to celebrate the release of Mysterium: Hidden Signs.

It features a wooden, untreated meeple in the weapon category (choke hazard).

The cards are designated P4.
202669.name: Mysterium: The Meeple

202670.description:
Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails takes the familiar gameplay of Ticket to Ride and expands it across the globe — which means that you'll be moving across water, of course, and that's where the sails come in.

As in other Ticket to Ride games, in Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails players start with tickets in hand that show two cities, and over the course of the game they try to collect colored cards, then claim routes on the game board with their colored train and ship tokens, scoring points while doing so. When any player has six or fewer tokens in their supply, each player takes two more turns, then the game ends. At that point, if they've created a continuous path between the two cities on a ticket, then they score the points on that ticket; if not, then they lose points instead.

Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails puts a few twists on the TtR formula, starting with split card decks of trains and ships (with all of the wild cards going in the train deck). Three cards of each type are revealed at the start of the game, and when you draw cards, you replace them with a card from whichever deck you like. (Shuffle the card types separately to form new decks when needed.)

Similarly, players choose their own mix of train and ship tokens at the start of the game. To claim a train route (rectangular spaces), you must play train cards (or wilds) and cover those spaces with train tokens, and to claim a ship route (oval spaces), you must play ship cards (or wilds) and cover those spaces with ship tokens. Ship cards depict one or two ships on them, and when you play a double-ship card, you can cover one or two ship spaces. You can take an action during play to swap train tokens for ships (or vice versa), and you lose one point for each token you swap.

Some tickets show tour routes with multiple cities instead of simply two cities. If you build a network that matches the tour exactly, you score more points than if you simply include all of those cities in your network.

Each player also starts the game with three harbors. If you have built a route to a port city, you can take an action during the game to place a harbor in that city (with a limit of one harbor per port). To place the harbor, you must discard two train cards and two ship cards of the same color, all of which must bear the harbor symbol (an anchor). At the end of the game, you lose four points for each harbor not placed, and you gain 10-40 points for each placed harbor depending on how many of your completed tickets show that port city.

Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails includes a double-sided game board, with one side showing the world and the other side showing the Great Lakes of North America. Players start with a differing number of cards and tokens depending on which side they play, and each side has a few differences in gameplay.
202670.name: Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
13. Devon Dice Guilds, Thrones and Assassins
Episode 191
Episode 2 - A-B-C, 1-2-3
Episode 31: The Networks Review + Gencon 2016 Preview

202671.name: Nightmare on Azathoth
202671.description:
User Summary

Lovecraft-inspired survival game has you gather food and ammo, trying to stop an alien invasion.

202672.name: Hermaion
202672.description:
From the introduction:

HERMAION n. An unlooked-for and unanticipated stroke of luck; attributed to Hermes.

CONTENT WARNING: GENDERED COERCION: In this game, two male-coded Gods will be attempting to coerce and manipulate a mortal (who may be coded female), using the lives of the mortal’s colleagues, research important to the future of humanity, their own control of the situation, and superior information. Also, time is limited.

202673.description: Other Gods is the dueling card game that pits mythological gods of every tradition together in a pitched battle for divine supremacy. You play as the deity of your choice in the waning days of polytheism, desperately trying to retain your follower base while attempting to convert or destroy those of your opponents'. Win the game by being the last God with a following.
202673.name: Other Gods

202674.name: Ore City
boardgamepublisher: トーホクウィステリア (Tohoku Wisteria)
202674.description:
User summary
俺の街 (Ore no Machi) carries an English title Ore City but in English means "The City of My Own" (ore meaning 'of me' not a mineral ore).

In a different world, land prices are rising sharply and real estates are out of public reach. In the midst of unprecedented construction boom, many City Creators are struggling to achieve fame.

In the card game of Ore no Machi (The City of My Own), players are City Creators who design and build their own cities. Their goal is to gain victory points by accomplishing several public projects. But to do so, they have to earn money by building residential, commercial, and industrial buildings, and then by book closing.

You accumulate your wealth and assets through expanded reproduction; your buildings are cleared upon book closing, though.

You may only build one type of buildings (residential, commercial, or industrial) in your construction space. If you want to build another type, you have to close your books to receive benefit from these buildings and clear your space. But you may use your neighboring players' spaces as well to share the benefit upon their book closing. You should use their spaces wisely to outsmart opponents.

Publisher's summary
こことは違う現在。地価は暴騰し、不動産は人々の憧れとなった世界。
あなたたちは街を作る「シティクリエイター」。誰よりも早く「公共事業」を建築し、10点の勝利点を獲得するのです。
　公共事業には多くの金貨が必要です。まずは「住宅」「商業」「工業」施設を建築し、資金を蓄えるのです。

202675.name: The Heart of the Wild (2014)
202675.description:
From the introduction:

The Story Web sheet will guide you through the game. It is divided into five stages, and you’ll play one of the provided scenarios from each stage before reaching The Heart of the Wild and making your final choice. You'll follow a story path determined by rolling dice.

In every stage, each player frames a scene for their character to show how they deal with the events in the scenario you have ended up in. A scene can be a simple vignette (a solo narrative or description of an impactful moment), or can be a dialogue or action scene involving any or all of the other characters, as the framing player chooses.

202676.name: Dakku: Arcanist - White Mage of Clan Qeykiko
202676.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weave spells to heal your allies and smite your enemies as a white mage arcanist!

Want to add interesting characters to your campaigns but don’t have time to create them? Need new characters at the last minute for you or your players to use during a game session? Wish you had a premade character at the ready to help introduce a new player to RPGs? Characters-By-Level has you covered!

What is Characters-By-Level?

Characters-By-Level (CBL) is a time-saving RPG accessory that offers GMs and players ready-to-play pregenerated characters to be used in games of any level. Each release provides you with stat blocks for one or more characters at multiple levels for a particular RPG system along with profiles detailing their character builds, backgrounds, physical descriptions, and personality traits plus ways to help you fit them into your games. You will also receive high-quality digital character artwork suitable for character sheets, virtual tabletop tokens, visual aids, and desktop wallpapers.

CBL characters are designed to be inserted into your games with a minimum of fuss and additional customization. GMs can deploy them as ready-made NPCs to use as either allies or rivals. Players can use them any time they need a character to play on short notice. Playing a CBL character requires little to no preparation, letting you spend more time playing your game and having fun instead of preparing for it. Less work, more play!

For the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, CBL characters come with complete NPC and PC stat blocks for levels 1-20. NPC stat blocks are based on the 15-point-buy method or the default NPC heroic ability scores. PC stat blocks use 20-point builds with two starting traits. All race, class, skill, feat, equipment, spell, and trait choices are selected from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game’s Advanced, Bestiary, and Ultimate sourcebook series.

Included in this release for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game:

One pregenerated tengu arcanist using the white mage archetype for levels 1-20
High-quality digital character artwork, including full-screen and portrait wallpapers*
Hero Lab portfolios — one file for every stat block




Let Dakku, a white mage arcanist who can cast cure spells, buff allies, and blast enemies, be part of your campaign today!

202677.name: Midnight
202677.description:
User Summary

Making a directional arrow with the mouse, you can catapult your cube towards a lighted square area -- not dissimilar from golf. Midnight, the name of your block, must complete 56 levels, avoiding barbs and a saws. A low-key piano soundtrack pervades.

202678.name: Rusthaven: An Iron Wind Sourcebook for Numenera
202678.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rusthaven is a sourcebook for the roleplaying game Numenera and adds new creatures, organisations, descriptors and foci, new NPCs, a completely new set of Iron Wind-caused mutations known as ‘corrosions’ and, of course, the location of Rusthaven itself. It covers multiple types of Iron Wind, how society reacts to them and the prejudices that exist out of fear and ignorance towards the Wind and the people affected by it. A new system for creating random cyphers created by the Wind itself is included, alongside a collection of new artifacts and oddities.

Filled with new artwork, a complete mini-adventure and several adventure seeds, Rusthaven has everything you need to bring the Iron Wind into your game. Taking inspiration from the body horror subgenre and the weird of Numenera itself, Rusthaven explores both the dark and the bizarre, the bleak and the hopeful.

202679.name: Between Sun & Shadow
202679.description:
From publisher blurb:

Between Sun & Shadow is an expansion for the Tiny Dungeon role playing game from Smoking Salamander. It includes a “light” campaign setting intended to provide the broad strokes of a fantasy world, leaving the fine details to you. It’s designed to spark your imagination with:

5 new player races.
58 new Traits, including a powerful set of Traits known as Carving, which allow Adventurers to manipulate elements, energy, people, and even time and space.
20 new creatures to fight or befriend.
78 plot hooks/adventure seeds.
Random adventure generator – roll some d6 to get an adventure started.
Rules for Adventurer Development.
A land of adventure in a tidally locked world.

202680.description:
This is a set of playable characters that was included exclusively for backers of the Rum & Bones: Second Tide Kickstarter. Each character comes with a miniature, a hero board, and a set of skill cards for use in the game.

The set consists of three boxes and contains the characters listed below.

Captains Promos Set:

Davy Jones (Captain)
Ironclaw (Captain)
Aurelio Voltaire (Captain)
Terrible Tink (Brute)





Mercenaries Promos Set #3:

Captain Hells (Captain)
Viktor (Gunner)
Eric the Beastly (Brute)
Belle Rose (Quartermaster)
Sebastian Lovell (Swashbuckler)





Mercenaries Promos Set #4:

The Man in Charge (Captain)
Maelstrom (Gunner)
Coulter Mcswain (Brute)
Papa Morte (Quartermaster)
El Gancho (Swashbuckler)
202680.name: Rum & Bones: Second Tide – KS exclusives

202681.description:
This is a set of cards and character sheets that allow you to use all previously released Rum & Bones characters in Rum & Bones: Second Tide.

It contains:

Rum & Bones: Second Tide version Hero Dashboards for all previous Heroes (characters released before 2017)
Skill Cards for all previously released Heroes (characters released before 2017)
Updated Kraken and Sea Dragon tiles.
Updated Objective Tiles for Wellsport Brotherhood, Bone Devils, La Brise Sanguine, and Mazu's Dreadful Curse
Updated Tide Decks for Wellsport Brother, Bone Devils, La Brise Sanguine, and Mazu's Dreadful Curse
202681.name: Rum & Bones: Second Tide – Season One Upgrade Kit

202682.name: Love Witch
202682.description:
From publisher blurb:

MAGIC AND DEATH IN A TIME BEFORE HISTORY BEGAN...

After the fall of Atlantis, its far-flung colonies quickly slipped into barbarism, and the final remnants of a once-great culture were swept away by the desperation of people just trying to survive. One of the last masters of the tradition of Philiamancy was Burnick the Love Witch. This is the story of her final battle against the Druids, her arch-enemies.

The Love Witch contains three exciting tales that mix high fantasy and horror by master comics-scribe Marv Wolfman, with gorgeous art by Ernie Colon, Don Heck, and others. The book also contains an all-new feat and talent-based magic system that can be brought into any d20 System and which is far more flexible than is typical, as it is not tied to any class- or level-based abilities. The system is the brainchild of Steve Miller, one-time contributor to the Ravenloft and Dragonlance game settings, and it intends to more accurately reflect how magic works in most fiction, comics, and film sources. Although framed in terms of Atlantis, it was easily be divorced from the source material and applied generically.

202683.name: Feats of Agility
202683.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats of Agility is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the subtle arts of intrigue, from spies and saboteurs to heists, chases, mysteries, secret identities, and the fine art of conversation. If your character is an awesome acrobat or a lithe leaper who always stays one jump ahead of the law and will always dare to cross a bridge too far, he will find any number of fantastic gymnastic tricks with 9 new mythic feats from Owl Swoop and Cat's Fall to Sliding Dash and Acrobatic Spellcaster!

202684.description:
A KS exclusive captain character that came with copies of Rum & Bones: Iron Inquisition that were ordered through the Rum & Bones: Second Tide Kickstarter.

It comes with a mini, a hero player board and a set of Skill Cards.
202684.name: Rum & Bones: Saint Seraphina

202685.name: Goblins
202685.description:
From publisher blurb:

Goblins are the smallest of the goblinoids, a family of related humanoids that includes the larger Hobgoblins and Bugbears. Goblin's small stature and typical lack of initiative mans they are frequently bullied into service to their larger goblinoid cousins. But some dare for a different life...

Explore the world of 5th Edition Fantasy Goblins and find out all you need to know to bring these popular mischief makers out of the bestiary and on to your game table as a playable race.

What does this book have to offer?

Learn more about your these vile and malicious creatures!
Explore your subraces! Nimblefoot, Wolf Master, and Rat Shaman!
Deploy amazing magic items like the Cloak of the Rat, Enchanted Collars and more!

202686.description:
A KS exclusive captain character that came with copies of Rum & Bones: Blutrausch Legion that were ordered through the Rum & Bones: Second Tide Kickstarter.

It comes with a mini, a hero player board and a set of Skill Cards.
202686.name: Rum & Bones: Captain Ridgeback

202687.name: City Blocks 02
202687.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 30 x 48 inch, Battlemap of several City Blocks , it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

We recommend that you buy the Bundle deal below ,as you will get City Blocks 1 & 2 at half price or if you already have City Blocks 1, you will only pay $1 for City Blocks 02.

“We loan to anyone at very reasonable interest rates. “—Pay Day Loans employee

City Blocks 02 is a single level exterior map of a city block with brick roads. This area has a double-sized city block, three large city blocks, one small city block and seven half blocks. The map has over fifty buildings.

City Blocks 02 is intended for use in modern games. It can also be used in post-apocalyptic games as cracks in the sidewalks and road give the city an aged appearance that will fit that genre as well.-

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Pay Day Loansharks: The older brick section of town is a small Chinatown. Legitimate businesses like the Canton Chinese Restaurant are only a few apartments away from a Pay Day Loans shark of an almost criminal nature. The Pay Day Loans is being investigated by the local police as a potential source of counterfeit bills.

The player characters are playing as detectives or police officers. They are tasked with figuring out if the Pay Day Loans is laundering funds and to catch the crooks if they can prove they are the source of the illegal funds on the streets.

An armored car comes in with the loan money every day in the morning and leaves at night. The police have set up a few stakeout areas around town and a small cone blockade on a road they think the armored car is using to get to its destination.

The player characters can try many different tactics to figure out what is happening such as tailing the armored car to see where it is going at night, staking out the pay day loans, breaking and entering the Pay Day Loans to investigate with the danger of being discovered for illegally searching without a warrant.

If the armored car discovers they are being tailed, they flee while firing on the police officers, leading to a dangerous chase through the Chinatown block…

202688.name: Bulldogs! (Fate Core)
202688.description:
Publisher blurb:

Bored with your dead-end job? Tired of your planet-bound life?

Is your bland home world too safe for you? Maybe you owe some money to the wrong people, or maybe the gun just somehow went off and now you have an urgent need of a change of scenery.

TransGalaxy PanGalactic Corporation does not care about your arrest record!

Join the Class D Freight division and in exchange for a simple five-year commitment, you can leave all your troubles behind.

They've got the ship. You've got a pulse. Welcome to Bulldogs!

Bulldogs! is a tabletop role-playing game of interstellar action adventure. Bulldogs! is about freebooting ruffians flying from planet to planet causing trouble.

202689.name: The BoL Hack
202689.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do you get when you mash up arguably the best swords and sorcery role playing game ever, Barbarians of Lemuria (BoL) with the Original 1970s Fantasy Roleplaying Game? That’s the question I asked and this book is my attempt answer to that question, taking the best bits from each. This is massively trimmed down from BoL and includes none of the background material (which you can get from BoL: Mythic Edition or BoL: Legendary Edition) – so you can use The BoL Hack for any swords and sorcery setting you like.

202690.name: Hydraulic Push
202690.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Spell Power PDFs introduce two pages of themed content for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Spell Power: Hydraulic Push includes a handful of new feats for fans of the hydraulic push spell, plus plot hooks to bring your adventurers in quickly using this spell and these feats!

Feats include Hydraulic Current, Hydraulic Slam, Hydraulic Undertow, Mighty Push, Quenching Push, and Rushing Push! The plot hooks wrapped around hydraulic push include merfolk raiders, a geyser that uses hydraulic push, an eccentric artificer, and a gauntlet of death with a hydraulic push in its core!!

202691.description: The Deluxe Upgrade Pack adds four limited-edition characters & upgrades your pieces for Flag Dash. Shake up the board with the Pool Shark's break shot, retrieve the flag with the Writer's pet monkey, and more!
202691.name: Flag Dash: Deluxe Upgrade Pack

202692.name: The Game (1987)
202692.description: The modestly named The Game, billed as "The Superior Game of chance & skill" and "more exciting than backgammon", is played on a circular grid with numbered spaces. Players roll the dice and move pieces of their own as dictated by the results, trying to capture the pieces of other players. A player with no remaining pieces is out of the game, but until that happens, eliminated pieces can be brought back into the game by rolling doubles.

202693.name: The Polish Incursion
202693.description:
In 2017, the new American President is confronted with a crisis between Russia and Poland. Escalating tensions have led to a meeting of NATO leaders in Europe.

Several high-ranking American government officials are en route to the NATO conference aboard Air Force One when the crisis escalates. The player characters must deal with this crisis, and also their own inter-personal conflicts.

From the game scenario background.

202694.name: Viva La Revolucion
202694.description:
It's the 1980s in the small, Latin American nation of Parador. Parador is a poor, agricultural nation, and a longtime client of the United States. Presidente Felipe Guardado has recently died, and the power brokers in Parador have assembled to choose his successor.

The players represent these power brokers, assembled at a dinner in Presidente Guardado's honor. The players are jockeying for position in an uncertain political environment.

From the game materials.

202695.name: Kaiju Canal
202695.description:
User summary
アミダ魚雷 (Amida Gyorai) means "Ghost Leg Torpedo" in English.

Place your Battle Ship and Ghost Leg panels in a good combination to hit the Monster by your torpedo(s). The player who manages to ring the Fire bell and strike the Monster with their torpedo(es) receives the "gem" left by the Monster.

The player who gathers the highest number of gems wins.

Publisher's summary
自分の「戦艦パネル」と「アミダパネル」をうまく繋げて、「カイジュウ」に魚雷を当てましょう。
「発射ベル」を鳴らして見事に魚雷を当てることができたプレイヤーは、カイジュウが落としていった「宝石」がもらえます。

一番多く宝石を集めたプレイヤーがゲームに勝利します。

202696.name: En5ider (Issue 83 - Jun 2016)
rpgissuearticle: The Occultist: Freeing the Monster Within
202696.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our second full 5th Edition class (following the Alchemist) this month comes from designer Mike Myler, and it's an unusual one! The Occultist allows you to play a monster, with a choice of three distinct paths - an abomination, a vampire, or a werecreature! Delve into the dark and secret creatures of the night, cursed to exist as monstrous beings shunned by the world. Illustrated by Ellis Goodson. Yup, you heard right - a class designed to let you play a horrific monster of the night

202697.name: The Escalated Bard
202697.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compatible with the 13th Age Roleplaying Game. More than a minstrel! With The Escalated Bard, your character gets new talents, backgrounds, and uniques, plus the battle cries, songs, and spells you need to bring combat to a satisfying crescendo. With magic items to equip your bard and new abilities like Soothsayer, Rewrite History, and Don't Quit on Me!, you’ll be both a master of manipulation and a virtuoso of violence. Your bard won't be comic relief — you'll be a force to be reckoned with!

202698.description:
DOC models the initial alien of Earth set in Southern California in the mid-20th century. The mission of the alien player is, of course, to seize control of Earth. The defenders – a mixture of US Marines and US Army National Guard and other supporting units – is to defeat them and preserve Earth for Earthlings. The defenders organizations are based on period tables of organization and equipment and include the 1st Marine Regiment, Combat Command “A” of the 40th Armored Division, California Army National Guard, and the 153rd Regimental Combat Team, Arkansas Army National Guard as well as the unorganized militia of the United States. The Aliens consist of up to 9 powerful Alien Fighting Machines equipped with directed energy weapons and defensive shields.
